jobDescription:
Jongler avec les données vous enthousiasme? Votre rigueur et votre sens de l’organisation vous démarque ? 
Joignez-vous à notre équipe!
Chez Berger, ça fait maintenant 60 ans qu’on vient travailler le sourire aux lèvres. Pourquoi? Parce qu’on est fiers de développer et de commercialiser les meilleurs mélanges horticoles pour la culture de fleurs, de petits fruits, de produits maraîchers en serre et bien plus. Parce que chez Berger, on se sent chez-soi. Parce que Berger, c’est beaucoup plus qu’une entreprise: c’est une culture, c’est une équipe, c’est un milieu de vie stimulant et enrichissant!
 Vous voulez en faire partie? 
Ça tombe bien, nous sommes à la recherche d’un Analyste – Données maîtres pour compléter notre équipe ! Dans ce rôle, vous serez responsable du maintien des données maîtres dans les systèmes d’informations, un actif très important. Vous serez également amené à contribuer à l’élaboration des processus, à promouvoir les bonnes pratiques en matière de gestion des données maîtres et à faire évoluer la pratique au sein de l’organisation. Ce défi vous intéresse? Nous vous attendons dans notre équipe! En plus, vous aurez l’opportunité d’être en télétravail et/ou mode hybride selon votre situation géographique et vos préférences!
Aperçu Du Travail
 Agir à titre de personne ressource pour la mise à jour des données maîtres dans les systèmes d’information;  Soutenir et former les mandataires qui créent ou modifient les données maîtres;  Veiller à la sécurité, la qualité et l’intégrité des données saisies aux systèmes;  Développer et mettre à jour les outils de travail (instructions, formulaires, processus, etc.) relatifs à la gouvernance des données. 
Profil Recherché
 Vous détenez un DEC ou un BAC relié à la gestion des données, en administration ou toute autre expérience pertinente;  Vous avez de l’expérience et/ou de l’intérêt à travailler avec des outils de manipulation de données et d’interagir avec des systèmes d’informations reconnus tel que SAP;  Vous maîtrisez l’anglais, autant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit;  En plus d’être soucieux du niveau de sécurité des données, vous avez de l’intérêt à appliquer des standards de conformité ou à déceler des anomalies;  Vous êtes reconnu pour votre souci du détail, votre rigueur et votre sens de l’organisation. L’utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n’a aucune intention discriminatoire.Le salaire affiché ne correspond pas nécessairement à l'échelle salariale établie pour ce poste. Nous reconnaîtrons vos compétences et votre expérience à l'embauche en vous offrant une rémunération concurrentielle ainsi que plusieurs autres avantages.
Postuler maintenant
companyDescription:
Depuis 1963, Berger récolte et transforme une matière première aux propriétés uniques : la tourbe. Grâce à la qualité et la constance de nos produits, ainsi qu’à une expertise transmise de génération en génération, notre entreprise familiale s’est bâti une solide réputation dans l’industrie de l’horticulture.
Soucieux de travailler de façon responsable et toujours à la recherche de solutions innovantes, nos spécialistes s’assurent de répondre aux besoins spécifiques de tous nos clients.
_______
Since 1963, Berger has been harvesting and transforming a raw material with unique properties: peat. Thanks to the quality and consistency of our products, as well as an expertise passed down from generation to generation, our family business has built a solid reputation in the horticulture industry.
Concerned with working in a responsible manner and always looking for innovative solutions, our specialists make sure they meet the specific needs of all our clients.

jobDescription:
Company Description
Kenny U-Pull takes pride in giving used vehicles a second life. Our 25 auto recycling yards across Eastern Canada and USA are backed by 400+ employees, all passionate about the revalorization of used cars and the desire for a greener environment for future generations. Since 2008, we have recycled over 1 million vehicles and counting!
At Kenny, we do things differently by offering our customers the opportunity to create their own self-serve experience. Customers pick and pull replacement parts themselves for a fraction of the manufacturer's price, in a safe, clean, and environmentally responsible environment. 
Our engine runs on purpose, passion, and team spirit. We’re a close-knit and supportive company where your ambitions are also ours. Come ride with us - we promise it will be a rewarding journey.
Job Description
Schedule : Monday to Friday, Day shift
Office work only (no hybrid mode) 
Location : 3080 Boul. le Carrefour, Laval, QC H7T 2R5
As a Data Analyst, you will contribute to the development of tools and methods to collect, compile and model transactional data. You will be part of a team whose mandate is to support the development of the organization's business intelligence skills. These skills will then help decision makers in their decision making.
More Specifically, your role will be to:
Analyze and provide opinions based on existing information;Develop recommendations and implementation plans;Diagnose data related issues;Provide support to users and help them interpret the data; Develop new data-related knowledge;Design reports and dashboards to meet business needs;Work closely with various technology teams.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Supply Chain Management, Statistics, Mathematics or related field;A minimum of two years of relevant experience;Bilingualism (English, French, spoken and written mandatory);Strong interest in data analytics, data transformation and problem-solving;Experience in business intelligence and data management;Advanced Knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Pivot tables); Experience with cubes, data analysis tool, hypothesis testing, linear regression, qualitative and quantitative forecasting methods.Knowledge of Excel (Advanced), SQL, entity-relationship diagrams and dimensional data models;Facility with databases management;Knowledge of the operation and supply chain;Knowledge of visualization tools such as Cognos or Power BI (an asset);Knowledge of VBA, R, or Python (an asset)).
Additional Information
And by additional information, we mean perks! 
Competitive salary;3 weeks paid vacation upon being hired**; Comprehensive group insurance plan; Group RRSP (with employer matching contributions); Outstanding advancement opportunities; Exclusive employee discounts on parts from any Kenny yard; Company-wide events throughout the year (BBQ, Holiday party etc.);Uniform provided from day 1.
Kenny U-Pull is a subsidiary of American Iron & Metal (AIM) inc., a recognized global leader in the metal recycling industry with more than 125 site locations, 3500 employees worldwide and over 3.5 billion dollars in yearly sales. AIM and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to all. Only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Thank you for your interest.
 Vacation accrues bi-weekly and is pro-rated during any partial year of employment.
companyDescription:
KENNY U-PULL - a division of AIM - offers a brand-new concept in self-service retailing of used auto parts, a highly economical solution for all kinds of used car parts.
 
 We offer an endless supply of used auto parts at a fraction of the manufacturer's price. Through a strict process, we prioritize security on our sites. Customers can come and buy or sell their vehicles with peace of mind.
 
 Concerned about the environment, we offer a second life to used cars and we have an outstanding recycling process for our non-reusable parts.
 
 With branches in Quebec, Ontario and one in the United States, KENNY U-PULL has 24 branches and over 22,000 used cars for parts in inventory.
 
 Visit our website for online inventory of cars available for parts and price list of parts.

jobDescription:
Description de l'offre

Titre du poste : Analyste de Données - TI

Département : Technologie de l'information

Tu veux atteindre ton plein potentiel? Ça avance au GROUPE ALDO.

NOUS SUIVONS UN PARCOURS POUR CRÉER UN MONDE OÙ RÈGNENT L’AMOUR, LA CONFIANCE ET L’INCLUSION.

Le Groupe ALDO a entamé ce parcours il y a plus de 40 ans. Nos associés passionnés sont au cœur de notre succès et c’est avec eux que nous avancerons avec bienveillance vers l’avenir.

Au Groupe ALDO nous nous engageons en faveur de la diversité et de l’inclusion, et ce, non seulement maintenant, mais aussi à long terme. Nous encourageons fortement les personnes autochtones, racisées, handicapées, issues de communautés diversifiées sur le plan du genre et du sexe et/ou ayant des identités intersectionnelles à postuler un emploi chez nous. Au Groupe ALDO, nous efforcerons toujours de prendre des mesures afin de créer un environnement de travail diversifié et inclusif mettant de l’avant égalité des chances et imputabilité. #NousSommesALDO

AVANTAGES DES ASSOCIÉS DU GROUPE ALDO
Programmes de reconnaissance pour mettre en valeur ton talent! Faire partie d’une entreprise qui prend position sur des enjeux touchant les gens, l’environnement et nos partenaires Vendredis d’été (car l’été c’est fait pour s’amuser!) Rabais sur les achats vendus dans toutes nos marques Événements « Famille et amis » offrant des rabais sur nos produits Cafétéria et garderie subventionnées Transport public subventionné, réseau de covoiturage et stationnement gratuit Gymnase sur notre campus avec possibilité d’accès à un entraîneur  Horaires flexibles et possibilité de télétravail. Journées de maladie Rémunération globale attrayante! 

VOTRE RÔLE

Nous recherchons un analyste de données hautement qualifié pour rejoindre notre équipe. Le candidat retenu aura une forte mentalité de produit en matière de données et d'analyse, et sera responsable de la création de tableaux de bord et de rapports, de l'analyse des données et de la visualisation des informations. Il travaillera en étroite collaboration avec les scientifiques des données, les propriétaires de produits, les gestionnaires de produits et les ingénieurs en analyse pour développer et tester des hypothèses, créer et gérer des ensembles de données, et fournir des informations qui orientent les décisions d'affaires. Le candidat idéal aura de l'expérience dans l'approche Agile et sera compétent en matière de narration avec les données.

Responsabilités principales:
Collaborer avec les scientifiques des données, les propriétaires de produits, les gestionnaires de produits et les ingénieurs en analyse pour développer et tester des hypothèses et fournir des informations qui orientent les décisions d'affaires.Créer et gérer des ensembles de données pour soutenir l'analyse et les rapports.Effectuer des analyses de données pour identifier les tendances, les modèles et les informations qui orientent les décisions d'affaires.Créer des tableaux de bord et des rapports visuellement convaincants et efficaces pour communiquer les informations qui sont guidées par les données.Appliquer des techniques de narration pour communiquer des informations complexes à des publics techniques et non techniques.Travailler dans une approche Agile pour fournir un travail de haute qualité dans un environnement rapide.

AVEZ-VOUS LE PROFIL QUE NOUS RECHERCHONS?
Baccalauréat dans un domaine connexe (par exemple, informatique, statistiques, économie)3 ans d'expérience en analyse et visualisation de donnéesForte mentalité de produit en matière de données et d'analyseExpérience dans la création de tableaux de bord et de rapports avec des outils tels que AWS QuickSightCompétences avancées en Python et en SQLSolides compétences analytiques et de résolution de problèmesExpérience dans la création et le test d'hypothèsesSolides compétences en communication et en narrationCapacité à travailler en collaboration avec des équipes interfonctionnellesExpérience de travail dans une approche Agile

Si vous êtes passionné par l'analyse de données, la visualisation de données et l'orientation des décisions d'affaires avec des données, nous vous encourageons à postuler pour cette opportunité excitante.

N’attendez plus pour postuler. Au GROUPE ALDO Ça avance!

VOUS AIMERIEZ EN SAVOIR PLUS SUR NOUS? VOICI QUELQUES FAITS AMUSANTS.

Présent dans plus de 100 pays, le Groupe ALDO s’est imposé à l’aide de marques fortes : ALDO/ALDO Accessoires, Boutique Spring et Globo. Guidée chaque jour par sa raison d’être « un parcours pour créer un monde où règnent amour, confiance et inclusion », l’organisation est tout simplement unique. Ce qui rend notre culture si incomparable, c’est la passion de nos gens pour l’innovation, l’excellence, le savoir-faire, l’entrepreneuriat et la diversité, en plus de leur empathie et bonté. De plus, nos associés ont tous une curiosité insatiable!
companyDescription:
Founded in 1972, the ALDO Group is one of the world’s leading fashion retailers. We specialize in the design and production of quality, stylish and accessible footwear and accessories.

From our global head office based in Montreal, we operate a network of over 1,500 stores worldwide under our three signature banners: ALDO, Call It Spring and GLOBO. 

Guided by a strong set of values and aiming to influence society in both fashion and social responsibility, our purpose is to create a world of love, confidence, and belonging.

We are advocates for diversity and inclusion, and for the environment. In 2018, we were the first fashion footwear and accessories company in the world to be certified climate neutral and we carry forward our sustainability journey.

jobDescription:
Our culture lifts you up—there is no ego in the way. Our common purpose? We all want to win for our customers. We aim to always be evolving, dynamic, and ambitious. We believe in the power of genuine connections. Each employee is a part of what makes us unique on the market: agile and dedicated.

Time Type


Intern (Fixed Term) (Trainee)

Job Description


Internship position

Position Summary


In accordance with established policies, procedures and service principles, the successful candidate will be responsible to analyze, interpret and provide insights on the performance of our product line. In addition the analyst will support the product streams and the PMO with analysis on process improvement and new product introduction initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Develop meaningful insights from various data sets and communicate those insights with recommendationsWork with various stakeholders to document dashboard and reporting requirements Maintain documentation on all developed dashboards and reportsStudies data for inconsistencies or potential errors and collaborates in resolutionsCreates hypotheses to situations posed by senior leadership, and performs analysis to support them. Ensure that project success metrics are established.Have fun!
Essential Qualifications


ACADEMIC TRAINING
Currently enrolled in 2nd or higher year of an undergraduate program in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics
Experience

Experience in combination of analytics, and data science beneficial
SPECIFIC COMPETENCIESExposure to:cloud fundamentalsJiraFamiliarity withBI tools (eg. Tableau, DataStudio/LookerStudio)Google Analytics 4SQL Language (preferably BigQuery)Ability to recognize and identify data inconsistenciesAbility to recommend decisions based on evidence, and support recommendations Self motivated with the ability to take initiative in identifying and resolving problems independentlyMonitors own work for quality.Ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and change to new methods of working as systems evolve
In Our Program, You’ll Benefit From


"Join our dynamic team for a thrilling internship experience. As a valued member of our organization, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, develop new skills, and network with industry leaders. This is a rare chance to gain hands-on experience, apply your knowledge, and grow professionally in a supportive and inclusive environment.
Flexibility: We understand and support the importance you place on your studies. From home, to the office.Networking: Your colleagues across business units will help you sharpen your skills and competencies and help you build the network of your future career;Mentoring: Coaching and meetings with management teams are planned to allow you to evolve in our corporate culture.
 Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to jumpstart your career - Apply now!"

Location :

Burlington, ON

Company


Cogeco Connexion Inc

At Cogeco, we know that different backgrounds, perspectives, and beliefs can bring critical value to our business. The strength of this diversity enhances our ability to imagine, innovate, and grow as a company. So, we are committed to doing everything in our power to create a more diverse and inclusive world of belonging.

By creating a culture where all our colleagues can bring their best selves to work, we’re doing our part to build a more equitable workplace and world. From professional development to personal safety, Cogeco constantly strives to create an environment that welcomes and nurtures all. We make the health and well-being of our colleagues one of our highest priorities, for we know engaged and appreciated employees equate to a better overall experience for our customers.

If you need any accommodations to apply or as part of the recruitment process, please contact us confidentially at inclusiondiversite@cogeco.com
companyDescription:
Cogeco delivers 100% local support on a fibre-powered network. For more than 65 years, Cogeco has been in smaller cities across Ontario and Quebec—and that’s true for our employees too. We live in the communities we serve, and customer satisfaction is our priority. Thanks to our powerful network, our residential and business customers can get Internet with speeds of up to 1 Gbps, TV with all their favourite content in one place, and reliable home phone service.

#Cogecommunity

jobDescription:
We're looking for an Analytics Solutions Engineer (Business Intelligence Analyst) for our Analytics and Data Lifecycle Services (ADLS) department.

In this role, you will be responsible for developing analytics solutions (e.g. dashboards, reports, conditional emails) and conducting analyses on a wide variety of issues (e.g., occupational health and safety, financial risk exposure, and disability management) using various sources of business data and communicating findings and related interpretations/observations with primarily, but not exclusively, an internal audience.

Join our analytics delivery team that has been quoted by a senior Microsoft analytics consultant as "leading the Canadian public sector in our maturity of analytics".

At this time, this is a hybrid position where you will work primarily at home and be on-site at our Richmond office occasionally.

As An Analytics Solutions Engineer, You Will
Develop analytics solutions such as reports, dashboards, analytics apps and conduct analyses on a wide variety of issues (e.g. occupational health and safety, financial risk exposure, disability management)Capture, analyze, and document detailed requirements from our internal customers in order to design, develop, and support new and currently offered high quality business intelligence reporting solutions, both from strategic and operational perspectivesCollaborate with Data Engineers, Sr Analytics Solutions Engineers, Sr Analytics Specialists, Data Scientists, and Analytics Delivery Managers to collectively deliver the best value for the opportunityWork in a fast-paced Agile-style delivery environmentWe're looking for someone who can:
Design and develop solutions that will promote usability, standardization, and self-serve opportunitiesEnsure that the client's changing solution requirements are fulfilled in a timely manner and translated into workable solutionsTurn data into information and information into actionable intelligence that drives an improved decisionStay abreast of emerging technologies that utilize analytics principlesConduct data discovery, with minimal documentation, and navigate large complex data models to find what the customer is looking forWrite SQL as second nature and have used BI/analytics solution software (e.g. Power BI)Your experience and educational background:
A Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or BusinessA minimum of 18 months of directly related experience working in an analytics delivery capacity.Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbalOther combinations of education and experience may be consideredApplication Requirements:

You will be required to successfully meet WorkSafeBC's requirements with regards to a criminal record clearance.

If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) at the time you submit your application.

Who are we?

At WorkSafeBC, we're dedicated to promoting safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation, and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We also work diligently to sustain our workers compensation system for today and future generations. We're honoured to serve the 2.4 million workers and 245,000 registered employers in our province.

WorkSafeBC's COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the "Policy") is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect.

We recognize that our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences, and which reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

What's it like to work at WorkSafeBC?

It's challenging, stimulating and hugely rewarding. Our positions offer tremendous diversity and excellent opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important and so are the people we do it for.

Our Benefits

Being part of WorkSafeBC means being part of a strong, committed team. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes vacation, optional leave arrangements, health care and dental benefits, and contributions toward your retirement pension. As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that can help you get the most out of work — and life.

WorkSafeBC has adopted a hybrid model offering opportunities to work remotely and onsite based on the operational needs of the position.

Learn More About What We Offer .
companyDescription:

When work-related injuries or diseases occur, we provide compensation, and we support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. 

We also work diligently to sustain our workers compensation system for today and future generations. We’re honoured to serve the almost 2.3 million workers and 210,000 employers in our province.

jobTitle: Senior People Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Get To Know Our Team
The People Team is a purveyor of opportunity, searching the globe for the most talented individuals and offering them an open, collaborative workplace. By prioritizing skill and potential, we have cultivated a powerful assembly of professionals through our drive for equal opportunity and diversity. We make the move to Agoda a breeze with assisted onboarding programs, and we continue to support and enrich our thousands of Agoda employees through individual growth with outstanding learning programs and various means of assistance. Our development of incredible benefits has ensured everyone can stay strong, healthy, and happy during their time at Agoda. Leading ambitious changes and making a positive impact in the lives of our employees, the People Team is a crucial and rewarding part of the Agoda family.
The Opportunity
The Senior People Data Analyst will contribute to the People Planning & Analytics organizations’ success by providing pro-active analysis around People data, working with People Team and other Business stakeholders to identify patterns and provide actionable recommendations. As part of the organization, you’ll be working actively on budgeting activities and process and progressive improvement of the tools and processes of the team. This role collaborates closely with Finance and People team stakeholders to ensure activities are aligned with Agoda’s strategic goals and Personnel budget. The rapid growth of the business and the increasing complexity driven by new launches and services make this an exciting, and challenging proposition.
In this Role you’ll get, 
 Add immediate value to the organization by delivering insightful analysis, dashboards and presentations to business & leadership about People data (recruitment, attrition, performance) to support long-term strategic decision making  Get involved in the operational Budgeting and Workforce planning of the company  Provide financial analysis & commentary on month-end financials & KPIs/OKRs Be a trusted advisor to Business Partners across the organizationEnhance the understanding and key levers of the Agoda business 
What You’ll Need To Succeed
 Bachelor’s degree required  3-5 years of experience as Data analyst, preferably in an HR environment  2-3 years of practical experience with MSSQL (or equivalent database), Tableau visualization  High level of discretion, confidentiality and ethics  Ability to work well with employees in a highly multi-cultural environment  Strong attention to detail and accuracy  Self-starter with ability to work independently, while also collaborating with cross-functional teams  Ownership mindset and ability to meet tight deadlines with a logical, methodical approach to prioritizing tasks and responsibilities 
Great if you have
 Experience with OneStream software  Workforce planning and Budgeting experience  Commercial awareness, ability to think both analytically and strategically, to identify about underlying business issues Willingness to challenge the status quo and propose improvements in existing processesCuriosity and willingness to get involved in the business to understand the story behind the numbers companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

jobTitle: Senior Data Analyst, Partner Development – (Statistics/ML/BI) (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Get to know our team:
Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.
In this role you’ll get to
This role is designed to mainly growth opportunity identification among mid to long tail hotels, experiment execution and data tracking within Partner Development team for the global teams. You will get to work directly with the regional team to design and put in place global experimentation and initiatives to drive tangible impact in each market.
Key activities involved include but not limit to:
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to identify opportunities for business improvements and support your recommendationsOwn end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner DevelopmentBuild dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team’s performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvementsWork closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identifiedSupport global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization
What You’ll Need To Succeed
Bachelor’s degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline4-8 years experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy roleExcellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using dataTeam player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skillsCoding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choiceAbility to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environmentExcellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with jobDescription:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
Are you looking for an entry-level role in the software industry that will give you the skills and exposure to move into any speciality later? We’re looking for curious individuals who love searching for meaningful answers.
In this role, you’ll be given a business problem and will scour the internet for possible solutions. The problems will come from every area of our business: operations, finance, hiring, engineering, and more - giving you broad exposure.
Not only will you gain knowledge, you’ll receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals.
Jumpstart your career with us today!
What You Will Be Doing
Research a variety of high-priority topics that are critical to the businessEvaluate results against provided evaluation criteria
What You Won’t Be Doing
Researching the same topics repeatedlyWorking on loosely-scoped research with desired outputs not clearly definedGetting lost chasing tangentially-related solutions; our systems and processes will help you focus your research and optimize your time
Data Research Analyst Key Responsibilities
Provide high-quality research data to support company-wide business decisions
Basic Requirements
Excellent written and verbal communication skillsBasic financial analysis skillsAbility to work in the US timezone
About Trilogy
Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
Working with Crossover
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
What to expect next:
You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. Crossover Job Code: LJ-4718-CA-Ontario-DataResearchAn.009

jobTitle: Senior BI Analyst (Supply Analytics) (Bangkok-based role, Relocation provided)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Get to Know our Team:
The Supply Analytics team is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s non-accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.
The Opportunity: 
The role sits within the Supply Analytics team under Central Supply Team, where new business ideas, and partnership types are incubated and scaled. We are looking for a Senior BI Analyst whose main focus areas are providing visibility and insights for people-related issues through Business Intelligence tools like Tableau and SQL, managing data warehouses, building ETL processes, and helping build other tools to optimize the business. This role will be involved in strategic projects and work closely with commercial owners and business stakeholders, using data to identify and translate business needs and opportunities into actionable initiatives.
In this Role, you’ll get to:
Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‘right questions’, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholdersProactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider businessDrive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supplyIdentify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligenceAutomate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations
What you’ll Need to Succeed:
4+ years of experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategyBachelor’s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)3+ years of experience with BI & analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Metabase, Data Studio, or similar technologies)2+ years of solid project managementGood stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suiteStrong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the businessA hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototypingExcellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skillsData driven in both decision making and performance measurementExtreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environmentAbility to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources
It’s Great if you Have: 
Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experienceExperience in conducting A/B testing experimentation (a plus)A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning jobDescription:
Build Your Career at Aecon 
Aecon is proud to build some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of this generation. From the roads and transit systems that connect our communities, to the communication networks that link us from coast-to-coast, and the water infrastructure that supplies our businesses and homes. Our integral work includes constructing the pipelines that join provinces with the energy that fuels the nation, and the airports and ports that connect us all. Aecon is there, safely and sustainably building the future.
We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity , expertise and teamwork of our employees. We are always searching the globe for exceptional candidates to join the Aecon family and be a part of our forward-thinking, innovative, best-in-class organization!
What is the Opportunity? 
Faster. Smarter. Safer.This is how Aecon Utilities is committed to delivering projects. We simply do it better. Aecon Utilities is ready to become Canada’s #1 utility construction provider and we're looking for a Data Analyst to help us get there!
Reporting to the Senior Analyst, the Data Analyst will be a key member of the project team working on the development and implementation of the Aecon Utilities digital footprint. Post-implementation, the focus of this role will shift to the development and maintenance of all in field data collection, dashboards, KPI's and predictive analytics in support of improving operational efficiency, utilization, and productivity. The ideal candidate will have a combination of technical and analytical capability, as well as experience and knowledge in construction operations.
What You'll Do Here
 Act as a key member of the project team; accountable for the development, setup, and implementation of a Telematics system and digital solutions across several Aecon divisions.  Accountable for the design, development and ongoing monitoring of KPIs, productivity reports, dashboards and predictive analytics to improve operational efficiency and productivity.  “Makes sense of the data” in a way that can be read, understood, and actioned by Operations teams.  Conduct detailed analysis of data to identify anomalies and patterns and make recommendations for outcomes.  Utilizes data to anticipate gaps, identify unknowns and develop solutions.  Maintain the quality, accuracy and consistency of our system configuration and data.  Responsible for the creation, maintenance, review and improvement of processes and training documentation  Work collaboratively with the Operations and Fleet to understand business requirements and develop best practices and processes.  Participate in the planning and implementation of future system enhancements.  Provide practical assistance and technical support to operations, as necessary. 
What You Bring To The Team
 Post-secondary education coupled with a minimum of 3-5 years of related work experience.  Demonstrable and substantial skills with SQL and Python.  Experience with machine learning and AI is an asset.  Strong computer skills – MS Office, SAP and Power BI Applications  Excellent ability to translate business requirements into practical solutions.  Research, analytical, and problem-solving skills  Strong oral, written and interpersonal skills.  Experience with Telematics / Fleet Management systems is an asset.  Experience developing dashboards, KPIs and analytics in support of business operational excellence.  Ability to foster a cooperative environment between different operational groups and functions.  Ability to see a task from conception to implementation with accuratacy.  Willingness to travel as required. 
Aecon fosters diversity , inclusion and belonging within and across our organization. We welcome all to apply including, women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.
We are committed to adhering to the objectives and requirements outlined in the Accessible Canada Act (ACA), and to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in a timely manner, through the implementation of the requirements of the ACA and its applicable regulations. If you require accommodation under the ACA Act during any step of the application process please click here.
companyDescription: As a Canadian leader in construction and infrastructure development with global expertise, Aecon Group Inc. (TSX: ARE) strives to be the number one Canadian infrastructure company. Aecon safely, profitably and sustainably delivers integrated solutions to private and public-sector clients through its Construction segment in the Civil, Urban Transportation, Nuclear, Utility and Industrial sectors, and provides project development, financing, investment and management services through its Concessions segment. Join our online community on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram @AeconGroup.

What You Won’t Be Doing
Researching the same topics repeatedlyWorking on loosely-scoped research with desired outputs not clearly definedGetting lost chasing tangentially-related solutions; our systems and processes will help you focus your research and optimize your time
Data Analyst Key Responsibilities
Provide high-quality research data to support company-wide business decisions
Basic Requirements
Excellent written and verbal communication skillsBasic financial analysis skillsAbility to work in the US timezone
About Trilogy
Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
Working with Crossover
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
What to expect next:
You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. jobDescription:
Who We Are

We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.

CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation. Learn about our Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy and the work being done to create a more inclusive and welcoming organization by focusing on how we learn, govern and practise.

At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Benefits Pension)Retirement Planning ProgramGenerous vacation days for permanent and long-term contractsWork-life balanceCareer Planning ProgramLearning and Professional Development ProgramFlexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts
Why is this role important?

The Data Analyst works as part of our analytic team to compile, verify and analyze data for indicators, and disseminate results to diverse audiences. The data analyst also helps define what the indicators will measure, contributes to analytical plans and literature reviews, supports migration and streamlines existing programming code, and helps with client requests.

Note: This posting may be used to fill similar positions in the Health System Performance Branch. Departments within the Health System Performance branch include, Indicator Research and Development, Performance Improvement and Capacity-Building, Health Indicators and Client Support, Health System Performance Reporting, and Virtual Care Initiative.

The Indicator Research and Development team develops indicators on many aspects of health system performance to promote quality improvement across Canada. This includes work that supports the Common Statement of Principles on Shared Health Priorities, which focuses on improving access to mental health and substance use services, and to home and community care.

This is an opportunity to join a motivated, collaborative and high performing team that fosters and prioritizes mentorship, growth and development of its members.

What You'll Do
 Does basic and advanced qualitative and quantitative analyses on data from administrative databases and other sources (e.g., surveys). Supports the development of coding best practices and migration of existing analytic code to python language. Identifies data sources for health system indicators, helps determine how indicators will be calculated and provides advice on data quality. Understands CIHI’s databases, related data held by other organizations, and how to access these databases and related analyses. Prepares presentations, technical documents and reports that will help stakeholders understand and use health system data, indicators and information to improve the performance of Canada’s health systems. This includes planning meetings with stakeholders. Writes analytical reports, briefing notes, fact sheets and presentations. Develops figures and tables. Provides methodological advice and mentoring to other members of the analytical team.
What You'll Bring To The Table
 An undergraduate degree in epidemiology, statistics, health services research or similar fields. A graduate degree would be an asset. 3 – 5 years of experience analyzing large and complex data sets (of both administrative and survey data) and writing reports on the results. Specific experience with data on mental health and on home and community care would be an asset. Extensive knowledge of programming languages required; experience with R or Python would be an asset. Strong communication and writing skills. Specifically, the ability to write for a variety of audiences clearly and in an engaging way, as well as the ability to effectively communicate technical and analytical information. Strong organizational skills. Able to manage projects, including multiple projects at once. Able to work on a team and alone, and with minimal supervision. Strong critical-thinking skills. Able to analyze and combine data and information to produce insights and knowledge that stakeholders can put into action. Fluency in English required; fluency in French would be an asset.
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.

We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.

At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Please note the CIHI Recruiting Team uses email to communicate with applicants. Please make sure your profile has an updated email address that is checked regularly, including the junk/spam mail folder, as we send time sensitive emails (i.e. testing and interview bookings).

jobDescription:
Location: Toronto-661 University

Department

The Role:

We are always looking for talented Health Analysts to fill our contract positions. If you are interested in being considered for future opportunities we encourage you to apply now!

The Health Analyst will provide a range of data collection, collation and analyses to support the data needs of the team, department, PHO and stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities-
Maintains electronic access to data holdings, information systems and appropriate interfaces to ensure an organized and clean file structure of the PHO’s large datasets.Writes and executes computer programs for data extraction, data set creation and analysis using spreadsheets and statistical software packages (e.g., Excel, SAS).Conducts the routine analysis of large data sets for the interpretation and production of basic population health assessment and surveillance reports.Analyzes, interprets and reports health data using appropriate methods in response to inquiries from within PHO and external stakeholders.Prepares and disseminates health status and surveillance information in various formats including reports, charts, graphs and maps.Provides support during outbreak investigations, including database development, data management, data quality and regular reporting, as needed.Supports Department’s data quality assurance efforts through the application of proven analytical approaches to identify errors or limitations in the data and to improve data validity.Maintains contact with database and analysis experts within the broader public health system to keep up to date in the area of data quality, data management and analysis and related technologies.Works with the epidemiologists and others on the team to assist in developing data set creation plans and analysis plans which require access to different public health data holdings.Completes program and project documentation according to applicable standards and guidelines.Contributes to the ongoing development of standard operation procedures for data set creation, analysis and reporting.Contributes to the identification of optimum methods for analysis and assists in the interpretation of data.Performs other related duties as assigned.
Knowledge and Skills-
Skilled in the use of data sets, spreadsheets and databases using software such as Excel, Cognos ReportNet (CRN) and SAS.Familiarity with public health information systems such as the Integrated Public Health Information System (iPHIS) and ability to work with large data sets and utilize a range of information systems.Knowledge of population health indicators, epidemiological concepts, public health research, statistical analysis, health analytic methods, and techniques to analyze data, including trend analysis, and ability to work with content experts to define their data needs would be an asset.Knowledge of stakeholder groups, ability to build public health, research, academic, institutional, and professional networks; and working at the local, provincial/territorial, and/or federal levels would be an asset.Knowledge of, and skills in effective time management methods and techniques to plan, develop data set creation and analysis plans for projects.Knowledge of current public health issues related to enteric, zoonotic and vector-borne diseases.
Education And Experience-
Bachelor’s degree in health sciences, biostatistics or equivalent combination of education and related experience.Knowledge of database design, health analytics, and public health methods and data analysis techniques with approximately 2 years of experience in the collection, collation, analysis and interpretation of health data.
Attributes and Competencies-
Effective oral communication to discuss detailed data and analytic needs in response to enquiries regarding health data and related information systems from management and staff across the PHO.Written communication skills to respond to data requests and prepare summary statistical analyses based on data findings.Ability to work within the parameters of existing protocols for data manipulation, analysis, storage and privacy protection.Proficiency in determining the appropriate syntax within statistical program (i.e. SAS) necessary to develop and undertake queries and problem solve or troubleshoot when syntax or software is not performing.Identifies which of the range of available data sets are best used to access and manipulate in order to meet data needs.Interpretation information needs into analytical procedures.
Duration: Contract (Fixed Term), 0 month(s)

jobDescription:
LifeLabs is the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada, serving the healthcare needs of Canadians for over 50 years. Our team members are truly centred around our customers, and we know that behind every lab requisition, sample being tested, or investment in technology is an individual and their family counting on us.

Consistently named one of Canada's Best Employers by Forbes, LifeLabs has also been recognized for having an award-winning Mental Health Program from Benefits Canada. The passion and commitment of over 6,000 diverse and innovative team members unites and motivates us to ensure our customers receive high quality tests and results that they can trust. Agile, customer-centred, caring and teamwork: we live these values every day in what we do to support our customers and healthcare providers, driving forward our vision of empowering a healthier you .

Make a difference – join the LifeLabs team today!

Reports to: Director, Data Management

Purpose of the Role This role is pivotal to the building and operationalizing of the data necessary for enterprise data and analytics initiatives. The focus of the work will be working with cross-functional teams to analyze, model and interpret data to build models, reports and dashboards that create analytical insights. This role will work collaboratively with business stakeholders to translate business requirements into actionable data insights while also helping identify feasibility and value. This role will be an advocate for data literacy with both the direct team and LifeLabs overall. This role will analyze and interpret data, have a demonstrated ability to use visualization tools such as PowerBI and have a passion for investigating information to provide deeper insights. As this role will collaborate with many different groups, strong communication and relationship management skills are needed.

Core Accountabilities
 Creating value from business-driven data and analytics initiatives  Supporting the business and other stakeholders in their data driven objectives. This means supporting through the various phases, identification of the right use cases and support prioritization based on feasibility and value  In the ideation phase, help with the development of a minimum viable product. During implementation phase, make sure the product or service is adopted and measured for impact  Ensure that proposed models follow data architecture guidelines and best practices. Creation of tabular and multi-dimensional models that are compatible with data warehousing standards  Demonstrate analytical thinking for translating data and business needs into data visualizations  Ensure that data security is maintained within datasets by enforcing security standards such as row level security  Proactively monitor industry, functional and technology trends to guide business partners on emerging opportunities  Provide consultive support and advice on technology and visualization techniques to business partners to elevate the organization capabilities in using tools such as PowerBI  Participate in ensuring compliance and governance during data use. Working in collaboration with the Data Governance Analyst(s) and data stewards to ensure that policies are adhered to  Provide information about data lineage and governance from various data sources. Provide input to Data Governance Analyst(s) for Data Quality monitoring  Actively promote the available data and analytics capabilities to business leaders with the help of the Data Management team  Apply design thinking and an agile mindset in working with other engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders and organizational leaders to identify opportunities for process improvements  Establish and lead the Center of Excellence to foster a strong community of practice 
Minimum Qualification And Skills
 Degree or diploma in data science, computer science, or equivalent experience  Minimum 3 years' experience in a comparable role  Experience with any/most of: Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, Azure Analysis Services and Azure Data Lake, PowerBI  Understanding of various data types and associated lifecycles (e.g. master data, reference data, transactional data, etc.)  Has good judgement, a sense of urgency and commitment to learning  Excellent written/verbal communication, analytical, organizational and interpersonal skills 
#LI SW1 #INDEED

At LifeLabs, we strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where our team members and the communities we serve feel accepted, valued, and respected.

In accordance with LifeLabs’ Accessibility Policy , the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. For a confidential inquiry or to request an accommodation, please contact your recruiter or email careers@lifelabs.com .

LifeLabs is committed to providing a safe environment for our employees, customers, and the communities we serve. We have been a leader throughout the COVID-19 pandemic regarding health and safety measures and have always put our employees and customers at the center of every decision that we make. As an organization in the health care sector, we believe the COVID vaccination adds a layer of protection that complements the extensive and necessary health and safety protocols that we have taken to date. With this in mind, we currently require all LifeLabs employees, contractors, students and volunteers to be fully vaccinated.

companyDescription: LifeLabs has operated in Canada for nearly 50 years. It is a leading provider of laboratory testing and management services, contributing to the treatment and prevention of disease by enabling healthcare providers to operate more efficiently and effectively. Following the acquisition of BC Biomedical on April 2, 2013 and CML Healthcare on October 1st, 2013, LifeLabs nearly doubled in size, now providing more than 100 million diagnostic tests for approximately 19 million patients visits annually. Information from these tests plays a vital role in predicting, diagnosing, treating and monitoring disease. LifeLabs operates the largest community medical laboratory network in Canada, together with our hospital and healthcare partners. LifeLabs also partners with healthcare providers to transform and manage laboratory organizations to better meet the complex healthcare challenges of today and tomorrow.

jobDescription:
*English will follow*
Description de l’entreprise:L’ASEQ|Studentcare est le principal fournisseur de soins de santé et dentaires pour les étudiants au Canada, avec plus de 1 million de membres chez plus de 100 partenaires postsecondaires.
Description du poste:Nous sommes à la recherche d’un analyste de données très motivé et soucieux du détail pour rejoindre notre équipe. Le candidat retenu aura de l’expérience dans l’utilisation de Microsoft SQL Server et la création des packages DTS, ainsi que de solides compétences en codage SQL.
L’analyste de données joue un rôle crucial dans la prise en charge des opérations commerciales en concevant et en mettant en œuvre des procédures d’extraction, de transformation et de chargement de données (ETL) à l’aide d’outils tels que DTS (SSIS à l’avenir) ou d’autres outils ETL. Il est qualifié pour décomposer des ensembles de données complexes, vérifier l’intégrité des données par l’analyse et créer des rapports pour les parties prenantes a l'internes et l'externe. De plus, l’analyste de données doit avoir une expertise en modélisation de données et être capable de documenter les processus, ainsi que d’avoir de l’expérience en tant que développeur SQL. Il peut également avoir besoin d’interagir avec les clients et les fournisseurs pour planifier, exécuter ou résoudre les problèmes de transfert ou d’intégrité des données en utilisant les meilleures pratiques de rapprochement et de validation des données.
Tâches et responsabilités : Les tâches principales incluent, mais sans limiter:Planifier et exécuter des procédures ETL, des routines d’analyse et des rapports à l’aide de Microsoft SQL Server Enterprise Manager.  - Importer et traiter les données des clients, y compris la validation préliminaire et les analyses post- importation Signaler et résoudre (ou escalader) tous les conflits de données et/ou erreurs - Extraire et exporter les données vers les clients.Concevoir et construire des processus ETL pour les nouveaux clients : Rassembler les exigences et modéliser l’architecture de la solution ETL ; Travailler avec les équipes de développement au besoin pour exécuter la conception et la mise en œuvre. Soutien financier : aider les équipes financières à interpréter les rapports en fonction des données ingérées / transformées. Maintenir et améliorer les structures de données : Mettre à jour les processus à mesure que les exigences changent, optimiser les lacunes existantes dans les analyses de données et améliorer la méthodologie en utilisant des techniques modernes de modélisation des données telles que la modélisation dimensionnelle et la normalisation.Préparer des rapports ad-hoc à la demande des parties prenantes internes.Manipuler des données ad-hoc avec Excel ou des scripts pour aider d’autres équipes à répondre à leurs besoins en données.
Compétences et qualités recherchées :Expérience dans l’analyse de données, la manipulation de données, l’architecture de données, le support de base de données (junior) et l’optimisation des requêtes SQLExpertise dans les principes de modélisation des données pour des améliorations continuesÊtre capable de documenter les processus de données à l’aide de ConfluenceBonnes compétences en résolution de problèmesCapacité d'analyser et optimiser les structures de données pour une interrogation et un stockage de données efficacesFamiliarité avec les outils de visualisation de données tels que Tableau ou Power BICompétences efficaces en communication
Exigences:DEC en technologie de l’information ou équivalent.Excellente connaissance et expérience de Transact-SQL ou d’un autre langage SQLConnaissance du serveur MS SQL (2014 / 2016 / 2019) et de la pile MicrosoftExpérience avec DTS (SQL 2000) et/ou SSIS (SQL 2014 +)Bonne connaissance des langues Français et anglaise, tant à l’écrit qu’à l’oral: OBLIGATOIRE
Conditions de travail : Temps plein, permanent
Le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

Company Description:ASEQ/STUDENTCARE is the leading provider of student health and dental care in Canada, serving over 1 Million members at more than 100 post-secondary partners
Job Description:We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will have experience using Microsoft SQL Server and creating DTS packages, as well as strong SQL coding skills. The Data Analyst plays a crucial role in supporting business operations by designing and implementing data extraction, transformation, and loading procedures (ETL) using tools such as DTS, (SSIS in the future), or other ETL tools. They are skilled at breaking down complex data sets, verifying data integrity through analysis, and creating reports for internal and external stakeholders. Additionally, the Data Analyst should have expertise in data modeling and be able to document processes, as well as have experience as a SQL developer. They may also need to interact with clients and suppliers to plan, execute, or resolve data transfer or integrity issues using reconciliation and data validation best practices.
Key duties and responsibilities: The key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Plan and execute ETL procedures, analysis routines, and reporting using Microsoft SQL Server Enterprise Manager.  - Import and process data from clients, including preliminary validation, and post-import analyses Report on and resolve (or escalate) all data conflicts and/or errors - Extract and export data to clients.Design and build ETL processes for new clients: Gather requirements and model ETL solution architecture; work with development teams as required to execute on design and implementation. Finance Support: Help finance teams interpret reports based on ingested / transformed data. Maintain and improve data structures: Update processes as requirements change, optimize existing gaps in data analyses and improve on methodology by using modern data modelling techniques such as dimensional modeling and normalization.Prepare ad-hoc reports as requested by internal stakeholders.Manipulate ad-hoc data with Excel or scripts to assist other teams with data needs.
Skills and Qualities Sought :Experience in data analysis, data manipulation, data architecture, database support (junior) and SQL query optimizationExpertise in data modelling principles for continuous enhancementsBe able to document data processes using ConfluenceStrong problem solving skillsAbility to analyze and optimize data structures for efficient querying and data storageGood to have: Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BIEffective communication skills Requirements:DEC in Information technology or equivalent.Excellent knowledge of, and experience with, Transact-SQL or other SQL languageKnowledge of MS SQL server (2014 / 2016 / 2019) and the Microsoft stackExperience with DTS (SQL 2000) and/or SSIS (SQL 2014 +)Good knowledge of French and English languages, both written and spoken: MANDATORY Work Conditions: Full-time, permanent
companyDescription:
ASEQ | Studentcare

Le nom ASEQ est utilisé pour nos communications en français et Studentcare pour nos communications en anglais. 

Fondé il y a plus de 20 ans, l'ASEQ découle de l’union de leaders étudiants qui mirent leurs forces en commun afin de promouvoir une vision commune : offrir des régimes de soins de santé et dentaires adaptés à la communauté étudiante postsecondaire. À titre de leader des régimes étudiants de soins de santé et dentaires au Canada, l'ASEQ est fier de fournir des régimes simples, engageants et fiables à plus de 1 000 000 membres répartis dans 100 associations étudiantes et établissements d'enseignement supérieur à travers le pays.

ASEQ is used for our French communications and Studentcare is used for our English communications. 

Founded over 20 years ago, Studentcare was the result of student union leaders joining forces to enact a common vision. Together, they were committed to offering health and dental plans adapted to the needs of the post-secondary community. As the leading student health and dental plan administrator in Canada, Studentcare provides simple, empowering, and reliable service to more than 1 000,000 students from 100 student associations and post-secondary institutions across the country.

jobTitle: People BI Specialist (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
About The Team
The People Team is a purveyor of opportunity, searching the globe for the most talented individuals and offering them an open, collaborative workplace. By prioritizing skill and potential, we have cultivated a powerful assembly of professionals through our drive for equal opportunity and diversity. We make the move to Agoda a breeze with assisted onboarding programs, and we continue to support and enrich our thousands of Agoda employees through individual growth with outstanding learning programs and various means of assistance. Our development of incredible benefits has ensured everyone can stay strong, healthy, and happy during their time at Agoda. Leading ambitious changes and making a positive impact in the lives of our employees, the People Team is a crucial and rewarding part of the Agoda family.
 The Opportunity 
We are looking for a  People BI Specialist  whose main focus areas are providing visibility and insights for people-related issues through Business Intelligence tools like Tableau and SQL, managing data warehouses, building ETL processes, and helping build other tools to optimize the business. This would entail liaising with key stakeholders in the People team, IT team, and other teams to provide the data tools and support necessary for the business.
 In This Role, You’ll Get To 
 Create strong collaboration with IT, People, and Global Services partners to gather business requirements and provide solutions to improve the business  Design and implement solutions empowering end-users to be self-reliant  Develop and build BI tools to help greater maximize the People team’s business impact  Understand how HR data is built and used in a global company 
What You’ll Need To Succeed
 Ability to bridge communications with both IT and HR audiences  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail  Excellent communication skills and ability to influence peers and build strong relationships within HR and cross-functionally is required.  3 + years of experience with BI & analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Metabase or similar technologies)  2 + years of solid project management  Fluency in English required  Strong sense of ownership and growth mindset  Thriving on learning new skills  Experience in ETL tools, data warehouse design, data modeling, and visualization  Be responsive to work within a deadline  Work professionally to understand business questions or the requests and be able to suggest proper BI solution s which is measurable and scalable
