companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobDescription:
Position Title: FEA Analyst

Department: Global Engineering Services

Division: AGI Corporate

Location: Winnipeg, MB, Canada

About AGI

AGI is a global food-based infrastructure company publicly traded in Canada. With over 4,200 employees and over 30 global manufacturing brands, AGI is a leading provider of equipment and technology solutions for agricultural commodities including seed, fertilizer, grain and feed systems and an expanding platform for food processing facilities.

The Opportunity

As the FEA Analyst, you will work closely with senior engineers in the analysis of equipment.

The Team

Reporting directly to the Manager of Global Engineering, you will work with senior engineers in the analysis of equipment.

Responsibilities

 Perform Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of structural and mechanical equipment. Provide support to senior engineers in the analysis and design of equipment Prepare technical reports and presentations Review 3D models, drawings, calculations, specifications, and other engineering documentation Ensure that all assigned work is complete, accurate and on time Complete other duties as assigned

Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent experience 1 year of FEA experience in a professional environment Experience with Finite Element Analysis. Experience using Solid Works Simulation/Ansys is preferred. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Detail oriented and organized Time management skills with the ability to work in complex environment often driven by project deadlines Effective communicator, both verbal and written Strong problem-solving, analytical, and interpersonal skills Sound technical judgement and understanding of ethical responsibilities

AGI is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with a disability taking part in the recruitment process and once hired.
companyDescription:
At AGI we build the world’s food infrastructure.

AGI is a global leader in the planning, engineering and manufacturing of full equipment solutions and systems across 5 platforms: Grain, Fertilizer, Food, Feed and Seed. We partner with our customers on 6 continents to leverage the AGI advantage and engineer unique market specific systems. These systems are delivered for farm and commercial applications and include: Storage, Handling, Structural, Processing, and Controls all based on, and brought together, with Engineering and Project Management.

The AGI brand as well as our product brands are among the most recognized in global agriculture; in some cases, with more than 160 years of industry experience. Our history of success and international esteem is yet another reason the AGI advantage has you covered.

Interested in a career at AGI? Visit www.aggrowth.com/careers

jobDescription:
NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.
We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Specialist to join our team in Victoria, British Columbia (CA-BC), Canada (CA).
In this role, you will provide industry best practices to support our Canadian clients with deliverables that are focused on the Microsoft Analytics technology stack. You are adept at the entire software development lifecycle from facilitating requirements gathering sessions, creating solution designs (including ETL, semantic layer, and reporting), and managing deployments into multiple environments. You are experienced at developing solutions for on-premises solutions using tools such as SSIS, SSAS (Tabular), SSRS, and Power BI. Your T-SQL skills are intermediate to senior level.
Basic Qualifications
Possess a college diploma or university degree focused on computer science, or equivalent experience
Minimum six (6) years’ experience working with on-premises Microsoft data warehouse solutions
Minimum five (5) years’ experience designing dimensional models (i.e. Kimball methodology)
Comfortable working in a hybrid or remote work scenario
Mandatory Qualifications
Experience working with SQL Server (2019 preferred), including DML and DDL
Six (6) years’ experience working with T-SQL
Five (5) years’ experience developing ETL solutions using a combination of SSIS and SSMS (stored procedures, functions, etc.)
Five (5) years’ experience developing Semantic Layers utilizing tools such as SSAS Tabular models, and/or Power BI data sets
Five (5) years’ experience designing and developing reporting solutions for on-premises architectures utilizing tools such as SSRS and Power BI
Nice To Have Qualifications
Fundamental understanding of the Power BI administration and governance framework
Experience integrating analytic content into SharePoint, specifically Power BI, Excel, and SSRS
Microsoft Azure cloud experience in particular Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL, Azure Analysis Services and Azure Synapse Analytics
About NTT DATA Services
NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.
NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.

Business Analyst - Customer Analytics

This position is hybrid and located in Mississauga, ON (GTA + Hamilton Area)

Who is Just Energy?

Just Energy is a retail energy provider specializing in electricity and natural gas commodities and bringing energy efficient solutions and renewable energy options to customers. Currently, operating in the United States and Canada, Just Energy serves residential and commercial customers. Just Energy is the parent company of Amigo Energy, Filter Group Inc., Hudson Energy, Interactive Energy Group, Tara Energy, and terrapass.

Job Summary

Business Data Analysts play an integral role in our strategic and operational capability at Just Energy by querying data repositories and generating ad-hoc reports and identifying data patterns and trends in available information sources. This role will provide exposure to customer data analytics covering multiple business departments including but not limited to credit policy analytics, collections strategy analytics, residential customer behavioral analytics, commercial customer portfolio analytics.

If you are someone relatively fresh out of school, have a passion to apply your learned concepts to real-life problem solving and can leverage data to drive your point – this role is a treasure house to learn and grow. Since our Analysts work in small group settings and interact directly with senior leadership as well as executive leadership on a regular basis, there is opportunity to build business acumen, sharpen critical thinking, analytical and decision-making skills in real-world business scenarios to develop your career.

The individual is expected to work with senior leadership in iterative problem solving or trend analysis leveraging the power of data and the informational insights it can drive. The successful candidate will have strong quantitative skills, exceptional initiative and, along with a drive to consistently seek out additional information and ideas to support the problem solving. Our team structures are relatively flat, we like to move fast, learn and explore various perspectives based on facts and figures. Our culture demands a fast-pace of work with extreme focus on problem-solving and is results-driven, we take pride in offering opportunities for advancement and increased responsibility for successful team members.

Responsibilities
 Query database tables to extract business requested data Create ad-hoc reports (using MS SQL, MS Excel, Power BI Reporting tools) within required timeframes. Analyze and validate data to provide assurance of accuracy and validity of critical business information Provide quantitative analysis, reporting, and trending for key strategic initiatives; provide data sets and metrics to add context and measure potential impact for new projects Synthesize current business intelligence or trend data to support recommendations for action Build reporting tools to assist business operational users to execute day-to-day responsibilities Analyze data correlations / discrepancies / reconciliations and related impact to business
Requirements
 Bachelor's Degree in a business/analytical field of study (e.g. Business, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Management Information Systems) Strong analytical and quantitative modeling capability with some hands-on experience with performing analysis and modeling in Microsoft Excel 1-2 years’ quantitative experience in any business field will be highly valued SQL familiarity with an ability to learn quickly Strong ability to communicate & drive standardization & simplification efforts Strong solution design capabilities Ability to work with cross-functional teams to understand business components and processes impacting the data you are set to analyze Resourceful, quick learner able to efficiently seek out, learn, & apply new areas of expertise Working knowledge of Power BI reporting tool would be a nice to have Self-starter, results-oriented, ability to prioritize and managing multiple tasks of varying complexities and be able to work with minimal supervision under deadlines. Performs other duties as assigned
Benefits

Just Energy offers a robust benefits plan for staff members, as well as Employee Assistance Programs that offer a wealth of tools and resources to enrich the employee experience. The company also provides a number of cost-free, self-development courses for those that wish to build on their skills and competencies. In addition, a variety of awards offer another opportunity to recognize and reward employees.

We Offer
 Competitive compensation Performance based bonuses Comprehensive benefits package from day 1 of employment Employee Deferred Profit Sharing Plan (DPSP) Work from home (WFH) Model *During pandemic Health and wellbeing tools and resources and more…
Just Energy and its subsidiaries are an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace. We invite all interested individuals to apply.

Primary Location

CA-ON-Mississauga

Other Locations

US-TX-Houston

Job

Organization

Canada

Schedule

Regular

Shift

Standard

Employee Status

companyDescription:
Established in 1997, Just Energy (NYSE:JE, TSX:JE) is a leading consumer company focused on essential needs, including electricity and natural gas commodities; health and well-being, such as water quality and filtration devices; and utility conservation, bringing energy efficient solutions and renewable energy options to consumers. Currently operating in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Germany, Ireland and Japan, Just Energy serves residential and commercial customers. 

Just Energy is the parent company of Amigo Energy, EdgePower Inc., Filter Group Inc., Green Star Energy, Hudson Energy, Interactive Energy Group, Just Energy Advanced Solutions, Tara Energy, and terrapass.

jobDescription:
Description De L'entreprise
Vention aide les fabricants les plus innovants à automatiser leurs opérations en quelques jours seulement. La plateforme d’automatisation de la fabrication de Vention permet aux clients de concevoir, automatiser, commander et déployer des équipements de la fabrication directement depuis leur navigateur web.
Vention a son siège social à Montréal, au Canada, et est utilisée dans plus de 3,000 usines sur cinq continents. Toujours en croissance avec 300 employés à Montréal, Boston et Berlin, Vention a annoncé la finalisation de leur financement de ronde C en mai 2022. Ce financement sera utilisé pour développer la stratégie de mise sur le marché, étendre l'empreinte de distribution mondiale de l'entreprise et accélérer le développement de sa plate-forme.
Description Du Poste
Création et maintenance de rapports BI essentiels permettant d’orienter les décisions relatives aux activités et aux opérations de croissance, en utilisant les indicateurs clés de performance de l’entreprise.Conception de rapports et de supports visuels pertinents intégrant des techniques de narration.Développement de valeurs et de connaissances pour nos parties prenantes internes et externes en exploitant les données afin de favoriser la transformation et les résultats de l’entreprise.Connaissance des objectifs des parties prenantes et compréhension des paramètres les plus importants et leurs finalités.Traduction des besoins de l’entreprise en spécifications techniques et définition des meilleures approches d’exécution des analyses fournissant des informations sur l’entreprise.Création de rapports, de tableaux de bord et de visualisations pour les clients internes à l’aide d’outils BI.Formulation de recommandations sur la manière dont les informations clés peuvent être utilisées afin d’avoir un impact positif sur l’entreprise.Vérification de la qualité et de l’intégrité des données et exécution des requêtes de la base de données.
Qualifications
Licence dans un domaine pertinent (intelligence économique, gestion, économie, mathématiques, ingénierie, informatique, etc.).Plus de 3 ans (3+) d’expérience en analyse de données, avec une solide connaissance des solutions BI.Compétences en SQL, analyse de données, Excel avancé et développement de rapports.Expérience avec les outils de visualisation de données (PowerBI, Looker).Expérience des outils AWS, notamment Redshift, EventBridge, Glue et Appflow.Connaissance des principes de stockage des données et des techniques de modélisationSolides compétences communicationnelles et capacité à présenter des problèmes complexes à des parties prenantes intersectorielles.Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement entrepreneurial, dynamique et à croissance rapide.

Vention helps some of the most innovative manufacturing companies automate their production floor in just a few days. Vention’s online-first, manufacturing automation platform (MAP) enables its clients to design, automate, order, and deploy manufacturing equipment directly from their web browser. 

Vention is headquartered in Montreal, Canada and is used in over 2,000 factories on 5 continents.

Vention a son siège social à Montréal, au Canada, et est utilisée dans plus de 2,000 usines sur cinq continents.

jobTitle: Stagiaire, Analyste en intelligence d’affaires - Intern, Business Intelligence Analyst
jobDescription:
Overview

English follows

Tu cherches une opportunité d'apprentissage enrichissante?

Solotech est un endroit génial pour travailler et construire une carrière, car nous nous engageons à promouvoir le développement des jeunes talents. Nous offrons des opportunités de stage qui favorisent l'autonomie dans un environnement de travail convivial, collaboratif et dynamique.

Étant un leader mondial de l'industrie audiovisuelle, nous évoluons dans un secteur d'activité très tendance qui travaille avec de nouvelles technologies et propose des expériences uniques pour une variété de marchés et de clients. Nous souhaitons accueillir des étudiants et/ou des jeunes diplômés qui partagent un intérêt pour ce secteur en évolution rapide et qui incarnent nos valeurs (passion, collaboration, respect, innovation et excellence), car nous reconnaissons que les compétences s'acquièrent avec le temps.

La culture de Solotech consiste à transmettre notre passion, quel que soit notre niveau d'expérience ou de formation. Tu seras ravie de découvrir une équipe qui est toujours prête à te faire profiter de ses compétences et de ses connaissances.

Looking for an enriching learning opportunity?

Solotech is a rewarding place to work and build a career as we are committed to the development of young talent. We offer internship opportunities that favor autonomy within a collaborative, supportive and dynamic work environment.

Given that we are a global leader in the audiovisual industry, we operate in a very trendy business sector that works with new technologies and offers unique experiences for a variety of markets and clients. We seek students and/or recent grads who share an interest for this fast-paced industry and who embody our values (passion, collaboration, respect, innovation, and excellence), as we understand that skills can be learned over time.

Solotech’s culture is about sharing our passion, regardless of our level of experience or our background. You will be happy to discover a team that is always ready to share its skills and knowledge.

 Your day will look like this 

Sous la responsabilité du gestionnaire intelligence d’affaires, le titulaire du poste développera des tableaux de bord et rapports opérationnels pour les différentes unités d’affaires. Il sera impliqué dans toutes les étapes de développement des rapports, en passant de la prise de besoins auprès des clients internes à la modélisation des données et à la mise en place des visuels.

 Développer des tableaux de bord et rapports opérationnels pour les différentes unités d’affaires;  Conseiller et assister les clients ou les utilisateurs dans une perspective d’amélioration et d’innovation en matière d’analyse de données;  Développer des requêtes SQL;  Offrir un support aux opérations en participant au développement d’outils permettant l’optimisation des processus;  Formuler des recommandations quant à l’amélioration de la performance des différentes unités d’affaires;  Présenter des solutions concrètes liées aux besoins de la clientèle. 

Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, the incumbent will develop dashboards and operational reports for the various business units. The incumbent will be involved in all stages of report development, from gathering requirements from internal clients to data modeling and visual implementation.

 Develop dashboards and operational reports for the different business units;  Advise and assist clients or users in a perspective of improvement and innovation in data analysis;  Develop SQL requests;  Provide support to operations by participating in the development of tools for process optimization;  Make recommendations on improving the performance of the various business units;  Present concrete solutions related to customer needs. 

 Your profile 

 Baccalauréat en informatique, en administration (spécialisation en intelligence d’affaires)  Expérience dans la réalisation d’analyses complexes;  Bonne connaissance des bases de données SQL Server et Oracle;  Maîtrise de la programmation SQL (un atout);  Connaissances avancées de Microsoft Power Bi (un atout);  Rigueur et souci du détail;  Bon esprit d’équipe et de collaboration;  Fortes aptitudes pour l’approche client;  Possède une excellente éthique professionnelle;  Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit.  Bachelor's degree in computer science, in administration (Business Intelligence specialization);  Experience in performing complex analyses;  Good knowledge of SQL Server and Oracle databases;  Mastery of SQL programming (an asset);  Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Power BI (an asset);  Thoroughness and attention to detail;  Good team spirit and collaboration;  Strong client-focused skills;  Excellent work ethic;  Fluency in French and English, oral and written. 

 Our offer to you 

À propos de Solotech

English follows

L’équipe Solotech, c’est plus de  2 000 personnes passionnées en audiovisuel et technologies du divertissement , propulsées par la même ambition:  livrer des expériences spectaculaires partout autour du monde . En tant que leader mondial en solutions événementielles, intégration de systèmes et technologies virtuelles, Solotech offre plusieurs avantages sociaux concurrentiels, un milieu de travail inclusif et inspirant ainsi que des opportunités de développement dans près de  20 emplacements  en Amérique, en Europe et en Asie. Si tu souhaites faire partie d’une histoire unique qui rayonne depuis plus de  45 ans , nous t’invitons à te joindre à nous !

Pour en savoir davantage : www.  solotech  .com

About Solotech

The Solotech team is comprised of more than  2,000 people passionate about audiovisual  and entertainment technology, driven by the same ambition:  to deliver spectacular experiences worldwide . As a global leader  in live productions, systems integration and virtual technology,  Solotech offers competitive benefits, a collaborative and inspiring work environment, and development opportunities in nearly  20 locations  across America, Europe and Asia. If you want to be part of a unique story that has been shining for over  45 years , we invite you to join us !

Find out more at: www.  solotech  .com
companyDescription:
Solotech is your single source for audio, video, lighting, rigging, soft goods, control and collaboration solutions & services.
Our world-renowned notoriety in live productions, systems integration and equipment makes us unique.

1-877-514-7656 / 514-526-7721
info@solotech.com

jobTitle: Data Scientist I Scientifique de données
jobDescription:
As part of our Data Science team, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-discipline teams to help us constantly improve our games and our players' experience. You will actively contribute to the game development (design, direction, live operation) by creating data-fueled tools and by generating insights from a variety of scientific approaches: machine learning, statistical modeling and simulations.
In This Role You Will
Discuss with internal partners to identify challenges and design solutions. Develop math-based computer simulations in Python. Develop statistical models for predicting players' behavior. Develop AI tools like NLP models, clustering models or recommenders. Design experiments (A/B tests) to estimate the effect of data-informed initiatives on key metrics and provide recommendations. Build dashboards and complex visualizations. Develop the right tools and methodologies to make your analyses repeatable and accessible, including extensive documentation. Define and analyze key performance indicators such as retention, lifetime value or player acquisition. Translate complex findings and results into an easy-to-understand and compelling narrative. Communicate analyses and recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders to influence the direction of the business. 
What We’re Looking For
3+ years in a quantitative analysis role focusing on data mining and manipulating, predictive analytics, business intelligence, statistics, machine learning. Strong experience on coding in Python, SQL and R. Ability to code predictive simulations. Good background in mathematics is a plus. Curiosity and problem-solving mindset.  Genuine interest and ability to identify and solve complex business problems. Genuine interest for video games, as well as for the video game industry and its relevant challenges. Ability to autonomously manage a project from the beginning to the landing. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to build clear and easy-to-understand presentations (previous experience using PowerBi would be a plus).
Dans Ce Rôle, Vous Devrez
Discuter avec des partenaires à l’interne pour identifier les défis et élaborer des solutions.Développer des modèles informatiques basés sur les mathématiques dans Python. Développer des modèles statistiques pour prédire le comportement des joueursDévelopper des outils IA tels que des modèles NLP, clustering et recommandatairesConceptualiser des expériences (tests A/B) pour estimer l'effet des initiatives fondées sur les données des paramètres clés et de fournir des recommandations.Bâtir des tableaux de bord et des visualisations complexes. Développer des outils et des méthodes, y compris une documentation complète, pour rendre vos analyses reproductibles et accessibles.Définir et analyser des indicateurs de performance clés tels que la rétention, la valeur à vie ou l'acquisition de joueurs.Vulgariser des conclusions et des résultats complexes en un récit convaincant.Partager des analyses et des recommandations aux parties prenantes interfonctionnelles pour influencer la direction de l'entreprise.
Ce Que Nous Recherchons
3 ans et plus dans un rôle d'analyse quantitative axé sur l'exploration et la manipulation de données, l'analyse prédictive, l'intelligence des affaires, les statistiques et l'apprentissage automatique.Expérience exhaustive en codage Python, SQL et R.Capacité à coder des simulations prédictives et une bonne base en mathématiques est un plus. Curiosité et capacité à résoudre des problèmes. Intérêt et capacité à identifier et à résoudre des problèmes commerciaux complexes.Intérêt pour les jeux vidéo, ainsi que pour l'industrie du jeu vidéo et ses enjeux.Capacité à gérer de manière autonome un projet du début à la finCompétences interpersonnelles et savoir communiquer.Capacité à créer des présentations claires et faciles à comprendre (une expérience antérieure avec PowerBi serait un plus).
Faire partie de l’équipe de la science de données vous donnera l’opportunité de collaborer avec des équipes interdisciplinaires qui nous permettent d’améliorer constamment nos jeux ainsi que l’expérience des joueurs. Vous allez contribuer au développement du jeu (conception, réalisation, fonctionnement direct) en créant des outils alimentés par les données et générer des idées à partir d’une variété d’approches scientifiques; apprentissage automatique, modélisation statistique et simulations.
companyDescription: Celebrating its 30th year, and with more than 1,000 full-time employees, the studio has enjoyed immense success with its original IP Dead by Daylight, which now has more than 50 million players around the world and across all platforms. Behaviour holds co-developer credits for some of the gaming industry’s largest titles (such as Assassin’s Creed, Gears 5, Call of Duty and Tony Hawk Pro Skater 1 & 2) and developed an unparalleled, award-winning culture within the gaming industry. Winner of Deloitte Canada’s Enterprise Fast 15 and Best Managed Company awards and listed as one of the Best Places To Work – Canada by GamesIndustry.biz in 2021, Behaviour is a leading development studio, cultivating career growth and talent development within the gaming industry. Behaviour counts among its partners some of the world’s most renowned brands, including Microsoft, Sony, EA, Warner, 2K and many more. For more information, visit bhvr.com. ﻿﻿

Dans Ce Rôle, Vous Devrez
Discuter avec des partenaires à l’interne pour identifier les défis et élaborer des solutions.Développer des modèles informatiques basés sur les mathématiques dans Python. Développer des modèles statistiques pour prédire le comportement des joueursDévelopper des outils IA tels que des modèles NLP, clustering et recommandatairesConceptualiser des expériences (tests A/B) pour estimer l'effet des initiatives fondées sur les données des paramètres clés et de fournir des recommandations.Bâtir des tableaux de bord et des visualisations complexes. Développer des outils et des méthodes, y compris une documentation complète, pour rendre vos analyses reproductibles et accessibles.Définir et analyser des indicateurs de performance clés tels que la rétention, la valeur à vie ou l'acquisition de joueurs.Vulgariser des conclusions et des résultats complexes en un récit convaincant.Partager des analyses et des recommandations aux parties prenantes interfonctionnelles pour influencer la direction de l'entreprise.
Ce Que Nous Recherchons
3 ans et plus dans un rôle d'analyse quantitative axé sur l'exploration et la manipulation de données, l'analyse prédictive, l'intelligence des affaires, les statistiques et l'apprentissage automatique.Expérience exhaustive en codage Python, SQL et R.Capacité à coder des simulations prédictives et une bonne base en mathématiques est un plus. Curiosité et capacité à résoudre des problèmes. Intérêt et capacité à identifier et à résoudre des problèmes commerciaux complexes.Intérêt pour les jeux vidéo, ainsi que pour l'industrie du jeu vidéo et ses enjeux.Capacité à gérer de manière autonome un projet du début à la finCompétences interpersonnelles et savoir communiquer.Capacité à créer des présentations claires et faciles à comprendre (une expérience antérieure avec PowerBi serait un plus).
Faire partie de l’équipe de la science de données vous donnera l’opportunité de collaborer avec des équipes interdisciplinaires qui nous permettent d’améliorer constamment nos jeux ainsi que l’expérience des joueurs. Vous allez contribuer au développement du jeu (conception, réalisation, fonctionnement direct) en créant des outils alimentés par les données et générer des idées à partir d’une variété d’approches scientifiques; apprentissage automatique, modélisation statistique et simulations.

jobTitle: Data Analyst, Strategic Partnerships( Bangkok based)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Key Areas of Focus:
In this role, you’ll get to: 
Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape.
Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance.
Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives.
Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers
Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making.
Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management.
Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments.
What you’ll Need to Succeed: 
4 years and above of experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areasEntrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on on the work Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders 
It’s Great if you have:  
Ability to write in SQL a plus, or willingness to learn Ability to use Tableau a plus, or willingness to learn Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics a plus jobDescription:
Job Summary
In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position. The Data Analyst, working within a designated service line, provides data management and maintenance services, ensures quality and integrity of data for the various information systems, performs regular analysis of data, and supports information system use by departmental staff. The Data Analyst reports to the Coordinator for Data Standards and Integration, and has a functional relationship to the service line the Analyst is assigned to.
Duties/Accountabilities
Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, transformation, and documentation. Develops and maintains data collection and recording systems such as databases, spreadsheets, and web-sites, including designing ad hoc reports. Writes computer code and data queries to capture and edit data, and/or liaises with information systems department for same. Creates analytic reporting tools to allow internal and external users to analyze data. Receives and responds to ongoing requests to evaluate data, systems, processes and procedures. Automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools.Performs descriptive analyses and produces summaries and analytical reports using statistical software and coding, identifying all data limitations that apply. Identifies issues, trends, and developments. Communicates findings to Centre staff and external stakeholders at the local, provincial and federal level. Automates routine analyses using standard programming tools. Monitors data quality in the information systems like the Public Health Information System and disease databases, proactively identifies and communicates anomalies that indicate data quality issues, and ensures that data used for analysis purposes or distributed to stakeholders is of the highest quality possible. Follows up with regional health authorities on missing, erroneous, and duplicate data to achieve high quality data. Corrects data errors in a timely manner. Documents processes for these procedures. Prepares and maintains documentation and reports such as user guides, procedure manuals, metadata, code documentation, data security policies and data dictionaries. Supports data security by assigning and deleting access for various applications and network file systems. Ensures the secure transfer of patient data to stakeholders when authorized to. Assists as needed with gathering data, entering data, researching historical and archival data, accessing on-line databases, performing interviews, and obtaining data from national, provincial and local agencies and individuals. Links data from separate sources such as the client registry and MSP. Provides training and user support to users on software applications used by department staff. Attains high-level proficiency with the centre’s data warehouse and related tools in order to train and support staff in the assigned service line. Maintains the departmental content on the Inter, Extra and Intra nets. Recommends and implements changes to, and development of, web sites, and web site content. Adds links, URLs, PDFs, MS Excel files, word documents and graphics to web sites using html programming language. Participates in review, critique/ enhancement identification, documentation, and planning of systems such as the centre’s data warehouse, providing information about data requirements and workflows as needed. Coordinates the placement of the rotating co-op student in the department, provides orientation, assigns and oversees their activities, and evaluates their performance. Performs other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Education, Training and Experience 
Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Science or Computer Science or equivalent and three (3) years’ experience as a data analyst/scientist, preferably in community health and/or the health information field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Skills And Abilities
Ability to write data management and analysis programs using data programming tools such as SAS or R.Experience managing and querying data in large relational or multidimensional databases and data warehouses an asset.Ability to create data visualizations.Knowledge of standard software packages, spreadsheet, statistical, graphical, database, communication and web software.Knowledge of descriptive statistics.Knowledge of PC systems and applications.Familiarity with health-related terminology.Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.Ability to operate related equipmentPhysical ability to carry out the duties of the position.

companyDescription:
Canada's first provincial health services authority.

Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) is one of six health authorities – the other five health authorities serve geographic regions of BC. PHSA's primary role is to ensure that BC residents have access to a coordinated network of high-quality specialized health care services.

PHSA operates provincial programs including BC Children's Hospital, BC Women's Hospital + Health Centre, BC Emergency Health Services, BC Cancer, BC Centre for Disease Control and BC Transplant. It is also responsible for specialized provincial health services like chest surgery and trauma services, which are delivered in a number of locations in the regional health authorities.

For career opportunities, visit www.jobs.phsa.ca or email careers@phsa.ca.

We are a diverse family that highly values each individual, and together we make a team that’s bigger than ourselves. “Who We Are” meets “What We Do” to make us into a productive and accomplished force dedicated to improving ourselves and our whole team. Our clients and partners are among the most successful and innovative organizations in the world. jobDescription:
At Rona Inc., over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.
We operate or service some 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated employees to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.
You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills. All that in a work environment that offers a lot of flexibility because the well-being of our teams is an everyday priority.
So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.
Workplace
Our head office being located in Boucherville, on the South Shore of Montreal, we know that some of our employees are concerned by the roadwork being carried out in the Louis-Hippolyte-La Fontaine tunnel. That’s why we stood up an in-house advisory committee and implemented new work policies that provide our teams with even more flexibility, no matter where they live. Whether it’s working from home or having flexible hours – when a role requires employees to be physically present at the office –, we are constantly revaluating our practices to provide the best possible work environment to our employees.
Our expectations
The Analyst, Digital Data and Analytics will work with multiple data sources to deliver relevant and reliable insights to improve the Marketing initiatives. The analyst will collaborate closely with the e-Commerce Product Management, Online Merchandising and Marketing by developing methods for measuring and analyzing cross-platform digiral experiences, to create a view that integrates all channels and optimizes the marketing strategies.
Your role
Design, build, and maintain dashboards using data visualization tools Collaborate with the Marketing teams to transform business objectives into specific metrics and KPIsConduct ad-hoc analysis to provide recommendations that tie customer behaviour to business objectivesPartner with various teams to improve current capabilities that leverage digital analytics tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)Assist with requests for data extraction, manipulation, and integration to leverage customer behaviour data to inform product and merchandising decisions. Package, share, and present complex analytical findings in a simple manner to other business areas
The Qualifications We Are Looking For
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, e-Commerce, Information, Technology, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or a similar fieldAt least 2 to 4 years of experience in analytics Product, marketing, web development, and/or retail background (an asset)Experience building analytics dashboardsAt least 2 years of experience as a power user for Adobe Analytics or Google AnalyticsComfort with technical documentation and independently developing innovative, untested solutionsKnowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (i.e. PowerBI)Strong business acumen and ability to understand business problems, develop hypothesis, test, and learnProficiency in data storytelling, pulling insights out of data, and visually organizing data to readily answer business problems
Your benefits of working for Rona Inc. : 
By joining the Rona Inc. family, you’ll enjoy many benefits, such as:
A highly flexible hybrid workplaceA fitness centre, sports activities, and showersA childcare centre that can accommodate up to 78 childrenA cafeteria with a delicious menu prepared by a dedicated chef, healthy options, as well as FARO Roasting Houses and Tim Hortons coffee stationsExclusive employee discounts, plus a 10% discount on store merchandise (at all Rona Inc. locations)Benefits: retirement savings plan, annual bonuses, stock purchase plan, student incentive program, etc.Electric car charging stationsCareer growth opportunities within the companyAn inclusive and safe working environmentPromotion of work-life balanceAn employer that’s involved in the communityAnd much more!
The masculine generic is used without discrimination and only in order to simplify the text. Rona Inc. is committed to encouraging diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, or any other status protected by law.
companyDescription: Created in 1939, RONA is a part of the Lowe’s Canada family of banners. Spanning the entire country, its vast network of more than 375 stores includes both corporate stores and independent affiliated dealers. Known for its large in-store and online product selection as well as for its installation services, RONA also provides expert support and advice to its retail and pro customers for their building and renovation projects.

jobDescription:
Are you a Data Analyst looking for a new opportunity?

Are you looking for a new contract opportunity?

If so, we are pleased to offer you a new contract opportunity for you to consider: Data Analyst.

Actively seeking for candidates with below requirements.

Standard Working hours - Monday to Friday.

Advantages
Start: ASAPEstimated length: 12 MonthsLocation: Toronto HYBRID - Wednesday is mandatory on-site day

You will have an opportunity to work with a leading employer in the local market.

Responsibilities
 Reports to the Director, Client Data Management and Process Re-engineering Collaborating with business stakeholders

This role requires interaction with Technology teams and various Front office, Legal, Regulatory Operations and other teams.

Change management
 Work closely with Technology Partners and other stakeholders to guide formulation of business requirements and solution discussions to meet project needs. Work in Scrum teams to deliver products using Agile methodologies. Lead the sprint planning, refinement sessions for different work streams, create and assign the user stories. Support project planning, impact assessment, SIT, UAT, BAT testing. Run regular meetings and walkthroughs with stakeholders (Legal, Client Services, Front Office, Regulatory operations, Corporate Banking, etc.), technology partners and internal operations teams Provide subject matter expertise in client and account data, Client Onboarding

Client Data Analytics
 Design and develop a client data and account attribute remediation rule book per trading and settlement application and/or Capital Markets product. Support end-to-end implementation and execution of each rule book through to data capture and act as a subject matter expert with regards to the rule books and with client data in general. Plan and collaborate with a diverse team to create and build flexible, innovative solutions that address client data remediation and future data quality. Work closely with partners to guide formulation of requirements and solution design to meet project needs. Support end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in client data and in-scope regulations. Drive to collaborate and support individuals and cross-functional teams to resolve organizational, operational and process problems. Ensure remediation activities are progressing to meet company and regulatory deadlines. Escalate any issues as appropriate to manager. Interact, obtain information and provide direction to Operations/Technology teams regarding the creation and maintenance of client data in their respective trading and settlement applications Act as an escalation contact for queries and issues from internal stakeholders on remediation activities by providing resolutions to their queries or concerns in a professional and timely manner Be accountable at all times, taking ownership of projects and initiatives assigned by manager

Relationship Management
 Effectively manage relationships with internal stakeholders, including Senior Management in Front Office, as well as Legal, Compliance, Technology and Operations stakeholders Provide leadership and guidance to team members to ensure their data related mandates are fulfilled Lead change and implement the required solutions, processes and procedures to ensure effectiveness in, or improve, the client data and reporting function.

Client Data and Reporting
 Work directly with stakeholders to understand their current and future reporting requirements Identify opportunities for automation and enhancements to current reporting processes that support management reporting and business as usual activities related to client onboarding and KYC/AML due diligence Provide input on key performance indicators to assist with team performance and monitoring and build appropriate tools to deliver this information to stakeholders Understand the company CM client onboarding process and workflow in order to construct end to end client lifecycle reporting Document the process and procedures for generating metrics and reporting as needed Support build out of client data governance program Support other initiatives and projects as assigned by the Director and Executive Director

Qualifications
 2+ Years' experience with Alteryx (REQUIRED) 5+ Years' experience as a Business Consultant/Analyst or Data Analyst Excellent Microsoft Suite skills (Advanced Excel - Formulas, pivot tables, macros, etc.) 2+ years’ experience with Power BI Must be able to read/write & understand SQL Experience working within an AGILE environment University Degree Must possess strong leadership skills Must be able to work independently Excellent verbal and written communication, problem solving and analytical thinking skills. Must have a strong continuous improvement mindset, identifying opportunities for operational enhancements and process efficiencies. Flexible and able to adapt to changing situations and ability to work in a very fast paced and demanding environment. Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization, including clients and relationship managers to deliver high quality and timely deliverables.

Nice to have:
 Work experience within Capital Markets or Financial Institution industry in the area(s) of Client Onboarding, Change Management and Client Data Analysis. Tableau Power Automate University degree in business, data analytics, math, statistics or operations research is an asset.

jobDescription:
WHY JOIN THE TEAM?
To experience exciting challenges and have the opportunity to work at the heart of BRP's transformation, innovation and continuous improvement.You are entrepreneurial, have a strategic vision and wish to support BRP in achieving its growth objectives.To work closely with various multi-disciplinary teams to determine the optimal strategies for the supply chain.You want to be at the very forefront of defining the logistics strategies of a growing multinational company and want to learn the best practices of the manufacturing industry in the area of logistics.
Your Key Responsibilities
Source, clean, and maintain accurate logistics data.Audit logistics data including packaging weight for priority parts in the warehouse.Partner with key internal stakeholders, including the NPD, BI, local, planning, and inbound logistics teams to obtain, synthesize, and present logistics data to relevant audiences.Deliver packaging audits in line with monthly and annual targets, collaborating with local site to secure the support necessary to complete objectives.Correct packaging errors in SAP, according to best practices.Collect weight data according to the priorities given by our transportation provider and internal transportation department.Leverage scheduled assembly line downtimes to advance packaging dimension and weight audits.Support the improvements and implementation of the new Packaging Requirements & Specifications (PRS) document and process with logistics engineering teams.Ensure data is correct in logistic report(s) to improve transportation accuracy.Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), communicate the results and, if necessary, make needed corrections to meet project objectives.Support the implementation of a new App and database to improve auditing performance and storage in a database.Promote a spirit of continuous improvement to support our ‘Lean Enterprise’ mission.Work with internal logistics, transportation, and planning to correct and improve data planning parameters and packaging data.Create reports to highlight potential data entry errors.Other duties, as required.
Your Qualifications And Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Operations Management/Logistics, or other relevant field.Previous relevant experience (logistics, supply chain management, manufacturing operations).English and French fluency required, both written and oral - other language skills (ie. Spanish) a plus.Project management experience.Knowledge of manufacturing operations and logistics (warehousing, transportation, etc.).Strong analysis and problem-solving skills.Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, Power BI, Google suite (including sheets & sites) and other project management software (Smartsheet).The ability to communicate and synthesize complex information to diverse audiences and build ‘executive level’ presentations.Sense of initiative, ability to challenge the status quo, autonomous, organized, and possessing strong attention to detail.Proven interpersonal skills.Accountability for delivering results and achieving objectives.Excellent ability to work in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams.Knowledge of SAP (WM, MM, PP) an asset.Availability to travel, when required.
AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.

Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:
Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams.Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products. Pension plan: we want to make sure you’ll enjoy retirement; we’ve got you covered. Collective saving opportunities: being part of BRP allows you to tap into the strength of our saving programs. Industry leading healthcare: fully paid by BRP, this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters.
What About Some Feel Good Extras
Flexible work schedule: balance is key to innovation, and we want to make sure you are at the top of your game with a schedule that will work for you. Summer schedule: time flies at BRP, so we hit pause to enjoy it.Holiday season shutdown: between Christmas and New Year’s, we close our facilities and refill on good times.Educational resources: you love what you do, and we get you resources to stay cutting-edge, so we all win together.Discount on BRP products: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.
WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey.

 AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA! >
companyDescription:
We create innovative ways to move – on snow, on water, on asphalt or dirt – even in the air.

Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, BRP has been reimagining the way you access your world since 2003 and beyond. Building on a tradition of ingenuity and intense customer focus that go all the way back to 1937, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Austria and Australia. We have a total workforce of more than 14,500 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products comprises Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex boats and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts and recreational aircraft. We support our product lines with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business, to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

jobDescription:
SAPMontréal, Québec, CanadaGlencore Copper
About The Role
Our Glencore Copper Asset Management team has a unique opportunity for an experienced and highly knowledgeable professional to join us as the Regional AM Process and Data Lead.
In this position, you will provide oversight and advanced support across the Glencore Copper Region for the management of S/4 Hana (SAP) as it relates to plant maintenance.
You will promote efficient system usability in pursuit of operational discipline by ensuring system alignment with the Asset Management Framework and its associated processes and guidelines discipline.
You will also provide guidance and support to operational teams in meeting their business objectives.
 More specifically, you will be expected to: 
 Provide business support, prioritize issues impacting system usability;  Provide Business as Usual (BAU) system support to progressively address either deficiencies or issues identified by site end users impacting system usability via the issue identification process, and prioritize accordingly;  Troubleshoot, develop change requests to allow issue resolution, and escalate issues that are not resolved in a timely manner;  Promote and reinforce compliance to SAP standards and / or any other standards and guidelines, document best practices, identify gaps or opportunities and either develop documentation or seek support to action so that solutions promote effective and efficient system use;  Encourage continuous improvement of master data quality and effectiveness through different initiatives such as participating in system master data audits, assisting in the development of actions and monitoring timely resolution;  Provide intelligence where required and support the development of analytics to measure the health of the SAP PM module master data;  Collaborate with multiple stakeholders to enable the implementation of integrated business solutions to support effective issue resolution and allow more informed decision making;  Support system upgrades and participate in appropriate testing to allow seamless transition of upgrades into the Production environment;  Provide technical intelligence in aligning system functionality with asset management processes to drive operational discipline;  Monitoring KPI’s and providing guidance to Operational Teams to reinforce positive behaviours or identify opportunities in meeting business objectives. 
 Do you have what it takes? 
 Bachelor's degree in Information Systems / Technology or Maintenance related field, or equivalent recognized industry experience.  Functional support knowledge of SAP PM modules.  Experience in a maintenance planning role in the mining or minerals processing industries.  Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with various stakeholders;  Self-starter, autonomous and flexible;  Solid analytical skills with an innovative mindset . 
 Language:  Bilingual (English and French). Knowledge of an additional language such as Spanish is an asset.
 Travel:  We estimate that you will have to travel abroad up to 30% of the time. You also need to have some flexibility to be able to work with colleagues located in different time zones.
 Only candidates with full working rights in Canada will be considered.

jobTitle: Data Analyst, Digital performance - Intact Lab
jobDescription:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone's job. Ready to make your mark?

About The Role

We’re looking for a Data Analyst, Digital performance to join our growing team!

What You'll Do Here
Be a data analyst to assist the various teams involved in the Lab’s digital initiatives.Create, design and present analytical reports and appropriate recommendations for optimization on a regular basis4.Monitor, identify, and analyze trends, explaining outliers and providing influential feedback related to results and productivity.Consolidate data from various sources, ensuring data is clean. Build and maintain an inventory of data and support the monitoring of KPIs. Proactively identify new data elements that may provide further insight into performance or business trends.Analyze and present information clearly and concisely to diverse audiences within the organization.Create and maintain effective documentation to assist in training and reinforcement of workflows & best practices, and to satisfy audit protocol.Conceptualize, develop, and implement technical solutions to meet the evolving needs of our partners.Work in collaboration with project team members, leading the development of new reports using PowerBI.Support ad hoc reporting as new needs arise. Proactively identify new data elements that may provide insight into performance.
What You Bring To The Table
Passionate about digital, data and performance.5+ years of relevant work experience as a data analyst.Proven experience of at least one web analytics tool (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Amplitude, etc.).Interest/Knowledge of tracking implementation process and digital data collection tools (Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch, etc.).Can communicate effectively with diverse audiences verbally and in writing.Excellent time management and organization skills, managing competing priorities to meet deadlines.Strong critical thinking and analytical skills with high attention to detail.Dynamic individual with a high level of energy and strong initiative.
#IN-QC

What We Offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:
A financial rewards program that recognizes your success An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare Flexible work arrangements Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunitiesInspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique 
We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Intact Financial Corporation (TSX: IFC) is the largest provider of property and casualty (P&C) insurance in Canada, a leading provider of global specialty insurance, and, with RSA, a leader in the U.K. and Ireland. Our business has grown organically and through acquisitions to over $20 billion of total annual premiums. In Canada, Intact distributes insurance under the Intact Insurance brand through a wide network of brokers, including its wholly-owned subsidiary BrokerLink, and directly to consumers through belairdirect. Intact also provides affinity insurance solutions through the Johnson Affinity Groups.  In the U.S., Intact Insurance Specialty Solutions provides a range of specialty insurance products and services through independent agencies, regional and national brokers, and wholesalers and managing general agencies. Outside of North America, the company provides personal, commercial and specialty insurance solutions across the UK, Ireland, Europe and the Middle East through the RSA brands.

jobDescription:
Mier Recruitment is hiring!
Our client in York Region is actively looking for an experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join their team.
Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst 
Location: York Region, ON 
Length of Assignment: Permanent 
Salary: $80,000 - $85,000/hr
Summary/Objective
The BI Analyst is responsible for aggregating data from multiple sources in an efficient data warehouse and designing enterprise-level solutions for multidimensional and tabular databases and creating and managing BI and analytics solutions that turn data into knowledge.
Essential Functions
Design, build, deploy and maintain BI solutions (e.g. OLAP cubes, tabular models, reporting tools, data integration solutions)Debug, monitor and troubleshoot BI solutionsMaintain and support data analytics platformsCreate tools to store data (e.g. relational database, OLAP cubes)Conduct unit testing and troubleshootingEvaluate and improve existing BI systemsCollaborate with teams to integrate systemsDevelop and execute database queries and stored proceduresAnalyze and cleanse dataEffectively present BI solutions to end users and stakeholdersEnhance business intelligence systems to help make better decisionsLead requirements gathering and review sessions and translate business needs to technical specificationsDevelop and update technical documentation
Skills And Qualifications
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP), SSAS Tabular model and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework. Knowledge of Python or R is an asset. Strong knowledge of data warehouse design principles (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining.Supply Chain Industry experience is preferred. Knowledge of financial processes and accounting fundamentals is an asset. Knowledge of Navision ERP or SAP is an asset. Excellent communication skills and ability to operate effectively in a team environment and independently.
Required Education And Experience
1-2 years' experience in SQL queries, MDX, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), data analysis, validation, data cleansing tools and processesBSc/BA/Diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or related field Proven experience as a BI Developer/Analyst or Data Scientist.Experienced in BI analytical and visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Pyramid Analytics, PowerPivot) and Excel.
If you meet the above qualifications, and possess the above qualities, please send your resume and cover letter to careers@mier.ca, quoting job title BI Analyst in the subject line.
Please note that while we appreciate all applications, only those being considered will be contacted
