jobDescription:
Description De L'entreprise
Kenny U-Pull est fière de donner une seconde vie aux véhicules usagés. Nos 25 sites de recyclage automobile dans l'Est du Canada et des États-Unis sont soutenus par plus de 400 employés, tous passionnés par la revalorisation des voitures usagées et par le souhait d'un environnement plus vert pour les générations à venir. Depuis 2008, nous avons recyclé plus d'un million de véhicules, et ce n'est pas fini!
Chez Kenny, nous faisons les choses différemment en offrant à nos clients la possibilité de créer leur propre expérience de libre-service. Les clients choisissent et retirent eux-mêmes les pièces de rechange pour une fraction du prix du fabricant, dans un environnement sûr, propre et écologiquement responsable. 
Notre passion est au coeur de ce que nous faisons. Nous sommes une entreprise unie et solidaire où vos ambitions sont aussi les nôtres. Montez à bord - nous vous promettons un périple enrichissant.
Description Du Poste
Horaire : Lundi au vendredi de 9H à 17H30
Travail en présentiel seulement (pas de mode hybride) 
Lieu : 3080 Boul. le Carrefour, Laval, QC H7T 2R5
En tant qu'analyste de données, vous contribuerez au développement d'outils et de méthodes de collecte, de compilation et de modélisation de données transactionnelles. Vous ferez partie d'une équipe dont le mandat est de soutenir le développement des compétences en intelligence d'affaires de l'organisation. Ces compétences aideront ensuite les décideurs dans leur prise de décision.
Plus précisément, votre rôle consistera à :
Analyser et fournir des avis basés sur les informations existantes;Élaborer des recommandations et des plans de mise en œuvre;Diagnostiquer les problèmes liés aux données;Fournir un soutien aux utilisateurs et les aider à interpréter les données; Développer de nouvelles connaissances liées aux données;Concevoir des rapports et des tableaux de bord pour répondre aux besoins de l'entreprise;Travailler en étroite collaboration avec diverses équipes.
Qualifications
Baccalauréat en commerce, ingénierie, informatique, gestion de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, statistiques, mathématiques ou un domaine connexe;Un minimum de deux ans d'expérience pertinente;Expérience en intelligence d'affaires et en gestion des données;Bilinguisme (anglais, français, oral et écrit obligatoire);Intérêt marqué pour l'analyse et la transformation des données;Bonne capacité de résolution de problèmes;Connaissance avancée de Microsoft Excel (tableaux croisés dynamiques); Expérience avec les cubes, l'outil d'analyse de données, les tests d'hypothèses, la régression linéaire, les méthodes de prévision qualitative et quantitative;Connaissance d'Excel (avancée), de SQL, des diagrammes entité-relation et des modèles de données dimensionnelles;Facilité avec la gestion des bases de données;Connaissance de l'exploitation et de la chaîne d'approvisionnement;Connaissance d'outils de visualisation tels que Cognos ou Power BI (un atout);Connaissance de VBA, R, ou Python (un atout).
Informations complémentaires
Les avantages (!): 
Salaire compétitif; 3 semaines de vacances payées dès l'embauche **;Régime d'assurance collective complet; REER collectif avec contribution équivalente de l'employeur; Programme de référence; Rabais exclusifs aux employés sur les pièces de n'importe quel site Kenny; Évènements sociaux (BBQ, Tire sur neige, tirages, party de Noel, etc.);Vêtements fournis.
Kenny U-Pull est une filiale d'American Iron & Metal (AIM) Inc, un leader mondial reconnu dans l'industrie du recyclage des métaux avec plus de 125 sites, 3500 employés dans le monde entier et plus de 3,5 milliards de dollars de ventes annuelles. AIM et ses filiales offrent des chances égales d'emploi à tous. Le masculin est uniquement utilisé afin d'alléger le texte. Seules les personnes retenues pour entrevue seront contactées. Merci de votre intérêt. 
 Le quota de vacances est calculé au prorata de la période d’activité dans l’année.
companyDescription:
KENNY U-PULL - a division of AIM - offers a brand-new concept in self-service retailing of used auto parts, a highly economical solution for all kinds of used car parts.
 
 We offer an endless supply of used auto parts at a fraction of the manufacturer's price. Through a strict process, we prioritize security on our sites. Customers can come and buy or sell their vehicles with peace of mind.
 
 Concerned about the environment, we offer a second life to used cars and we have an outstanding recycling process for our non-reusable parts.
 
 With branches in Quebec, Ontario and one in the United States, KENNY U-PULL has 24 branches and over 22,000 used cars for parts in inventory.
 
 Visit our website for online inventory of cars available for parts and price list of parts.

jobTitle: Analyste, Données et Analytique (Modélisateur ou modélisatrice de données)
jobDescription:
Description

Description de poste

Appartenir à Air Canada, c’est appartenir à un symbole canadien, Air Canada récemment élue meilleur transporteur aérien en Amérique du Nord. Faites décoller votre carrière en vous joignant à notre équipe novatrice et diversifiée à l’avant-garde du transport aérien de passagers.

Air Canada est à la recherche d'un analyste des données et de l'analyse (modélisateur de données) talentueux pour contribuer à la conception et à la mise en œuvre de nos bases de données. Le candidat doit avoir une solide expérience en modélisation de données et doit démontrer une affinité pour travailler avec d'autres personnes afin de créer des solutions d'entrepôt de données (DW).

L’analyste, Données et Analytique, Modélisateur ou modélisatrice de données doit être une excellente communicatrice, tant à l’écrit qu’à l’oral, et avoir une expérience de travail avec les secteurs d’activité pour traduire les besoins et questions liés aux données de ces secteurs en exigences de projet ou d’amélioration. Elle doit avoir une solide expérience dans l’analyse des données et une expérience professionnelle en tant que modélisateur ou modélisatrice de données. Ce poste offre la possibilité de participer à de nouvelles solutions d’intelligence d’affaires et d’entrepôt de données, telles que des tableaux de bord et des rapports, des solutions de mégadonnées et de travailler avec de nombreux secteurs d’activité différents au sein de l’entreprise. La personne candidate participera à toutes les phases du cycle de développement des solutions d’intelligence d’affaires et d’entrepôt de données, et soutiendra les activités quotidiennes en ce qui concerne l’amélioration de la modélisation des données et le soutien de la plateforme existante.

Responsabilités
 Développer des modèles dimensionnels et des vues nécessaires à l’analyse des données et à la production de rapports.  Effectuer la consolidation et l’intégration des modèles de données pour intégrer les nouveaux silos de données sources des organisations à la plateforme de données.  Développer et maintenir des modèles de données dimensionnels conceptuels, logiques et physiques entièrement définis afin de s’assurer que les modèles d’information sont capables de répondre aux besoins des utilisateurs finaux et des développeurs.  Animer ou participer à des séances agiles pour évaluer, saisir et traduire des questions et des exigences commerciales complexes en architecture de données structurées et en exigences de cas d’utilisation de la modélisation de données.  Tenir des vérifications de modèles de données conceptuels et logiques avec les chefs des produits et experts en matière de données.  Être capable d’extraire de façon abstraite les principes généraux des spécifications et de conceptualiser et de concevoir un modèle de données.  Développer, améliorer et gérer le modèle de données conceptuel, le modèle logique de données d’entreprise et le modèle physique de données pour la plateforme de données.  Assurer la cartographie de la traçabilité des données dans toutes les mises en œuvre de la plateforme.  Comprendre les exigences d’intégrité des données référentielles en fonction des besoins de l’entreprise et y satisfaire. Développer ou aider à générer une cartographie des données de la source à la cible.  Comprendre et appliquer les concepts de conception relationnelle des entités logiques.  Développer des modèles de données et des stratégies de migration des données en utilisant les concepts des meilleures pratiques de modélisation des données, y compris le schéma en étoile, le schéma en flocon, etc.  Construire des couches d’agrégation de modèles et des schémas en étoile en particulier en tant qu’objets d’un modèle logique et physique. 
Qualifications
 Diplôme universitaire en informatique ou dans un domaine similaire, ou expérience pertinente.  Expérience dans la création et la gestion de modèles de données de niveau entreprise.  Expérience en modélisation relationnelle, en modélisation de domaine, en modélisation Data Vault et en modélisation dimensionnelle.  Expérience dans la gestion de métadonnées et leur utilisation dans des activités de modélisation.  Expérience en création de modèles de données et de structures de données en Teradata, SQL Server, PostgreSQL ou autre à l’aide d’ER/Studio Data Architect ou de la modélisation Erwin.  Plus de 5 ans d’expérience dans l’utilisation des techniques de modélisation suivantes : troisième forme normale, ERD, modélisation dimensionnelle (schéma en étoile).  Plus de 5 ans d’expérience avec les normes de gestion des données et les pratiques de modèles de données.  Connaissance approfondie de la modélisation conceptuelle et logique des données et familiarité avec les concepts de conception et d’optimisation des bases de données physiques.  Expérience avec les normes communes et les meilleures pratiques pour les éléments de données, les types de données et les formats de fichiers  Connaissance pratique des méthodologies de développement Waterfall et Agile.  Capacité à concevoir et à décrire la vue d’ensemble.  Solides compétences quantitatives et analytiques.  Capacité éprouvée à travailler rapidement avec plusieurs parties prenantes clés.  Capable de diriger un environnement d’entreprise de grande envergure et de s’assurer que les processus de données organisationnels appropriés sont respectés.  Analyse et profilage des données, et ingénierie inverse des données. Forte connaissance des architectures de bases de données relationnelles et multidimensionnelles.  Excellentes habiletés pour les relations interpersonnelles.  Solides compétences en communication, orale et écrite.  Connaissance de SQL. 
Conditions D’emploi
 Les candidats doivent avoir le droit de travailler dans le pays choisi au moment où un emploi leur est offert. Il incombe entièrement aux employés posant leur candidature d’obtenir les permis de travail, les visas ou toutes autres autorisationsrequises pour le poste. 
Exigences Linguistiques

À compétences égales, la préférence sera accordée aux candidats bilingues.

Diversité et inclusion

Air Canada est résolument engagée en faveur de la diversité et de l’inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et gratifiant qui met en valeur la contribution unique de nos employés au succès de notre entreprise.

En tant qu'employeur qui garantit l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, nous encourageons les candidatures les plus diverses afin de pouvoir nous doter d’un effectif varié et représentatif de nos clients et des communautés où nous vivons et offrons nos services.

Air Canada remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt, mais seules les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue seront contactées.
companyDescription:
Canada's largest airline, the country’s flag carrier and a founding member of Star Alliance, the world's most comprehensive air transportation network celebrating its 25thanniversary in 2022, Air Canada provides scheduled passenger service directly to 51 airports in Canada, 51 in the United States and 86 internationally. It is the only international network carrier in North America to receive a Four-Star ranking from Skytrax, which in 2021 gave Air Canada awards for the Best Airline Staff in North America, Best Airline Staff in Canada, Best Business Class Lounge in North America, and an excellence award for its management of the COVID-19 pandemic. 

**

Air Canada est la plus importante société aérienne du Canada, le transporteur national du pays et un membre cofondateur du réseau Star Alliance — le plus vaste regroupement mondial de sociétés aériennes, qui célèbre son 25e anniversaire en 2022. Les lignes passagers régulières d’Air Canada relient sans escale 51 aéroports au Canada, 51 aux États-Unis et 86 sur le reste du globe. En Amérique du Nord, Air Canada constitue le seul transporteur aérien d’envergure internationale offrant une gamme complète de services à détenir la cote quatre étoiles de Skytrax qui, en 2021, lui a décerné les prix Meilleur personnel au sol et à bord en Amérique du Nord, Meilleur personnel au sol et à bord au Canada, Meilleur salon de classe affaires en Amérique du Nord ainsi qu’un Prix d’excellence pour sa gestion de la pandémie de la COVID-19.

jobDescription:
Titre d'emploi:Analyste de données en actuariatStatut:RégulierSommaire:En tant qu’analyste de données en actuariat, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l’extraction, la manipulation et l’analyse des données nécessaires au suivi du portefeuille de votre direction. Vos travaux permettront notamment d’effectuer le suivi efficace des métriques du secteur de l’assurance des entreprises, le tout en mode hybride.Vous avez une excellente compréhension des bases de données et de la production de rapports. Vous aimeriez collaborer avec les actuaires sur divers projets afin que les besoins et les intentions de gestion du secteur soient bien répondues. Vous aimeriez utiliser vos compétences en programmation pour relever les défis du poste en utilisant les divers outils mis à votre disposition pour effectuer vos analyses. Vous êtes le candidat que nous recherchons !Vous vous réaliserez dans les fonctions suivantes :Développer, produire et maintenir des rapports de suivi ou des tableaux de bordAnalyser ceux-ci pour diagnostiquer la santé des portefeuilles de l'assurance des entreprises et identifier les tendances émergentesActualiser et générer des rapports, et les distribuer aux dirigeants et aux divers intervenantsSoutenir l’actuariat dans l’extraction, la manipulation et la valorisation de la donnée dans les différentes analyses de l’équipeParticiper et/ou prendre en charge des analyses non-tarifaires, notamment au niveau de l’analytique d’affaireProposer et incorporer des améliorations continues aux outils et aux rapports existants tout en priorisant les travaux les plus importants au sein de l’équipe.Vos talents et qualifications :Baccalauréat en statistiques, en mathématiques, en administration ou l’équivalentExpérience pertinente de 5 ans dans un poste similaireConnaissance approfondie des langages de base de données et de programmation (SAS, R, SQL), ainsi que des méthodes et des outils statistiques.Expérience dans le domaine de l’assurance de dommages (un atout)Avoir de bonnes capacités d’analyse, de résolution de problèmes et de planificationMaitriser de la langue française tant parlée qu’écrite.Une carrière dans une entreprise où la collaboration et la diversité des expertises sont mises à l’avant-plan vous intéresse ? Joignez-vous à notre grande équipe composée de plus de 5 000 employés bienveillants!Nous souscrivons à un programme d’accès à l’égalité et encourageons les femmes, les minorités visibles et les autochtones à présenter leur candidature.Appellation interne :

Analyste technique en actuariat d'être : Les gens sont au cœur de nos actions. Nous les accompagnons dans leurs projets de vie en leur apportant la tranquillité d'esprit et nous contribuons au bien-être de la collectivité. Suivez-nous sur Instagram ! @beneva.ca

Please review the following job description:
RMA was founded in 1996. Its head office is in the financial district of Toronto, Canada with market representation in the United States. RMA is a member company of Truist Insurance, a division of Truist Financial Corporation. RMA is a licensed Life and Health Agency with Property and Casualty Broker licenses throughout Canada. Its primary focus is to provide flexible and innovative ideas, technical expertise and customized solutions to leading insurance and reinsurance companies both in Canada and USA. Our team consists of actuaries, underwriters, claims and treaty professionals as well as reinsurance administrative specialists.
RMA offers worksite flexibility and teammates may elect to work hybrid or permanently from home. Teammates will be required to attend the Company offices for regular collaboration days and/or other department or Company meetings as required.
Teammates are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to work on RMA’s premises and as a condition of employment. Accommodations will be made for teammates who cannot be vaccinated due to medical reasons or any other protected ground under human rights legislation.
Overview
The Data Analyst reports to the Vice President, Financial Solutions in the Life Reinsurance Division. The incumbent will have a balanced mandate of both modelling and technical support accountabilities. Responsibilities to include assisting in the modelling of mortality projections, preparing data files for quarter end process, supporting the enhancement of Moody’s AXIS models and helping to build and test an experience studies system.
Principal Accountabilities
Data Analysis
Analysis and summarization of client-provided dataAid with experience analysis for new business quotes. Data file preparation for quarter-end financial reporting process. 
Database Consolidation and Evaluation
Assist with the development of pricing models and tools. Assist with the development of SQL Server and MS Access databases. Consolidation, evaluation and reconciliation of MS Excel spreadsheets, text files and databases. 
Data Quality Review
Use of R or Python software required along with MS Excel. Reconciliation and evaluation of data within SQL server or MS Access. Coordinate with external systems to integrate outputs/inputs of AXIS with databases. 
Ad Hoc Requests:
Assist with pricing model setup, automation of tasks within Excel and other statistical/data manipulations tasks not mentioned. Assist with Longevity pricing as required. (Might be tasked with assist Life Reinsurance modelling tasks in Moody’s AXIS). 
Position Requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree from data science, statistical, mathematical, actuarial or similar programs or Actuarial exams along with other bachelor’s degree. College diploma with strong data analysis and database experience will be considered. 
Knowledge
Understanding of Linear Regression. High-level knowledge of insurance, reinsurance or life contingencies strongly preferred. 
Skills
Must have very strong communication skills. The candidate should be able to explain data quality and other issues in plan and simple language to various non-technical stakeholders (internal and external)Very strong analytical and problem-solving skills. A self-starter with strong collaboration skills. Ability to deal with other technical professionals (mathematical/actuarial). Highly proficient in MS-Office tools, especially MS-Excel and MS-Access. Experience with mortality forecasting algorithms preferred. Experience with either R, Python or other programming languages. Prefer working knowledge of data manipulation inside programming languages. Strong SQL and Database knowledge required, such as SQL Server, MS Access or others. Experience with MS Power BI, Tableau or similar is an asset. 
Experience
Previous work experience, including co-op or summer work term(s) preferred.

companyDescription:
CRC Group is one of the largest wholesale insurance distributors in the U.S. 

CRC Group consists of three divisions, Commercial Solutions, Group & Individual Solutions, and Specialty Programs.  The CRC Group family of brands includes CRC, TAPCO, Insurisk, CRC Programs, 5Star, The ABC Program, Negley, Professional Insurance Concepts, Pro-Praxis, SHU, Target, JH Blades, CRC Voluntary Benefits, Ethos Underwriting Services, and Hanleigh. 

CRC Group’s insurance offerings and practice groups range from commercial property, casualty, professional lines, small business, transportation, environmental, construction, energy, healthcare, hospitality, manufacturing & distribution, public entity, and real estate, to personal lines, disability, voluntary benefits, and more. 

CRC Group has the largest collection of actionable data in the wholesale business and we are putting it to use to consistently deliver better outcomes and more efficient results for our clients. We leverage data to provide a better client experience through limits benchmarking reports, amendatory endorsements, comparison tools, form review library, and property risk assessment reports. We have unveiled the REDY platform, which uses data and analytics to help clients win. In addition, we offer products exclusively available from CRC Group through our Insurisk brand. Our Claims Advocacy team is another way we strive to enhance the client experience, our dedicated team is ready to assist even after the policy is placed, we are here to help in the event of a difficult claim, as well. 

These are just some of the ways CRC Group is placing you first.

jobTitle: Analyst, Data Specialist, Client Services (12 month contract)
jobDescription:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
This is a 12 month contract position to support data quality and data remediation activities against Capital Markets product involving Corporate and Institutional clients that maintain relationships with CIBC entities globally, namely Canada, USA, UK, Luxembourg and Asia Pacific offices . On a daily basis you will execute a series of tasks using various applications, in order to help ensure that our Capital Markets clients who are actively booking (e.g., loans and trade finance products) or trading a variety of Capital Markets financial instruments (e.g., equity, fixed income, hedging products, etc.) have the correct mandatory data on file to fulfill our AML (Anti-Money Laundering), Regulatory and Tax reporting requirements. You’ll support your teammates in executing more complex processes, e.g., research and client outreach coordination as well as ad hoc clean up activities, all to support our client experience and data governance objectives.
At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.
How You’ll Succeed
Process Execution and Data Accuracy – Required to execute a variety of lightly to moderately complex processes whose primary objective is to ensure that our client data is accurate and fulsome to meet all mandatory data requirements. Detail Orientation - You will analyze data for certain products types and ensure information has been appropriately captured while verifying the information across various platforms. You will need to ensure our due diligence and governance practices have been followed before updating various systems. Proactive Questioning and Understanding - You will need to have a good understanding of client data by reviewing the information presented, and determine course of action to capture accurate client information. You must have a curious mindset and ask questions if the data presented requires further clarification.Collaboration – Must be able to work closely with your team and other teams to deliver assigned deliverables flawlessly and as per agreed-upon timeline in order to provide exceptional client service for our internal and external clients. This will require attention to detail as you encounter different scenarios that require you to collaborate with your teammates in order to achieve the desired outcome. Learning and Development – As part of a team executing various processes on a daily basis, your ability to absorb knowledge on your own by reading relevant policies, standards and procedeurs and learn from your manager and team members, will be key in helping you obtain the process knowledge to execute all processes on our roster and to be truly flexible in the variety of tasks you help execute. Learning when to escalate will also be an important developmental area.Communication: You have strong communication skills to provide prompt responses and updates to relevant teams and stakeholders in order to meet all deliverable timelines.You can demonstrate experience in a fast paced-environment, where multi-tasking, time management to prioritize and re-prioritize as per change mandate is key. You’re also self-sufficient, can work with ambiguity and have an analytical mind that allows you to understand issues and question solutions. You have working knowledge and experience with Capital Markets products and the data involved with Investment/Asset Managers and Funds. You are curious and resourceful during data investigation and research activities. Workflow knowledge in Client Life Cycle Application such as Fenergo and other client information database an asset.
Who You Are
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you truly live and exude our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability – and these are at the forefront of your actions on a daily basis, as we work through successes and challenges.You're passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.You're driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.
What You Need To Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.comYou need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
Job Location
Toronto-161 Bay St., 9th
Employment Type
Temporary (Fixed Term)
Weekly Hours
37.5
Skills
Business Effectiveness, Capital Markets
companyDescription:
CIBC is here to help all our clients reach their goals.  

We know the importance of reliable financial products and services, and we’re dedicated to providing them in a way that lets you bank however you want, whenever you want. 

With innovative tools designed around your priorities and a team fully focused on your success, you’ll get the insights you need to get even closer to achieving your goals. 

This culture of innovation and shared values of trust, teamwork and accountability are why we’ve been named a top employer in Canada. They’re also why a career at CIBC is more than a job—it’s an opportunity to grow and work alongside some of the brightest in Canada.  

La Banque CIBC est là pour aider tous nos clients à atteindre leurs objectifs. 

Nous connaissons l'importance de produits et services financiers fiables, et nous nous engageons à les fournir d'une manière qui vous permette d'effectuer vos opérations bancaires comme vous le souhaitez, quand vous le souhaitez. 

Avec des outils innovants conçus autour de vos priorités et une équipe entièrement centrée sur votre réussite, vous obtiendrez les informations dont vous avez besoin pour vous rapprocher encore plus de vos objectifs. 

Cette culture de l'innovation et les valeurs partagées de confiance, de travail d'équipe et de responsabilité sont la raison pour laquelle nous avons été nommés l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada. C'est aussi pourquoi une carrière à la Banque CIBC est plus qu'un emploi : c'est une occasion de grandir et de travailler aux côtés de certaines des personnes plus brillantes au Canada.

jobDescription:
Company Description
Are You Looking for a Great Place to Work? #Jointhegame 
Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft® has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the “Top 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads” from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt®, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney®, Marvel®, Hasbro®, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel® and Ferrari®. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company.
All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.
Job Description
Job Description
During the internship period, you will be assigned to a specific project and collaborate closely with our live game teams product managers, game economy designers, game designers and user acquisition managers, under the supervision of the lead data analyst and the monetization director. Together with other data analysts, data scientists and data engineers, you will be able to deep dive into our massive player data in-game, predict, segment and analyze player behaviours.
From the beginning of your adventure with us, you will be called to
Build both large systematic reports and one-off small pieces of analysisProvide ongoing reporting and performance monitoring from multiple data sourcesCreate performant SQL scripts for game analysisProactively develop new analyses and insights, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetizationDebug and solve issues to ensure the delivery of accurate metrics
Qualifications
Qualifications
Last year study of a degree in computer science, applied mathematics, data science or another technical field with strong IT skillsAdvanced SQL skills; experience querying large complex data sets, experience with window functionsFamiliar with data visualizationRelevant experience performing quantitative analysis, preferably for gaming, internet or technology companyBasic statistics knowledgeStrong presentation skills; effectively present insights from quantitative analysis to a non-analytical audienceAutonomous and team player, detail-orientedPassion for video games
Additional Information
Additional information
What We Offer
Salary $17/hr, 37.5 hrs/weekHybrid approach to work to give you work-life balanceFlexible working hours to suit your scheduleEmployee Assistance Program; because sometimes we need a helping handSocial Club events with awesome prizes and giveawaysDog-friendly Studio
Why join the Gameloft universe?
Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience, within a company that is constantly growing!Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers!Because you want to join a global company and meet great people around the world from all walks of life.Or, just because you’re looking for a great place to work!
We can’t wait to find our next great talent!
Please submit your CV, cover letter and portfolio or work examples (if applicable)Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted and your CV will be saved in our files for a period of 6 months.
Gameloft Toronto is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering diversity and inclusivity within our work environment. Gameloft Toronto welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, Gameloft Toronto has been developing and publishing games since 2011. With over a decade of experience specializing in partnerships with major rights holders like Disney®, LEGO® and Mattel®, our close-knit group of creatives combine the innovation of an independent studio with the global presence of one of the leading video game companies in the world.

As the creator of hit games such as the long running Disney Magic Kingdoms, LEGO® Legacy: Heroes Unboxed & award-winning UNO™ & FRIENDS, Gameloft Toronto boasts a studio of characters where the diversity of Toronto and the best talent in the world shines through.

jobDescription:
NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a [[Microsoft Data Analytics Consultant]] to join our team in [[Victoria]], [[British Columbia]], [[Canada]].

We are currently seeking a Microsoft Data Analytics Consultant to join our team in Victoria, British Columbia (CA-BC), Canada (CA).

In the role of Microsoft Data Analytics Consultant, you will provide industry best practices to support our Canadian clients with deliverables that are focused on the Microsoft Analytics technology stack. You are adept at the entire software development lifecycle from facilitating requirements gathering sessions, creating solution designs (including ETL, semantic layer, and reporting), and managing deployments into multiple environments. You are experienced at developing solutions for on-premises solutions using tools such as SSIS, SSAS (Tabular), SSRS, and Power BI. Your T-SQL skills are intermediate to senior level.

Basic Qualifications
 Possess a college diploma or university degree focused on computer science, or equivalent experience  Minimum six (6) years’ experience working with on-premises Microsoft data warehouse solutions  Minimum five (5) years’ experience designing dimensional models (i.e. Kimball methodology)  Comfortable working in a hybrid or remote work scenario 

Mandatory Qualifications
 Experience working with SQL Server (2019 preferred), including DML and DDL  Six (6) years’ experience working with T-SQL  Five (5) years’ experience developing ETL solutions using a combination of SSIS and SSMS (stored procedures, functions, etc.)  Five (5) years’ experience developing Semantic Layers utilizing tools such as SSAS Tabular models, and/or Power BI data sets  Five (5) years’ experience designing and developing reporting solutions for on-premises architectures utilizing tools such as SSRS and Power BI 

Nice To Have Qualifications
 Fundamental understanding of the Power BI administration and governance framework  Experience integrating analytic content into SharePoint, specifically Power BI, Excel, and SSRS  Microsoft Azure cloud experience in particular Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL, Azure Analysis Services and Azure Synapse Analytics 

About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.

 NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.
companyDescription:
NTT DATA Services is a recognized leader in IT and business services including cloud, data and applications. A division of NTT DATA headquartered in Texas, the company leverages consulting and deep industry expertise to help clients accelerate and sustain value throughout their digital journeys.
 
NTT DATA – a part of NTT Group – is a trusted global innovator of IT and business services headquartered in Tokyo. We help clients transform through consulting, industry solutions, business process services, digital & IT modernization and managed services in over 50 countries.

jobDescription:
Overview
We're looking for an Analytics Solutions Engineer (Business Intelligence Analyst) for our Analytics and Data Lifecycle Services (ADLS) department.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing analytics solutions (e.g. dashboards, reports, conditional emails) and conducting analyses on a wide variety of issues (e.g., occupational health and safety, financial risk exposure, and disability management) using various sources of business data and communicating findings and related interpretations/observations with primarily, but not exclusively, an internal audience.
Join our analytics delivery team that has been quoted by a senior Microsoft analytics consultant as "leading the Canadian public sector in our maturity of analytics".
At this time, this is a hybrid position where you will work primarily at home and be on-site at our Richmond office occasionally.
What You'll Do
As an analytics solutions engineer, you will: 
 Develop analytics solutions such as reports, dashboards, analytics apps and conduct analyses on a wide variety of issues (e.g. occupational health and safety, financial risk exposure, disability management)  Capture, analyze, and document detailed requirements from our internal customers in order to design, develop, and support new and currently offered high quality business intelligence reporting solutions, both from strategic and operational perspectives  Collaborate with Data Engineers, Sr Analytics Solutions Engineers, Sr Analytics Specialists, Data Scientists, and Analytics Delivery Managers to collectively deliver the best value for the opportunity  Work in a fast-paced Agile-style delivery environment 
Is this a good fit for you?
We're Looking For Someone Who Can
 Design and develop solutions that will promote usability, standardization, and self-serve opportunities  Ensure that the client's changing solution requirements are fulfilled in a timely manner and translated into workable solutions  Turn data into information and information into actionable intelligence that drives an improved decision  Stay abreast of emerging technologies that utilize analytics principles  Conduct data discovery, with minimal documentation, and navigate large complex data models to find what the customer is looking for  Write SQL as second nature and have used BI/analytics solution software (e.g. Power BI) 
Your Experience And Educational Background
 A Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business  A minimum of 18 months of directly related experience working in an analytics delivery capacity.  Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal  Other combinations of education and experience may be considered 
Application Requirements
You will be required to successfully meet WorkSafeBC's requirements with regards to a criminal record clearance.
If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) at the time you submit your application.
Who are we?
At WorkSafeBC, we're dedicated to promoting safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation, and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We also work diligently to sustain our workers compensation system for today and future generations. We're honoured to serve the 2.4 million workers and 245,000 registered employers in our province.
WorkSafeBC's COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the "Policy") is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect.
We recognize that our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences, and which reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply.
What's it like to work at WorkSafeBC?
It's challenging, stimulating and hugely rewarding. Our positions offer tremendous diversity and excellent opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important and so are the people we do it for.
Our Benefits
Being part of WorkSafeBC means being part of a strong, committed team. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes vacation, optional leave arrangements, health care and dental benefits, and contributions toward your retirement pension. As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that can help you get the most out of work - and life.
WorkSafeBC has adopted a hybrid model offering opportunities to work remotely and onsite based on the operational needs of the position.
Learn More About What We Offer .
This position is restricted to those legally entitled to work in Canada.
Thank you, in advance, for applying.
Value

jobTitle: Data Analyst, Strategic Partnerships( Bangkok based)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Key Areas of Focus:
In this role, you’ll get to: 
Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape.
Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance.
Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives.
Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers
Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making.
Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management.
Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments.
What you’ll Need to Succeed: 
4 years and above of experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areasEntrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on on the work Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders 
It’s Great if you have:  
Ability to write in SQL a plus, or willingness to learn Ability to use Tableau a plus, or willingness to learn Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics a plus companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

jobTitle: Data Analyst, Bariatric Centre of Excellence (BCOE)
jobDescription:
The primary role of this position is to ensure standard operating procedures (SOP) are developed and processes are monitored, to support the departmental data analytics.

Responsibilities & Activities
Conduct pre-processing checks on raw data to ensure data quality and integrityPerform and completes quality control checks following standard operating procedures to ensure data is accurate and of high qualityLead data processing workflowAnalyze the causes of errors and identify and communicate issues with manager and IT to ensure errors/issues get resolvedPre-process raw data to prepare for analysis. This includes cleaning and merging data from multiple sources, as well as understanding overall data quality. Conducts exploratory and statistical analysis of data to assess feasibility of new reportsAssist with data extraction, cleaning, predictive model and validation plans Completes cleaning/consistency checks and other quality control measures necessary for the final analysisStandardize and harmonize data from data sets to prepare for loading into database (if required)Validate any output tables, listings or figures generated to ensure accuracy and reliability of analysesConduct descriptive analyses from ad-hoc requests from manager and teamDevelop SOP in consultation with manager, outlining data analysis processes and resolutions to errors (i.e. a template to be followed to perform standard data analytics and ways to resolve specific issues).Notify manager of any issues and errors with code/analysisProduce high quality ad hoc and standardized reports customized and tailored to different end-users (e.g. clinicians, manager, external reporting agencies (if required))Collaborate with customers to develop new processes and solutions to meet their analytics needs Develops a process to validate information to ensure accurate information is being provided as clinical program decisions will be made using this information All staff are expected to carry out their assigned duties and responsibilities in a manner which prioritizes patient and employee safety and confidentiality. Key accountabilities in this regard include:Strict compliance with patient/employee confidentiality practices and policies Strict compliance with patient/employee safety practices and standards.Appropriate identification, reporting and response to patient/employee confidentiality breaches in accordance with established policies and proceduresAppropriate identification, reporting and response to patient/employee safety risks and incidents/events in accordance with established policies and procedures.
Knowledge & Skills
At least 2 years of relevant work experience with computer applications including ADT and SoarianMust be detail orientedDemonstrated ability to manage statistical programming activities Proficient with MS Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)Experience using key BI software such as Tableau is an assetExperience in healthcare is an asset
As a condition of employment, all external hires will be required to submit proof of COVID-19 vaccination or documentation unless a valid accommodation under the Ontario Human Rights Code exists. Please note, if you are extended an offer of employment, you will be required to provide proof of vaccination in Ontario QR Code format. All internal candidates must be in compliance with Unity Health Toronto’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy.
companyDescription:
Providence Healthcare is a leader in providing rehabilitation, palliative care, long-term care and community programs in Toronto. Providence Hospital offers inpatient and outpatient programs with a focus on rehabilitation for stroke and neurological conditions; hip fractures; lower limb amputations; and geriatric conditions associated with aging. Our community programs include the Adult Day Program for people with moderate to severe dementia, as well as family and caregiver support through the Scotiabank Learning Centre. Our Cardinal Ambrozic Houses of Providence provides quality long-term care in a warm and welcoming environment.

Our Catholic legacy of compassion and innovation dates back to 1857 when the Sisters of St. Joseph founded the original House of Providence as a refuge for the sick, the poor, the elderly and homeless. 

For more about Providence, please visit our website.

jobDescription:
Description
Data Analyst – Intelligent Automation
Halifax, Canada
About Citco
Citco is a global leader in fund services, corporate governance and related asset services with staff across 50 office locations worldwide. With more than $1.8 trillion in assets under administration, we deliver end-to-end solutions and exceptional service to meet our clients’ needs.
For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com
About The Team & Business Line
Fund Administration is Citco’s core business, and our alternative asset and accounting service is one of the industry’s most respected. Our continuous investment in learning and technology solutions means our people are equipped to deliver a seamless client experience.
As a core member of our Business Process Optimization team, you will be working with some of the industry’s most accomplished professionals to deliver award-winning services for complex fund structures that our clients can depend upon.
The Intelligent Automation (IA) is multi-skilled team charged with identifying, building, and deploying operational solutions by leveraging a suite of emerging technologies, such as Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Robotics Process Automation, Business Process Management, Reconciliation Tools, Cloud Services, and Business Intelligence Tools.
Your Role
The Data Analyst will be a key member of the Intelligent Automation (IA) team and will work directly with Senior VP on requirement gathering, documentation, establishing governance, and best practices for a new operational data lake. The incumbent will also help with data mapping, metadata management, and keeping data catalogues up to date.
You will elicits, captures, analyzes, refines, articulates and documents business requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria and data documentationWork with stakeholders to define reporting requirements, KPI, KRI, design front end visualizations if neededManaging metadata, data catalogue and mapping tables for Citco’s Data LakeWork with developers to document technical solution diagramsDevelop a strong understanding of evolving business requirements and corporate goals to provide data-backed insights/solutions that will guide strategy and growthPresent information through reports and visualization for a variety of stakeholdersEnsure clear and accurate communication of current status, dependencies and estimated delivery timelinesDevelop and update user/technical documentationParticipates in Scrum stand-up meetings, backlog grooming sessions, review and retrospective meetings.
About YouYou have a undergraduate degree in Business, Commerce, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a team environmentExcellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to present information/insight based on data to a varied audience including both business and technical stakeholdersExcellent listening and analytical skillsAble to work with multiple stakeholders to produce clearly articulated requirements for data projectsFamiliar with Data Warehouses and Data lakesProgramming knowledge in building and maintaining ETL using SQL/Python, etc.An asset:Financial product knowledge and knowledge of Hedge Fund Administration Understanding of agile project managementKnowledge of JIRA and Confluence Familiar with schema design and dimensional data modeling Familiar with data analysis and reporting, specifically creating interactive dashboards to provide actionable insight on specific business issues Familiar with using Qlik/PowerBI/Quicksight/Tableau 
Key Competencies
CommunicationProblem SolvingTeamworkDrive for ResultsAdaptabilityTechnical Knowledge and Commercial AcumenQuality and Risk Management
Our Benefits
Your well-being is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location.
We recognize diversity as a source of organizational pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization.
Citco welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection.
companyDescription:
Our heritage, since founding a civil law notary practice in the 1940s to establishing the Curacao International Trust Company in the 1960s, is built on challenging paradigms and delivering exceptional service within the financial and professional services industry. Today, we continue to pioneer award-winning services and technology solutions that meet ever changing markets.

A commitment to investing in people, and proprietary technologies, has resulted in our reputation as the industry’s preeminent service provider, reassuring clients that their critical administration functions are in safe hands. 

Our thought leadership and ability to quickly navigate complex change means our clients can depend on us as trusted advisors to make informed decisions in response to market conditions.

Our Divisions

Citco Fund Services & Investor Relations 
CFS is the global leader in services for the alternative investment industry. With over 2,000 funds under administration and net assets exceeding $840 billion, we provide full service fund administration, fund accounting, net asset value calculations, investor relations, and more.

Governance Services
Leveraging our extensive global office network Citco Governance Services provides customised solutions, including corporate and global subsidiary governance, secretarial services, financial accounting and reporting, tax and audit liaison, and market entry services.

Banking, Depositary & Custody Services
Citco Banks operate in strategic financial centres and provide Institutional and Fund of Funds clients access to the funds universe through multiple communication and online real-time global funds platforms.

Citco Technology Management
Through our eight global development centres, Citco Technology Management provides secure infrastructures and develops award-winning technology products that underpin our commitment to service excellence.

jobDescription:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
Joining the Canadian Tire team in the FGL Sports division, you will be working as part of a team of data management analysts. Your role as a Data Analyst will be to support the Data Architecture in the development of various query requirements across multiple enterprise database sources. You will design, implement and manage the structure of reporting systems. The Data Analyst is responsible for data extraction initiatives from our various systems, validation with business departments for ad hoc requests and project developments.
Main responsibility
Support various business requests by being responsible for the optimization and creation of SQL queries.Design, build, deliver and manage models and reports using Excel and Power BIPresent data from multiple enterprise database sources.Participate in the data architecture and data solution design of our various systems.Collaborate with analysts in the development of connections and extractions with our various databases ((DataLake, Dynamics AX or Dynamics 365, Azure, I Hub ingestion).Support data validations during the integration of systems under different platformsAnalyze impacts in existing systems during change requests; Analyze and collaborate on structural specifications for new software and applicationsDevelop an in-depth understanding of the various processesSupport process documentation and provide automation recommendationsParticipate in workshops to gather requirements and provide recommendations for reporting and BI solutionsConvert processes into functional requirements clearly and understandable to developers and project teams.Leverage knowledge of specific data products available as well as visualization capabilities to improve requirements and offer relevant suggestions to stakeholders.Prioritize tasks with the team and ensure the availability of forward-looking roadmaps for features to be delivered on data products under the team's purview.Collaborate with the Business Intelligence analysts and IT department in the realization of various requirements, as well as maintenance and evolution activities.
Your Qualifications And Skills
Bachelor's degree in quantitative discipline (mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics)3+ years of experience in data analytics and good understanding of data architecture.Working knowledge of AI and data warehouse concepts and terminology;Excellent Excel skills, especially with the use of advanced formulas and macros.Strong knowledge of SQL, ETL, Power BI (report design & visualization) and Microsoft Azure.Experience in Microsoft Dynamics AX or Dynamics 365 (asset) or knowledge of Thoughtspot (asset)Experience in analysis, modeling, verification, and development of business and technical requirements methodologies.Ability to establish, document and communicate data modeling standards, policies, guidelines, and governance structures. Ability to prioritize projects within timelines.Self-motivated and able to work independentlyExcellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to relate and describe situations with data; Ability to explain complex phenomena clearly and concisely to any type of hearingThorough person with a passion for quality and innovative technologies.Excellent command of French and English, both oral and written
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.
To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.
Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
companyDescription:
FGL Sports Ltd.—acquired by Canadian Tire Corporation in 2011.

Franchise banners: Sport Chek, Sports Experts, Atmosphere, National Sports, Intersport, Nevada Bob's Golf, Hockey Experts, Pro-Hockey Life, Sports Rousseau and L'entrepôt du Hockey.

The earliest days of FGL Sports dates back to 1974, when John Forzani, former chairman of the board for The Forzani Group Ltd., opened a retail location called Forzani’s Locker Room in Calgary, which sold athletic footwear, apparel, and sports equipment. The years to follow saw retail expansion and a number of business acquisitions. It continued in the early 1990s with the acquisition of Sport Chek International Ltd. in 1991, and Hogarth's Sport & Ski the following year. In the two decades leading to today, the company continued its expansion acquiring brand names such as Coast Mountain Sport, Sport Mart, Nevada Bob’s Golf, National Sports, Fitness Source, and Athletes World.

In 2011, Forzani Group Ltd. was acquired by Canadian Tire Corporation and renamed FGL Sports, making it Canada’s ultimate sports retailer with over 1,000 stores across the country.

jobTitle: Senior People Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Get To Know Our Team
The People Team is a purveyor of opportunity, searching the globe for the most talented individuals and offering them an open, collaborative workplace. By prioritizing skill and potential, we have cultivated a powerful assembly of professionals through our drive for equal opportunity and diversity. We make the move to Agoda a breeze with assisted onboarding programs, and we continue to support and enrich our thousands of Agoda employees through individual growth with outstanding learning programs and various means of assistance. Our development of incredible benefits has ensured everyone can stay strong, healthy, and happy during their time at Agoda. Leading ambitious changes and making a positive impact in the lives of our employees, the People Team is a crucial and rewarding part of the Agoda family.
The Opportunity
The Senior People Data Analyst will contribute to the People Planning & Analytics organizations’ success by providing pro-active analysis around People data, working with People Team and other Business stakeholders to identify patterns and provide actionable recommendations. As part of the organization, you’ll be working actively on budgeting activities and process and progressive improvement of the tools and processes of the team. This role collaborates closely with Finance and People team stakeholders to ensure activities are aligned with Agoda’s strategic goals and Personnel budget. The rapid growth of the business and the increasing complexity driven by new launches and services make this an exciting, and challenging proposition.
In this Role you’ll get, 
 Add immediate value to the organization by delivering insightful analysis, dashboards and presentations to business & leadership about People data (recruitment, attrition, performance) to support long-term strategic decision making  Get involved in the operational Budgeting and Workforce planning of the company  Provide financial analysis & commentary on month-end financials & KPIs/OKRs Be a trusted advisor to Business Partners across the organizationEnhance the understanding and key levers of the Agoda business 
What You’ll Need To Succeed
 Bachelor’s degree required  3-5 years of experience as Data analyst, preferably in an HR environment  2-3 years of practical experience with MSSQL (or equivalent database), Tableau visualization  High level of discretion, confidentiality and ethics  Ability to work well with employees in a highly multi-cultural environment  Strong attention to detail and accuracy  Self-starter with ability to work independently, while also collaborating with cross-functional teams  Ownership mindset and ability to meet tight deadlines with a logical, methodical approach to prioritizing tasks and responsibilities 
Great if you have
 Experience with OneStream software  Workforce planning and Budgeting experience  Commercial awareness, ability to think both analytically and strategically, to identify about underlying business issues Willingness to challenge the status quo and propose improvements in existing processesCuriosity and willingness to get involved in the business to understand the story behind the numbers jobDescription:
En travaillant chez Rona Inc., vous bénéficierez de nombreux avantages, dont les suivants :
Un centre de conditionnement physique, des activités sportives et des douchesUn centre de la petite enfance pouvant accueillir 78 enfantsUne cafétéria avec un menu de qualité cuisiné par un chef dédié, des options santé et des stations de café Brûleries FARO et Tim HortonsDes rabais exclusifs aux employé(e)s, en plus d’un rabais de 10 % en magasin (dans toutes les enseignes de Rona Inc. )Des avantages sociaux : régime de retraite, primes annuelles, programme d’encouragement aux études, etc.Des horaires flexibles et du télétravailBornes de recharge pour voitures électriquesPossibilité d’évoluer au sein de l’organisationUn environnement de travail inclusif et sécuritaireUne sensibilité à l’équilibre travail-vie personnelleUn employeur engagé dans sa communautéEt plus encore!
Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d’alléger le texte. Rona Inc. est déterminée à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.
Chez RONA, plus de 26 000 employé(e)s cultivent leur passion chaque jour. Nos équipes sont animées par la volonté d’aider nos clients à faire de leurs projets une réalité, et engagées à faire une différence dans les communautés où nous sommes établis.
Nous exploitons ou desservons quelque 450 magasins corporatifs et marchands affiliés indépendants. Grâce à une offre de produits et services unique et à des formats complémentaires allant des quincailleries de quartier aux magasins de grande surface, nos enseignes RONA, Lowe’s, Réno-Dépôt et Dick’s Lumber sont outillées pour répondre à tous les besoins des rénovateurs amateurs, des rénovateurs expérimentés et des professionnels de la construction.
Vous avez le talent? Nous avons les outils! Chez nous, votre travail et vos idées contribuent à bâtir une organisation florissante. Votre voix sera toujours entendue et valorisée. Vous trouverez des possibilités de carrière à la mesure de vos ambitions et pourrez développer encore davantage l’ensemble de compétences qui vous rend unique.
Si vous cherchez à faire ce que vous aimez, nous pourrions être parfaits l’un pour l’autre.
Milieu de travail 
Notre siège social étant situé à Boucherville, sur la Rive-Sud de Montréal, nous savons que les travaux dans le tunnel Louis-Hippolyte-La Fontaine peuvent être une source d’inquiétude pour nos employés. C’est pourquoi nous avons mis sur pied un comité consultatif en interne et implanté de nouvelles politiques de travail offrant encore davantage de flexibilité à nos équipes, peu importe leur lieu de résidence. Qu’il s’agisse de télétravail ou d’heures flexibles – lorsqu’un rôle exige une présence au bureau –, nous réévaluons constamment nos pratiques pour offrir à nos employés le meilleur environnement de travail possible.
Nos attentes
Envie de vivre l’expérience unique d’accélérer la croissance d’une équipe dynamique, en pleine croissance et de plus en plus visible et influente au sein de Rona Inc. ? Nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne exceptionnelle qui jouera un rôle clé dans la croissance à long terme des produits d’exploitation et des bénéfices liés aux affaires en ligne de Rona Inc.
L’analyste fera partie intégrante de l’équipe Expérience de la catégorie en ligne. Le ou la titulaire du poste devra analyser les termes pour les recherches en ligne et déterminer les optimisations à apporter aux résultats de recherche pour améliorer l’expérience client. Ces travaux permettront d’améliorer la satisfaction des clients et des associé(e)s, en plus d’augmenter l’achalandage, les ventes et le taux de conversion.
Nous cherchons une personne ambitieuse, dynamique, motivée et axée sur la croissance, qui redéfinira la trajectoire de notre objectif stratégique essentiel chez Rona Inc. Si vous vous reconnaissez dans cette description, continuez votre lecture pour en savoir plus sur le poste!
Le rôle
Analyser les principales données analytiques Web, les rétroactions de la clientèle et l’étalonnage concurrentiel pour fournir des idées et des recommandations sur les occasions d’amélioration pour la recherche en ligne par catégorie qui auront le plus grand impactAméliorer les résultats des recherches en ligne en utilisant Adobe Analytics et Google Analytics pour Lowe’s, RONA et Réno-Dépôt et recommander des améliorations pour augmenter la conversion et réduire le taux de sortieEffectuer une analyse hebdomadaire de la catégorie, des projets spécifiques à la catégorie et un blitz de recherche pour améliorer la conversion des recherches, l’adresse nulle et les principaux termes de recherchePrendre en charge les tâches liées à la recherche en ligne comme la formulation des mots clés, l’indexation des recherches, le mappage des synonymes, le renforcement des éléments, l’ajout de filtres et la redirection de mises en œuvreCollaborer avec les équipes de produits, de mise en marché en ligne et de marketing, ainsi qu’avec d’autres équipes pour agir en tant que spécialiste des pratiques exemplaires en matière de recherche en ligneAjuster les règles des algorithmes et fournir des conseils et des recommandations sur l’optimisation du moteur de recherche interneFournir des idées et des recommandations pour élaborer et influencer le plan d’amélioration de l’expérience de la catégorie en ligne et aider à définir les stratégies à court terme du serviceEffectuer des analyses postérieures et créer des recommandations pour ajuster les optimisations futures
Les compétences que nous recherchons
Baccalauréat en administration des affaires, en marketing, en finance ou dans un domaine connexeExcellentes compétences analytiques et capacités éprouvées en production de renseignements exploitablesAu moins 5 années d’expérience en application d’outils d’analytique Web (de l’expérience avec Adobe Analytics sera considérée comme un atout)Solides connaissances des pratiques exemplaires en matière de commerce électroniqueSolides aptitudes en relations interpersonnelles, en communication et en motivation (discussions, rédaction, présentations)Capacité démontrée de gérer de multiples projets à la fois (établissement de l’ordre de priorité, planification et délégation des tâches)Agilité et capacité de travailler dans un environnement qui évolue rapidementAptitudes en gestion de projets (de l’expérience avec JIRA est considérée comme un atout)
Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d’alléger le texte. Rona Inc. est déterminée à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

jobDescription:
Description:* The New Verticals contractor position will focus on one of our very important teams helping build the catalogs to support our Merchants. On the Catalog Launch and Catalog Updates team, you will be working with large amounts of inventory data provided by our new grocery and convenience partners to best prepare them for launch on the platform or updating their current catalog. You will own and collaborate on catalog building, updating, and process development + improvement.. You’ll become an expert in our Grocery product taxonomy and how to make a large amount of inventory data fit with our pre-existing layout to make shopping convenient and fun for Consumers. Leveraging catalog data across our different vertical stakeholder and partners to build, refresh, and maintain product categories, items, and collections.Utilizing and pulling data from SQL queries from our pre-built library” to build catalogs in Google Sheets to upload to our platform using multiple different formulas for a single catalog.Partner with cross functional stakeholders and give feedback to help develop new, specialized products and tools for the team to use.Become an expert in building and refining catalogs to give the Merchant the best quality catalog to enhance the shopping experience. *Additional Skills & Qualifications:* 1. Bilingual in French and English - written and verbal 2. Proficient in Excel - index matching 3. 8000 kph, 100% accuracyStrong understanding of Google Sheets formulas and finding ways to simplify working with large amounts of data -Comfortable pulling and synthesizing data through SQL and modeling within Sheets with formulas (NICE TO HAVE) -Strong verbal, written communication and attention to detail. -Proven ability to prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment, with a strong bias to action

jobDescription:
Titre d'emploi:

Analyste de données en actuariat

Statut:

Régulier

Sommaire:

En tant qu’analyste de données en actuariat, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l’extraction, la manipulation et l’analyse des données nécessaires au suivi du portefeuille de votre direction. Vos travaux permettront notamment d’effectuer le suivi efficace des métriques du secteur de l’assurance des entreprises, le tout en mode hybride.

Vous avez une excellente compréhension des bases de données et de la production de rapports. Vous aimeriez collaborer avec les actuaires sur divers projets afin que les besoins et les intentions de gestion du secteur soient bien répondues. Vous aimeriez utiliser vos compétences en programmation pour relever les défis du poste en utilisant les divers outils mis à votre disposition pour effectuer vos analyses. Vous êtes le candidat que nous recherchons !

Vous vous réaliserez dans les fonctions suivantes :
Développer, produire et maintenir des rapports de suivi ou des tableaux de bordAnalyser ceux-ci pour diagnostiquer la santé des portefeuilles de l'assurance des entreprises et identifier les tendances émergentesActualiser et générer des rapports, et les distribuer aux dirigeants et aux divers intervenantsSoutenir l’actuariat dans l’extraction, la manipulation et la valorisation de la donnée dans les différentes analyses de l’équipeParticiper et/ou prendre en charge des analyses non-tarifaires, notamment au niveau de l’analytique d’affaireProposer et incorporer des améliorations continues aux outils et aux rapports existants tout en priorisant les travaux les plus importants au sein de l’équipe. 

Vos talents et qualifications :
Baccalauréat en statistiques, en mathématiques, en administration ou l’équivalentExpérience pertinente de 5 ans dans un poste similaireConnaissance approfondie des langages de base de données et de programmation (SAS, R, SQL), ainsi que des méthodes et des outils statistiques. Expérience dans le domaine de l’assurance de dommages (un atout)Avoir de bonnes capacités d’analyse, de résolution de problèmes et de planificationMaitriser de la langue française tant parlée qu’écrite. 

Une carrière dans une entreprise où la collaboration et la diversité des expertises sont mises à l’avant-plan vous intéresse ? Joignez-vous à notre grande équipe composée de plus de 5 000 employés bienveillants!

Nous souscrivons à un programme d’accès à l’égalité et encourageons les femmes, les minorités visibles et les autochtones à présenter leur candidature.

Appellation interne : Analyste technique en actuariat

Raison d'être : Les gens sont au cœur de nos actions. Nous les accompagnons dans leurs projets de vie en leur apportant la tranquillité d'esprit et nous contribuons au bien-être de la collectivité. 

Suivez-nous sur Instagram ! 

@beneva.ca
