jobDescription:
Description

This is about you. Your passion, purpose and potential. In you we see care, drive, confidence and curiosity. When you join our team, you can expect intensity, excitement and energy. Through our culture of people development, we are committed to the continuous learning and growth of our teams.

As a Server, you anticipate guest needs, exude genuine warmth and care, and seek opportunities to deliver the unexpected. Guests trust your expertise and recommendations as you are always building on your knowledge to deliver a world-class experience. You have a passion for hospitality and are a team player who thrives in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment.

Core Values
You value honesty and humility. You have integrity and do what you say. You approach life with fearless determination and a sense of fun. You are creative, risk-taking, visionary and cutting edge. You choose to lead. You contribute to a strong culture and are committed to the team. You are passionate about quality and professionalism. You believe in unleashing the potential in others. 

Requirements
1-3+ years customer service experience (If you have the potential and less experience, we still want to meet you.) A passion for hospitality and creating world-class experiences A desire to learn and grow through personal and career development An entrepreneurial mindset. You see things from a new perspective Liquor Service certification

Benefits
Flexible scheduling to accommodate your personal and family needs Competitive compensation opportunity Ongoing mentorship to support personal and professional goals Fun, Team-driven and inclusive community Dynamic, fast-paced, and agile work environment World-class Culinary and Service training Compete through culinary and bar challenges Meal discounts Fitness membership discounts Recruiting & Referral bonus program incentives 

Your journey starts here.

If you're looking for a place to meet your potential, we'd like to meet you. Roll up your sleeves. Your journey starts here.

JOEY Restaurants is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We thank all candidates for their time and interest in working at JOEY Restaurants, however, only candidates under consideration for opportunities with JOEY Restaurants will be contacted to participate further in this process.

About JOEY Restaurants

The JOEY Restaurant Group exists to deliver the ultimate dining experience. Our handcrafted, locally, and globally inspired menu offerings are created by award-winning Chefs, and presented by world-class hospitality leaders in modern, warm, and lively environments. JOEY Restaurants has been family-owned and operating since 1992 and has grown into an iconic multi-concept brand throughout North America, with continued growth and expansion planned into 2030.

Our values shape every action we take and the decisions we make. JOEY Restaurants is all about opportunity and our ongoing success is attributable to our exceptional, team-oriented, performance-driven partners, who are constantly mastering their skill set. Our work environment is welcoming and inclusive, and our teams are passionate and creative. We embrace honesty and humility and are encouraged to fail forward and learn from our mistakes. Our industry-recognized performance-driven coaching culture paves the way for future leaders. Through ongoing coaching and mentorship, we directly impact the continuous learning, growth, and development of our partners across North America.

JOEY Restaurants provides reasonable accommodations to qualified applicants and employees, including due to disabilities, medical conditions, and religious beliefs and practices.
companyDescription:
JOEY exists to deliver the ultimate dining experience; it starts and ends with our people. We currently operate  44  locations throughout Canada and the United States and travel the globe to discover bold and addictive flavours, then turn them into signature recipes. Our people are our biggest investment and greatest return. We seek the best and the brightest, drive development, and reward top performers. JOEY is all opportunity, and our people is the way we succeed. They are masters of their craft, committed to creating a memorable and unique experience for each guest. We live by a simple credo: “Genuine Warmth and Care is always on the table.”  

JOEY has been recognized as one of the Great Place to Work® Best Workplace in Canada for 13 consecutive years (2010-2022) and is one of the Top Employers for Young People. These awards are a testament to our commitment to creating an environment where people are inspired to learn, grow, and discover their full potential. 

The JOEY Restaurant Group is an equal employment opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

companyDescription:
Our Purpose – Live Life Well

Loblaw Companies Limited is Canada’s food and pharmacy leader, the nation’s largest retailer, and the majority unit holder of Choice Properties Real Estate Investment Trust. Loblaw – and its portfolio of grocery, health and beauty, financial services and apparel businesses – provides Canadians with an unparalleled mix of value, assortment and convenience, and offers Canadians two of the country’s most recognized brands – President’s Choice and no name.

The acquisition of Shoppers Drug Mart, along with the powerful Life Brand and Optimum brand, has only served to reinforce our leadership position in the marketplace. As well, our PC Plus program, omni-channel efforts and multicultural merchandising offerings continued to be points of differentiation for our customer experience.

In 2019, Loblaw has been recognized as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Best Diversity Employers by Mediacorp Canada Inc.

----

IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT FRAUD AFFECTING OUR JOBSEEKERS.

Please be advised that recruitment fraud has affected a number of Canadian companies. In such schemes, individuals posing as legitimate recruiters may request personal information and payment from those seeking employment. 

Loblaw Companies Limited, its subsidiaries, and recruiting agencies will never ask for payment at any stage in the recruitment process. All legitimate postings may be accessed via our career website.

companyDescription:
Earls Kitchen + Bar is a family-run business, launched by father and son, Leroy Earl “Bus” Fuller and Stanley Earl Fuller in the early ‘80s and is also one of North America’s most successful independent restaurant groups. There are about 7,000 employees at 69 locations from Vancouver to Miami. Earls started with a simple idea: a laid-back burger and beer joint. jobDescription:
Joining Suncor means you will work for one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise.

We are living in an era of transformation – as a company, as an industry and as a global community. Suncor is evolving and we’re calling it Suncor 4.0. Technology and digital solutions are a big part of this, but unleashing the full potential of our people is what will get us where we need to be.

Suncor is on a journey to transform into a data-informed enterprise, where our people are empowered to make data-driven decisions. We are building our Enterprise Data team and have several exciting opportunities! By joining us in the early stages of our journey, you can help shape what Enterprise Data looks like at Suncor. Help us achieve our goal of transforming data into a strategic enterprise asset that is shared, accessible, trusted, stewarded and secure.

As a savvy Data Developer, you will play an active role throughout the development to sustainment cycle, from design, to build test and deploy; specializing in rapid deployment of data pipelines and business analytics solutions, including orchestration, automated testing and quality control, continuous integration/deployments, versioning and environment management.

Are you ready to help us solve problems we’ve never been able to address before? Join us and be part of transforming Suncor’s future!

Minimum Requirements: 

Five years of experience in data modelling and data mining techniquesFive years in ETL tools, techniques, data warehousing, and metadata & quality managementA Bachelor’s or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or a related technical fieldHands-on experience in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL queries across large datasets; Experience of working with various scripting and programming languagesExperience with modern data engineering tools in addition to strong relational database skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skills and well-versed with fundamental programming concepts and/or data structures and algorithms.Strong computing foundation and fundamentals, including experience with design Patterns 

Responsibilities: 

Work on multiple projects as a technical team member or lead, driving user story analysis and elaboration for data requirementsTranslate complex functional and technical requirements into detailed, design, and implement and maintain the business’s ETL pipeline and data warehouse, automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, and re-designing infrastructure for greater scalabilityBuild analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metricsConstruct the production management and monitoring of data pipelinesProvide in-depth knowledge of data modelling, warehousing and reporting platforms 

Location and other Key Details: 

Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to FridayYou will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave SW

Why Suncor?

Our operations include oil sands development and upgrading, conventional and offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and our product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our renewable energy portfolio includes investments in four operating wind farms and the operation of an ethanol plant. And our use of innovative technology has made us an industry leader in the energy business.

With a strong strategy for growth and our long-standing approach to sustainability, operational excellence, capital discipline and technology and innovation, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. We offer rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions – all of which means tremendous potential for your future. We are focused on deepening our commitment to inclusion and diversity and creating a respectful workplace.

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We have numerous employee inclusion networks to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change within Suncor. Current networks include both workplace inclusion networks (focusing on inclusion and respect for all), and identity-focused networks (focusing on building community and a sense of belonging and allyship). Through the Journey of Reconciliation, we are progressing the way we think and act to build greater mutual trust and respect with the Indigenous Peoples in Canada. Please note we will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.
companyDescription:
In 1967, we pioneered commercial development of Canada's oil sands – one of the largest petroleum resource basins in the world. Since then, Suncor has grown to become a globally competitive integrated energy company with a balanced portfolio of high-quality assets, a strong balance sheet and significant growth prospects.

Suncor’s operations include oil sands development and upgrading, conventional and offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. 

Our use of innovative technology has made us an industry leader in the energy business – and with a strong strategy for growth, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. 

As an employer, Suncor is one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of newcomers and experienced professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise from all parts of Canada.

jobDescription:
Acuren Group is currently recruiting a Structural Engineer to support our Remote Access Industrial Solutions Department. This position will be based Alberta and can be in Edmonton or Calgary.

Responsibilities

In this role, the incumbent will perform a wide range of engineering and project tasks for various projects including design and engineering plans for suspended platforms, aluminum truss systems, repair plans for piping and structural systems. 3D project plans and project management. The successful candidate will also assist in Engineering reviews, analyze data and delivers conclusions by written report. The role ensures work is managed within budget, meets client requirements and completed within designated timelines.

Participating in technical projects
Carrying out a range of engineering and project tasks for various client projects at all project phases. Communicating with clients to plan, schedule and execute site work. Providing support to projects such as document preparation, creation of estimates & inspection scopes, specifications, budgetary oversight and reporting. Acting as project leader and collaborate with other internal resources for support when required. Ensuring efficient use of resources and delivery of results. 

Providing clients with support and engineering expertise by:
Understanding customer requirements and needs to ensure expectations are met. Identifying additional services and products and new technologies to meet ongoing client needs. Meeting with customers to discuss report findings, recommendations and conclusions. Continually striving for process improvements including creating comprehensive reports aligned to client needs, identifying solutions to issues and developing recommendations for implementation. 

Conduct engineering work including:
Analysis and design of various structures such as tanks, piping systems, pressure vessels, structural members, etcDesign Remote Access Solutions for proprietary suspended platform and Truss systems including anchor selection and loading assessments. Work within a 3d Point Cloud CAD environment to develop workflows, project plans and simulations of remote work platforms and structural repairs of vessels, piping systems etc. Delivering conceptual and detailed structural designs based on project specifications and engineering inputs following the applicable standards, and codesProducing detailed procedures for rigging, lifting equipment, and other complex access solutionsAssuring compliance with project schedule and costsPerforming fitness for service assessments on pressure equipment as per API-579 and ASME FFS-1Performing Finite element analysis of various equipment and structures

Requirements
A university degree in Structural EngineeringMinimum of 5-10 years experienceMembership in a provincial association for professional engineers is required

The position requires understanding and knowledge in the following areas:
Engineering theories, principles and practices. Project management processes. Awareness of industrial codes and standards related to materials, welding, tanks, and pressure equipment. Experience with laser scanning, photogrammetry point, various 3D software. 

The position requires the following skills and abilities:
Ability to resolve issues and problems that are not clearly defined. Ability to manage large amounts of data effectively. Ability to translate knowledge into practical solutions. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) to effectively respond to different levels of understanding, and produce professional reports. Proficiency in MS Office programs and driver license, Class 5 (clean record) required. Proficiency with Auto CAD, Navis Works and other relevant design software for working in a 3D environment. 

Next steps

If you are interested in this employment opportunity, please apply in confidence through Acuren's online application process with copies of your certifications at www.acuren.com. We appreciate your interest in a career at Acuren, however only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further information. Agency services are not required at this time.

Company Overview

Acuren is a trusted, single source provider of technology-enabled asset protection solutions used to evaluate the integrity of critical energy, industrial and public infrastructures. Committed to delivering a Higher Level of Reliability, Acuren provides an unrivaled spectrum of capabilities including inspection, traditional and advanced NDE/NDT, failure analysis, rope access, materials engineering, reliability engineering and condition based monitoring services. Our work is critical to the integrity and safety of industrial firms, including petroleum refinery, pipeline, power generation, pulp & paper, mining, pharmaceutical, aerospace and automotive industries.

Acuren employs over 4,500 dedicated professionals supporting the mechanical integrity and inspection programs of the world’s largest industrial segments. Acuren is a market leader. Our formula for success is straightforward: be capable locally, with certified and well-equipped personnel supported by trained, experienced leaders. Continuing to build on a strong heritage of safety, quality and professionalism, Acuren strives to maintain incident free work environments, pursues advanced technical developments, and supports reliability programs that are valued by clients and employees. Acuren is a part of Rockwood Service Corporation, together with Hellier, and Tacten.
companyDescription:
INTEGRATED INDUSTRIAL SERVICES 

THE SMARTER WAY. THE EFFICIENT WAY. THE TACTEN WAY.

For 20 years, we have been leaders of innovation in delivering an integrated industrial services model based on composite crews, multi-disciplined trades, certified IRATA personnel and customized access optimization programs to industry’s largest clients in the world’s harshest environments.

Our highly skilled technicians, combined with our access solutions, and scalable composite crews with multiple certifications, allow us to provide clients with an unparalleled turnkey experience on a wide range of projects. 

Access optimization through rope access is one of the pillars of our model. It is one of the competencies that has enabled us to save our customers millions of dollars over the last 20 years. 

Being the first, and longest standing, full member of IRATA in North America, as well as the largest rope access service provider in North America, affords us a significant amount of experiential knowledge that has vast benefits to our clients.

Our composite crews are assembled from a large pool of employees that are specialists within their disciplines.  Teams are comprised based on the specific expertise required for each project. Through intimate working relationships with our customers, we participate in execution design during the planning process in order to ensure optimum efficiency.

We have capabilities that extend across all industry segments, but with specific capabilities in oil and gas, petrochemical refining, marine, pulp and paper, power generation and civil infrastructure. 

Our core service offering includes electrical, welding/fabrication, pipe-fitting, insulation, asbestos abatement, hoisting/rigging, painting and coating, inspection, shutdown/turn around support, removal of equipment or hazards, confined space (including rescue service), furnace and burner de-slags, nuts and bolts removal/replacement, and class surveys.

jobDescription:
GP JOULE PV Canada Corp. is currently seeking a Project Manager based out of our Calgary, Alberta office.
Why you should join the GP JOULE team: GP JOULE PV Canada Corp. North America is a subsidiary of GP JOULE GmbH, a diversified renewable project developer and Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) service provider headquartered in Reußenköge, Germany with offices across Europe, the US and Canada. The North American team is focused on solar project co-development as well as full turnkey EPC services. Headquartered in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, with satellite offices in Calgary, Alberta and Halifax, Nova Scotia and we specialize in ground mount and rooftop solar photovoltaic installations for both commercial and utility scale projects. 
As a growing international private company, we value authenticity, fair business practices, innovation, quality, and zest for life. We look for highly spirited people embracing those same core values to join us! We are dedicated to promoting solar renewable energy in North America and reducing our carbon footprint. 
The role of the Project Manager (Contracts) is to provide management oversight and leadership to direct reports (Project Engineers) and is responsible for overall project deliverables including scope, cost and schedule management, project status reporting, client relations, quality and safety leadership, cash flow management, and profitability tracking.
 You will use your expertise to:(You will be responsible for performing such duties and responsibilities which may be assigned to you from time to time by your leader.) Develop, manage, and control scope, cost, and schedules for the project.Oversee a variety of contractors, including engineering, fabrication, and construction, with the support of internal resources.Provide weekly updated schedules to leaders, and clients.Work closely with supply chain team members to validate material, and contract delivery timelines.Validate and approve Change Orders from vendors and clients.Work closely with internal construction management and commissioning teams to create realistic schedules and manage risk.Develop, manage, and facilitate contracts for subcontractors.Support project engineers in their growth and development and utilize their support for overall project execution.Communicate and develop strong relationships with clients and stakeholders to drive project progress and customer satisfaction.Operate as the key person responsible for the project/contract performance. Complete, oversee, and utilize contracts.Oversee the project budget including cashflows and expenditures to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery of projects. Working closely with accounts payable and project accountants to ensure timely forecast costs and cash flow objectives.Anticipate any cost overruns and implement recovery plans in place to alleviate them. Escalate potential loss in profitability from budgeted margins if necessary to management, early enough to provide guidance or support.Provide weekly (critical items), monthly (overall project i.e. safety, quality, timing, financial (actually spent vs. budgeted, project cash flows) and customer satisfaction and quarterly (project summary + process as part of management meetings).Work with accounting and finance to ensure project-specific payables, receivables, and consolidated statements are managed weekly and in accordance with respective contracts for your projects.Report daily or weekly, as required, to clients (Project Report) and to management to ensure all project deliverables are well tracked.Advise customers and potential clients on technical or engineering issues/changes affecting project deliverables from a civil, mechanical, or electrical standpoint. Coordinate accurate management of change orders with internal resources and clients.
 We would like to review your application if you have the following minimum qualifications:
Bachelor Science Degree - All Engineering, Valid P. Eng. In Canada, or other professional designation.10+ years of project management experience in the construction industry.Must have minimum five years construction exposure.Experience with the facilitation of engineering, fabrication, and construction contractors.Experience with preparing and executing utility interconnection plans, an asset.Experienced in all aspects of project management including scope management, cost estimating, scheduling and construction contracts development, supervision, and on-site inspections.Knowledge and experience in commercial supply chains processes.Knowledge of the Canadian Electrical Code.Knowledge and experience in industrial construction methodology and planning.Ability to read and extract scope of work from engineered drawings.Understanding of codes, governing regulations, and industry practices in Canada.Accuracy, completeness, and quality of technical information and project documentation.Excellent interpersonal skills and can work effectively with senior management, clients, project team, and contractorsResults-oriented, and be flexible to work well under tight schedules in a fast-paced team environment
Where you will be working, your work schedule, and other important information:
The base hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday, with the potential for extended work hours based on the business needs.This role is office based out of Calgary, Alberta. You may be expected to travel across Canada (Ontario, Alberta, Saskatchewan, British Columbia, Nova Scotia), and US (primarily Mid-West, North-East) from time to time as a representative of the Company. 
GP JOULE PV Canada Corp. also offers an exciting, faced paced working environment with a competitive base salary based on experience. Along with a comprehensive benefits package and vacation allotments.
companyDescription: GP JOULE has 11 years of experience in commissioning high-performance renewable systems on the North American power market. Since our founding in 2011, we have built more than 180 MW of solar photovoltaic power in this region.As of September 2022, we are part of the GOLDBECK SOLAR group. An international family-owned company specialized in the construction of large-scale photovoltaic power plants. As a clear result of the acquisition, we plan a growth of more than 60% with our pipeline of over 120 MW to be constructed in 2022 and 2023.The joining of forces between GP JOULE Canada and GOLDBECK SOLAR will provide customers with improved service and tremendous growth to support the energy transformation in Canada.GP JOULE and GOLDBECK SOLAR´s footprint now extends across 20 countries with more than 2.5 GWs of solar power installed and O&M Portfolio of 1.2 GW.

jobDescription:
Job Description

 À propos de BGIS 

BGIS est un chef de file de la prestation de services immobiliers et de services personnalisés de gestion des installations. Grâce à notre équipe combinée de plus de 6 500 personnes à l’échelle mondiale, nous encourageons sans cesse l’innovation par l’intermédiaire des services que nous offrons, tout en cherchant activement de nouvelles occasions qui stimuleront la créativité pour les entreprises de nos clients. Nous gérons des portefeuilles clients comptant plus de 320 millions de pieds carrés de superficie dans plus de 30 000 emplacements en Amérique du Nord, en Europe, au Moyen-Orient, en Australie et en Asie. Vous trouverez des renseignements supplémentaires au www.bgis.com/fr.

 SOMMAIRE 

Le Ingénieur de Puissance de 5ème classe est responsable des services d’entretien et de réparations habituels et sur demande sur les composants non techniques (par exemple les murs, les planchers, etc.) des installations. Le technicien II est aussi responsable d’effectuer des travaux selon les pratiques et procédures établies et de répondre aux exigences internes et externes, notamment les exigences écologiques, de santé et sécurité, et de sécurité incendie.

 PRINCIPALES ATTRIBUTIONS ET RESPONSABILITÉS 

 Dépannage 
 Fournit des observations sur l'installation, l'équipement mécanique et électrique de l'installation et les conditions et les lacunes des systèmes et fournit des suggestions d'amélioration et de réparation. 

Maintenance
 Effectue le travail conformément aux processus et pratiques établis.  Conforme à toutes les exigences internes et externes, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, l'environnement, la santé et la sécurité, la protection contre les incendies.  Effectue une surveillance et une inspection régulières des composants techniques et non techniques de l'installation.  Répondre aux demandes de service de routine et effectuer la maintenance préventive et corrective.  Exploite les systèmes mécaniques, électriques et autres de l'installation  Gère le cycle de vie des bons de travail en faisant progresser le formulaire de travail envoyé jusqu'à son achèvement et enregistre les données de résolution dans la base de données de gestion de la maintenance des services. S'assure que le travail terminé respecte la qualité, la réponse au contrat et toutes les autres exigences  Aide à la mise en œuvre du programme de maintenance préventive (MP). S'assure que les lacunes sont identifiées, enregistrées et transmises, et que les documents connexes sont conservés. 

 Relation client 
 Aide à améliorer la satisfaction des locataires et des clients et à maintenir des relations positives grâce à la manière dont le travail est effectué et les services fournis. 

Administration
 Enregistre les données de résolution dans la base de données de gestion de la maintenance des services. S'assure que le travail terminé respecte la qualité, la réponse au contrat et toutes les autres exigences.  Reçoit, suit, surveille et signale l'état des travaux de maintenance et de réparation dans la base de données de gestion de la maintenance des services. Initie les documents pour obtenir l'approbation formelle des travaux requis  Participe et aide aux projets liés aux installations.  S'assure que la manière dont le travail est effectué est conforme aux politiques, procédures, pratiques et directives de l'entreprise et législatives relatives à l'environnement, à la santé et à la sécurité, à la protection contre les incendies et à toute autre exigence applicable.  Entretenir tous les outils assignés et organiser les réparations et les remplacements si nécessaire  Soumet toutes les dépenses en temps opportun.  Autres tâches assignées 

 CONNAISSANCES ET APTITUDES 
 Diplôme d'études secondaires ou équivalent  Minimum de 3 ans d'expérience dans l'exploitation et la maintenance d'installations  Connaissance des processus et des pratiques liés à l'exploitation et à l'entretien des installations  Capacité à entretenir, dépanner et réparer les composants non techniques des installations  Capacité à fournir des observations sur les conditions et les lacunes des installations et à fournir des suggestions d'amélioration et de réparation  Capacité de rechercher, d'apprendre et d'acquérir une plus grande compétence dans l'application sur le tas des codes et normes d'incendie, de la vie et du bâtiment  Possède un fort état d'esprit en matière d'environnement, de santé et de sécurité. Capacité à effectuer un travail en toute sécurité  Forte orientation client et sens aigu de l'urgence  Compétences en communication efficaces aux fins de relais, d'échange, de rétroaction et de clarification des données  Connaissance et compréhension de base des systèmes d'automatisation des bâtiments (BAS)  Capacité à lire, à comprendre et à interpréter des dessins et des informations techniques  Motivé  Connaissances en informatique  Compétences démontrées en matière d'entretien et de réparation  Doit être capable et disposé à travailler par quarts, être disponible pour les appels d'urgence/de réserve et les appels d'urgence au fur et à mesure qu'ils surviennent  Doit être disposé à porter un équipement de protection individuelle  Doit satisfaire aux exigences d'habilitation de sécurité renforcées  Permis de conduire valide 

 Certificats ou agréments professionnels 
 Ingénieur de Puissance de 5ème classe  Satisfaire aux exigences d’une autorisation de sécurité supérieure.  L'un des elements suivants est considere comme un atout: Certification d'operateur de batiments ou equivalent par une institution acreditee de preferenceCertficat d'entretien des systemes du batimentsAdministrateur de la maintenance des systemesTechnicien en maintenance des systemesCertification de technicien d;installationsTravailler a la classe d'operation des systemes du batiments 1

Chez BGIS, nous croyons en la diversité et l'inclusion comme moteurs commerciaux clés, de sorte que nous ne perdons jamais de vue de son importance car elle est tissée dans l'ADN de notre organisation. Nous nous engageons à maintenir un processus de recrutement sans obstacle en offrant des opportunités d'emploi équitables grâce au recrutement et à la sélection d'individus de tous horizons. Nous reconnaissons que la promotion de la diversité est un élément essentiel de notre quête du succès organisationnel!
companyDescription:
BGIS is a global leader in the provision of Facility Management, Project Delivery, Energy & Sustainability, Asset Management, Workplace Advisory, and Real Estate Services. With a combined team of over 8,000 globally, BGIS relentlessly focuses on delivering innovative service solutions that create value for its clients. Globally, BGIS manages over 30,000 facilities totaling more than 320 million square feet across several markets including government, higher education, utilities, telecommunications, financial services, oil & gas, healthcare and cloud enterprise. In addition to managing a diverse portfolio of corporate offices, retail, colleges, hospitals and industrial assets, BGIS is a world leader in the management of data centers and other critical environments.

-

BGIS est un fournisseur de services personnalisés de gestion des installations, de services de livraison de projets, de solutions énergétiques et de développement durable, de gestion de la performance des bâtiments, de conseil et de gestion des lieux de travail et de services immobiliers. 7 000 membres d’équipe à l'échelle mondiale. Plus de 320 millions de pieds carrés de portefeuilles clients répartis sur plusieurs marchés, notamment ceux des gouvernements, de l’enseignement supérieur, des services publics, des télécommunications, des services financiers, du pétrole et du gaz, des soins de santé et de l’information dans les nuages. En plus de gérer un portefeuille diversifié de bureaux, de commerces de détail, de collèges, d'hôpitaux et d'actifs industriels, BGIS est un leader mondial de la gestion de centres de données et d'autres environnements critiques.

jobDescription:
Division: Automation & SCADA, Electricity 
Location: Edmonton, AB 
 
Position Summary:  

Always there. Anywhere. That's us! We are committed to delivering inspired solutions for a better world. We care about our communities, we care about each other, and we care about showing up for those who need us. We never break a promise, and we have the courage to do the right thing, even when it's hard. We take pride in holding ourselves to the highest standard of integrity and excellence in all that we do. 

Come join an unconventional utility - one that will challenge you while you grow and develop. ATCO has some exciting projects underway such as Decarbonization, Renewables, Solar Photovoltaics (PV), Battery Energy Storage System (BESS), Combined Heat & Power (CHP), Microgrids, and Electrification of transportation. We want you to help shape our energy future. Come be part of the change! 

Reporting to the Automation & SCADA Supervising Engineer, this position is responsible for creating and implementing Automation & SCADA systems for electrical utility Transmission substations and customer generation facilities. This position will complete all required Automation & SCADA project deliverables including scope and cost estimating, engineering design, equipment configuration development and on-site integration and validation testing with a focus on safety and adherence to ATCO, customer and industry standards and practices. This position will additionally participate in group technical initiatives, innovation pilot projects and identifying areas of cost and quality improvement. 

Responsibilities:

Specify and design low to medium complexity substation and solar/wind generation SCADA systems including processor-based hardware and software control systems (Gateway, RTU, PLC, Data Concentrators, HMI, Ethernet switches) and integration of Intelligent Electronic Devices (equipment monitors, protective relays, inverters, battery systems, etc,)Develop comprehensive Automation & SCADA packages through all project phases from design specification through to end-to-end commissioningComplete SCADA equipment device configurations and conduct quality assurance testing at the fabrication facility and onsite during project executionContribute to the creation of standards and specifications for Automation & SCADA process, procedure, and equipmentShare project lessons learned and experience to improve overall individual and team product qualitySupport project work planning, coordination, reporting, cost estimating, presentation development, quality checks and studiesEnsure project status update reporting is delivered on a regular and frequent basisSupport field maintenance staff in low to medium complexity SCADA and control system troubleshooting, issue investigation and restoration during business hours and afterhours/weekends as requiredParticipate in new technology investigation and group initiatives to improve team project and operational efficiency, increase project design or execution capability, or reduce costQualifications:

A Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, preferably in Power Systems, Control Systems or Electronics.A registered member of APEGA with P.Eng. designationMinimum 5 years of electrical engineering experience preferably with time spent in Transmission/Distribution utilities, power generation and/or renewables projectsExperience in electrical engineering detail design & drafting, equipment configuration and site commissioningPreference will be given to candidates with knowledge in SCADA systems, basic IP networking, and substation control system design and control system equipment configuration software for HMI, Gateway, RTU and/or PLC'sHighly effective interpersonal, oral, written, verbal and relationship building skillsProven ability to effectively interact with internal and external customersActive team member and ability to prioritize assignments to meet commitments and deliverable deadlinesDemonstrated ability to evaluate technical requirements and make decisionsProblem-solving skills with ability to deal with design issues in a timely fashionCapability to work on projects independently and with minimal supervisionConduct site work within the province of Alberta for portions of time through the yearA valid Province of Alberta Class 5 driver's licenseWhat We Offer: 

A culture based on caring, integrity, agility, collaboration, and striving for excellence Competitive compensation Flex benefits Tuition assistance program Training and mentorship programs Charitable donation matching 
We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted. 

ATCO Electric is part of ATCO Ltd. With approximately 6,000 employees and assets of $23 billion, ATCO is a diversified global holding corporation with investments in Structures & Logistics (workforce housing, innovative modular facilities, construction, site support services, and logistics and operations management), Energy Infrastructure (electricity generation, transmission and distribution; natural gas transmission, distribution and infrastructure development; energy storage and industrial water solutions; and electricity and natural gas retail sales), Transportation (ports and transportation logistics) and Commercial Real Estate. More information can be found at www.ATCO.com. ATCO is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. 

Issued: February 16, 2023 
Deadline: March 2, 2023 

This position is administered under the supervisory/professional salary administration guidelines.

jobDescription:
The Opportunity: 
Are you passionate about data and take pride in working with data to generate value? Are you ready to take your career to the next level? Canadian Natural is seeking a Data Engineer or Developer. As a Data Engineer or Developer, you will work with Data Analysts, Business Systems Analysts and industry experts to deliver fit-for-purpose data pipelines and data products for analytics and data science. You will develop modern data pipelines that extract data from multiple data sources, transform, combine, validate, and load it into a data lake, data warehouse, or application for further analysis and visualization.
The Data Provisioning Services team is working to enable CNRL to be a data-driven organization. The team work across the enterprise to create data driven solutions to better serve our customers and peers.
 Key Accountabilities: 
 Estimate, design and develop scalable, optimized data pipelines to enable our business through Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics solutions  Develop and update standards and best practices, use DevOps Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) process  Provide hands-on data integration support as part of daily operations; this includes monitoring, configuration, troubleshooting, user administration, and optimizing data objects for consumers  Follow ITIL processes to transition activities from project to production  Conduct root cause analysis and resolve incidents reported by monitoring systems and end-users  Configure and administer tools such as HVR, Magnotix, PowerBi, Tableau, and Informatica for reporting and data integration  Establish and maintain best practices and data engineering templates and standards for each toolset and function, ie. ML/AI vs BI Analytics 
 Other Details: 
 Job location: Calgary, Alberta  Shift schedule: 5x2 - Monday to Friday, 8-hour shifts  (Fridays off during the summer and office closure during the Christmas break)  Competitive salary, stock options, stock savings plan, and benefits 
 Skills & Qualifications: 
 Post-secondary degree in Computer Science/Software Engineering or a related field of study or equivalent experience in data integration or data engineering  5+ years’ experience developing cost-optimized, scalable and configurable, ETL/ELT data pipeline or data integration  3-5 years of experience with Python, SQL, and PySpark; DevOps/CI/CD pipelines, performant data stores and operational REST APIs  Experience in Cloud environments and tools including MS Azure, AWS, Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Data Lakes, Azure Data Factory, HVR, Magnotix, KQL, Scala, PowerBi, Tableau, and Informatica 
 Why Canadian Natural? 
CANADIAN NATURAL is a senior independent crude oil and natural gas exploration, development and production company based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Our strong, diversified asset base is comprised of a balanced portfolio of light, synthetic, and heavy crude oil and natural gas. Canadian Natural operates in Canada, the United Kingdom and Offshore Africa.
At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." We are committed to a long-term presence in the communities where we operate. Our activities create value by providing employment, business development opportunities, revenues to governments that contribute to spending on goods and services, and essential resources for public services, including health, safety, education and training.
Over the last 30 years, we have grown from a Company with nine employees to over 10,000 employees. We have increased our production from approximately 400 BOE/d in 1989 to more than one million BOE/d today.
Safety is a core value at Canadian Natural. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.
Canadian Natural Resources Limited – “Canadian Natural” - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.
Application deadline is February 24, 2023. Apply now!

Primary Location
Calgary
Job
Information Systems Technology

jobDescription:
Who we are:
Petrocom Construction Ltd. is an established leader in the construction industry, bringing a wide range of knowledge and expertise to every project. We are growing our team of energetic, dedicated employees and are currently recruiting for a Project Manager. If you have a positive attitude, great work ethic and want to be part of a winning team, we want to hear from you!

Job Description:
The Project Manager is responsible for all aspects of project management, including, but not limited to, the management of procurement, scope, schedule, cost, quality, communications, risk, and stakeholder communication. This role works closely with other members of the project team and must demonstrate excellent leadership and collaboration skills. The successful candidate must be highly detail oriented and focused on accuracy. Establishing and maintaining strong relationships with clients and stakeholders is a core value of Petrocom Construction and must be a priority of the Project Manager. 

• Manage project activities throughout the life cycle of the project, including the allocation of resources, scheduling, documentation, and budgets
• Prepare and coordinate estimates and proposal tenders
• Create and manage project budgets and complete accurate forecasts
• Act as primary liaison for clients, designers, site superintendents, subtrades and other project stakeholders
• Manage internal and/or external contractors and/or trades
• Accountable for completing projects on schedule and on budget
• Monitor daily operations, schedules, and overall progress
• Prepare and submit project budget estimates, contracts, change orders, RFI’s
• Interpret and manage contractual obligations
• Communicate with stakeholders/project team to discuss progress, obstacles, and solutions and hold the parties accountable for results
• To implement policies and procedures for quality control with a focus on continuous improvement

Qualifications:
• Relevant experience in commercial and/or retail petroleum construction
• Extensive knowledge of construction safety procedures and the ability to implement them on site
• Working knowledge of construction scopes and activities, scheduling, pricing, and management
• Proficiency in Microsoft Project is necessary; proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Sage Construction, and Adobe Acrobat is preferred
• Relevant construction related post-secondary education (Construction Engineering Technology or equivalent)
• Ability to confidently delegate to other members of the project team

What we offer:
Petrocom is an equal opportunity employer who provides continuous learning, opportunities for advancement, competitive wages, group RRSP plans, and a comprehensive benefits program. 
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
companyDescription:
At Petrocom, we pride ourselves on delivering the quality, commitment, performance and trust that we would expect ourselves. Serving Western Canada for over 15 years, we have developed lasting relationships with our clients, consultants, subtrades and suppliers. Our team specializes in a variety of construction delivery methods and has the skills and expertise to ensure success with every project we execute. Build with Petrocom, and expect an unmatched level of quality and service. 

Our Core Services:

Petroleum Related Construction
Petrocom is a proven industry leader in delivering quality petroleum projects. We provide petroleum related commercial, retail, and industrial construction services to major retail clients and private businesses across Western Canada.
 
Commercial Construction
From preconstruction to completion, Petrocom delivers exceptional service to a wide range of commercial clients. We offer services for Design Build, Construction Management, Tenant Improvements, and Light Industrial construction.

Residential Construction
In addition to our expertise in Petroleum and Commercial Construction, we proudly offer residential services including custom new home builds, multi-family residential units, and renovation projects. 

Setting the Bar in Safety Standards:
Petrocom’s commitment to safety in the workplace is second to none. Our team is upheld to an extensive health and safety program that ensures our work sites are safe for the public, subtrades, and staff.

companyName: Canadian Armed Forces | Forces armées canadiennes
jobDescription:
Overview
Marine Systems Engineers are responsible for the readiness, operation and maintenance of propulsion and ancillary systems, power generation and distribution, auxiliary systems, ship’s service systems, ship and machinery control systems, hull structure, ship’s stability, damage control, and the integration of these systems.
They analyze the state of their systems, equipment and personnel, predict their requirement for naval operations and advise Command accordingly. The primary role of a Marine Systems Engineer is to provide technical expertise, advice and leadership in support of: Day-to-day naval operations and maintenance of marine systems in ships and submarinesThe continuous renewal of the Fleet through modernization and replacement of naval marine systems and equipment, including:DesignDevelopmentAcquisitionConstructionDisposalMaintenance of infrastructure needed to support naval operations and missions in times of emergency, mobilization and war Work environment
Marine Systems Engineers are employed in ships and submarines as the Head of the Marine Systems Engineering Department, where they are responsible for the leadership and well-being of a large team of highly trained technical professionals committed to assuring the equipment’s peak performance.
Marine Systems Engineers may work in a range of roles in support of the continuous maintenance and renewal of the fleet including providing expert engineering advice, project management, advising on the acquisition of new equipment, training and administrative positions requiring engineering expertise.
Entry plans
 Direct Entry Options  Paid Education Options 
If you already have a university degree, the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) will decide if your academic program matches the criteria for this job and may place you directly into the required on-the-job training program following basic training. Basic training and military officer qualification training are required before being assigned.
Regular Officer Training Plan
Due to the requirement for CAF officer to obtain a university degree, the CAF will pay successful recruits to complete a bachelor degree program in the Royal Military College System. Recruits will receive full-time salary including medical and dental care, as well as vacation time with full pay in exchange for working in the CAF for a period of time. Typically, candidates enter the Canadian Military College System as an Officer Cadet where they study subjects relevant to both their military and academic career. In rare instances, based on the needs of the CAF, candidates may be approved attend another Canadian University. A determination will be made on a case by case basis. If you are applying for this program, you must apply to the CAF and it is recommended to apply to other Canadian universities of your choice should you not be accepted for ROTP.
Training
After enrolment, you start basic officer training at the Canadian Forces Leadership and Recruit School in Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu, Quebec, for 12 weeks. Topics covered include general military knowledge, the principles of leadership, regulations and customs of the Forces, basic weapons handling, and first aid. Opportunities will also be provided to apply such newly acquired military skills in training exercises involving force protection, field training, navigation and leadership. A rigorous physical fitness program is also a vital part of basic training. Basic officer training is provided in English or French and successful completion is a prerequisite for further training.
Following basic officer training, official second language training may be offered to you. Training could take from two to nine months to complete depending on your ability in your second language.
Naval officer training
All officer candidates in the Navy attend a nine-week Naval Environmental Training Program held at the Naval Officer Training Centre in Victoria, British Columbia. This course introduces the naval environment and includes four weeks on board a minor war vessel for officers to experience life at sea.
The professional training for Marine Systems Engineers consists of several courses held at the Canadian Forces Naval Engineering School in Halifax, Nova Scotia. The first course, Naval Engineering Indoctrination, lasts 11 weeks and introduces the systems, equipment and personnel of the two engineering departments of the ships in the Fleet. This course includes seven weeks on board a major warship.
The next course, Marine Systems Engineering Applications, lasts 22 weeks and provides detailed instruction in the theory, application, operation, maintenance, personnel and management of Marine Systems Engineering in the Navy. On completion, officers join the ships of the Fleet for one year in order to consolidate their skills and knowledge of Marine Systems Engineering.
Throughout training, officers develop the general and personnel management skills required to successfully fill engineering positions.
Marine Systems Engineers who demonstrate the required ability and potential will be offered specialized training in the following fields:
Marine propulsion control system analysisCargo managementVibration analysisGas turbine engineeringReliability centered maintenanceAdvanced ship production
Marine Systems Engineering may also be offered the opportunity to further enhance their engineering credentials through fully funded post-graduate education in Canada or abroad, in the following fields:
Naval architectureMarine engineeringHeavy electrical engineeringControl and instrumentation engineering
 Related Civilian Occupations 
 No directly related civilian jobs
companyDescription:
A career in the Canadian Armed Forces is more than a way to make a living. It’s a passport to a whole-life experience that will change you and allow you to change the lives of others.

In the Forces, you enjoy the stability of a steady career and the excitement of a job that offers travel, adventure, camaraderie, and the satisfaction of making a difference.

For more videos and information about careers in the Canadian Armed Forces, visit FORCES.CA.

jobDescription:
Role Summary
To understand the business goals, objectives, and strategies of the organization and to use that knowledge to design, develop, implement, and maintain business systems, data, software, and services that align with our business vision.
Specific elements for this role:Work as part of a team to develop functional applications, write and debug code, create user documentation, and maintain applications and software releases.Develop new features for GDM's web application, Converge (front end and back end).Test bug fixes and new features alongside development team.Add, enhance, and maintain GDM's data and ETL processes.Add, enhance, and maintain automated UI tests and data tests.Investigate test failures as they arise.Investigate customer issues as they arise.
ResponsibilitiesProvide supporting analysis into business cases for development opportunities.Provide solid effort estimates by reviewing business requirements and software specifications.Support existing applications by identifying areas for improvement and fixing known bugs.Analyze actual results against plans and projections, pointing out deficiencies, trends, and improvement opportunities.Ensure processes, policies, and procedures used by application development and operational staff are documented, understood, and followed to ensure effective application delivery.Maintain excellent external and internal customer relations through an understanding of business needs, timely problem resolution, and project status reporting.Adhere to data management strategies that support effective business processes.
QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.Experience using AngularJS, React, JS, HTML, C#, AWS Lambda, ElasticSearch, SQL Server, Kafka, Python, PyTest, SeleniumExperience designing, writing and utilizing RESTful web services.Experience with test driven development, writing unit tests and web-based performance testing.Experience with high-throughput data acquisition/processing and optimization is an asset.Excellent communicator.Excellent problem solving and analytical ability.Knowledge and use of agile software development methods.Demonstrated project management, organizational and problem-solving skill.Proven ability to perform detailed analysis to define and document optimized business and system requirements, process maps and procedures.Some knowledge of the Oil and Gas industry with particular focus on surface and near surface information
companyDescription:
GDM Inc. is the trusted source for energy infrastructure data in Canada. In business since 1997, GDM is relied on by industry to deliver the most complete, accurate, and current pipeline and facility, environmental incident, transportation infrastructure, utility, and frontier land data. Our data is available as part of prominent industry applications AccuMap and geoSCOUT, in addition to being accessible via direct database connection and GIS-ready files.  

To round out our offering, our proprietary software application, Converge, offers analytics and mapping tools, as well as modules specific to pipeline risk assessment, water crossing prioritization, and asset connectivity. We also deliver custom data reporting and analytics services to meet the unique and changing needs of the energy industry in Canada.

jobDescription:
Description
Revera owns and operates retirement residences and long term care homes in the senior living sector.
Purpose. Passion. People.
We are purpose driven. We are passionate. We are connected. We are truly out to live our best lives, as we come together to help others live theirs. Join our team today and build your career with us.
Like to serve? We’re hiring a Server to work in our bright and welcoming dining room. Join us today and be part of a team of servers that will support with the set-up of the dining room and all aspects of serving and clean up associated with dining services within our retirement residence. Here, we believe mealtime is more than food; it’s friends and family coming together for good conversation and memorable experiences. Key Responsibilities:
 To serve meals to residents and guests in a professional and courteous manner; To set and clear dining tables and deliver tray service as required; To assist with cleaning of dishware, cutlery at the conclusion of each dining service as required; To assist with maintaining the cleanliness of kitchen and dining area as required; To assist with catering, and actively participate in special occasions and theme events; To assist in the orientation and training of new culinary employees; To follow and comply with health and safety legislation and departmental safe job procedures; To comply with all provincial regulations and established department policies and procedures; To be aware of the Resident Rights & Responsibilities and endeavor to respect and promote it; To attend in-service training as required in order to better serve the needs of the residents; To attend staff meetings as required to be aware of changes in the Residence that have taken place; To participate in the Quality Improvement Program; To uphold and promote the organization’s values and philosophy relating particularly to ethics, morality, and integrity as set out in Revera’s Code of Conduct; and To complete all other tasks as assigned. Required Education, Credentials and Experience: Preference will be given to individuals who have previous experience in the food service industry and working with seniors Demonstrates excellent customer service skills Must be physically able to lift and transfer heavy, hot items and stand/walk for majority of shift Proficiency in a second language is considered an asset. Current (within 6 months) Vulnerable Position/Sector Screening (VPS) or be willing to obtain one upon hire.
Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. The vaccine must be a two-dose COVID-19 vaccination series approved by Health Canada. This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.
Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request.
companyDescription: Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. Through its portfolio of partnerships, Revera owns or operates more than 500 properties across Canada, the United States and the United Kingdom, serving more than 55,000 people. The company offers seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care, long term care and skilled nursing. Through Age is More, Revera is committed to challenging ageism, the company’s social cause of choice. Find out more at ReveraLiving.com, facebook.com/ReveraInc or on Twitter @Revera_Inc.

jobTitle: Point de terminaison sécurisé - DevOps en test
jobDescription:
Êtes-vous enthousiasmé par le défi que représente la protection des personnes contre les menaces avancées sur la sécurité informatique?

 Vos collaborateurs 

Des milliards de fois par jour, les ordinateurs du monde entier communiquent avec le nuage de Cisco Secure Endpoint et s’appuient sur nos produits pour les protéger contre les formes avancées de logiciels malveillants. Certains logiciels malveillants sont simples à détecter, et les antivirus le font depuis toujours. Nos clients ont besoin d'être protégés contre les logiciels malveillants plus difficiles à détecter :
 Des virus qui génèrent des fichiers binaires différents sur chaque machine qu’ils infectent  Des choses qui semblent bénignes jusqu’à ce que vous commenciez à examiner de près leur comportement  Les concepteurs de logiciels malveillants qui ont inventé de nouvelles façons de se dissimuler. 

Pour rendre le problème encore plus haletant, cela peut prendre quelques jours pour s'apercevoir qu'un programme ou un comportement est malveillant. Est-ce que cela vous amuserait?

Notre équipe cultive une approche collaborative et judicieuse du développement et des tests. C'est l'occasion de faire partie d'une équipe qui a à la fois de nouvelles idées et des années d'expérience dans le développement de logiciels en réseau très performants et à haute disponibilité dans un des secteurs les plus fascinants et surprenants : la sécurité informatique. Venez apprendre avec nous!

 Vos fonctions 

La prise en charge du développement et de la validation continus de Secure nécessite des environnements de test d’intégration qui peuvent refléter la production, mettre à disposition des tests de contrainte et de charge, ou permettre des tests d’intégration nets et rapides des nouvelles fonctionnalités et capacités, à la fois au sein des groupes d’ingénierie contribuant à l’ensemble du produit et entre eux. Vous êtes passionné par la mise à disposition, la surveillance et la maintenance des infrastructures essentielles utilisées chaque jour pour le développement et les tests. En plus de veiller à un fonctionnement efficace, vous mettrez en place et en œuvre des processus et du code qui assurent que ce qui est opérationnel le reste.

 Vos atouts 

Vous êtes motivé et autonome, axé sur les résultats et impliqué. Vous êtes passionné par les opérations en nuage et vous aimez collaborer dans un environnement d’équipe. Vous avez du plaisir en apprenant de nouvelles technologies. Vous voulez aller au fond des choses, comprendre ce qu'il se passe et obtenir un résultat. Vous n'abandonnez pas face à des problèmes complexes.

 Atouts 
 2 à 5 ans d’expérience sur des serveurs Linux  Capacité à s'adapter rapidement aux nouvelles fonctionnalités et aux nouveaux logiciels  Expérience avec le débogage des réseaux  Expérience dans un environnement infonuagique avec divers composants  Expérience dans les systèmes distribués  Expérience de débogage des problèmes de performance au niveau de l’application  Expérience dans le déploiement et la surveillance automatisés de type DevOps  Pourquoi travailler chez Cisco? 

#NoussommesCisco signifie que chaque personne est unique, mais qu’elle met son talent au service de l’équipe afin d’apporter sa contribution et d’œuvrer en faveur d’un avenir inclusif pour tous.

Nous adhérons aux technologies numériques et aidons nos clients à mettre en œuvre des changements dans leurs entreprises numériques. Certains nous pensent peut-être « vieux » (36 ans de réussites!) et axés seulement sur le matériel, mais nous sommes également une entreprise de logiciels Et une entreprise axée sur la sécurité. Nous avons même inventé un réseau intuitif qui s’adapte, prédit, apprend et protège. Aucune autre entreprise ne peut faire ce que nous faisons; nous ne pouvons pas être enfermés dans une seule case!

L’expression « transformation numérique » sert à attirer l’attention, mais elle est plutôt vide de sens si elle ne s’accompagne pas d’une culture qui autorise l’innovation, la créativité et, oui, même l’échec (si cela permet d’apprendre).

Au quotidien, nous nous concentrons sur l’offre et la demande. Nous donnons le meilleur de nous-mêmes, nous mettons notre ego de côté, et nous mettons du cœur au travail (cela fait partie de notre ADN). Nous prenons nos responsabilités, nous prenons des mesures audacieuses, et nous savons apprécier la différence. Parce que sans diversité de pensée et sans engagement pour l’égalité entre tous, il n’y a pas de progrès.

Vous avez des cheveux colorés? Ce n’est pas important. Vous avez des tatouages? N’hésitez pas à les montrer. Vous aimez les vêtements à pois? C’est super! Vous êtes amateur de culture pop? Beaucoup d’entre nous le sont aussi. Vous êtes féru de technologie et voulez changer le monde? Soyez vous-même avec nous!
companyDescription:
Cisco (NASDAQ: CSCO) enables people to make powerful connections--whether in business, education, philanthropy, or creativity. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. 

Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 71,000 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. 

Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.

jobDescription:
Caylent is a cloud native services company that helps organizations bring the best out of their people and technology using Amazon Web Services (AWS.) We provide a full-range of AWS services including: workload migrations & modernization, cloud native application development, DevOps, data engineering, security & compliance and everything in between.At Caylent, our people always come first.
We are a fully remote global company with employees in Canada, the United States and Latin America. We celebrate the culture of each of our team members and foster a community of technological curiosity. Come talk to us to learn more about what it means to be a Caylien!
The Mission
At Caylent, a Data Engineer works as an integral part of a cross-functional delivery team to implement data management solutions on the AWS cloud for our customers. You will work in a hands-on capacity to define RDS data sources, develop ETL jobs and manage data warehouses. You will participate in daily standup meetings with your team and bi-weekly agile ceremonies with the customer. Your manager will have a weekly 1:1 with you to help guide you in your career and make the most of your time at Caylent.
Your Assignment
Work with a team to deliver top-quality data solutions on AWS for customersParticipate in and contribute to daily standup meetingsDevelop ETL and analytics solutions around relational databasesImplement security, access controls and governance on cloud
Your Qualifications Develop and implement at least two of these:ETL, Orchestration and CI/CD pipelinesSQL, Stored procedures and Query optimizationAnalytics and visualizationMDM and Data GovernanceFamiliar or experienced with one or more of these on AWS:High Availability (HA) solutions, read/write replicas and optimizationRDS and Aurora performance tuningLarge scale application migration and modernization with a heavy focus on DBSecurity, access controls and governance on cloudExcellent understanding of Data Warehouses, RDBMSs like Redshift, Snowflake, Postgres, MySQLExperience with IaC tools such as CloudFormation, CDK, Terraform, and CI/CD toolsExperience with AWS Glue, Lambda, SDKExcellent written and verbal communication skills
Benefits
100% remote workEquitable Life - Hybrid Plan100% Premium Coverage for the employee and dependentsLong-Term Disability4% Pension match (employer contribution)Unlimited VacationsSick Leave Paid Holidays Parental LeavePaid for exams and certificationsPeer bonus awardsState of the art laptop and toolsEquipment & Office StipendIndividual professional development planAnnual stipend for Learning and DevelopmentWork with an amazing worldwide team and in an incredible corporate culture
Caylent is a place where everyone belongs. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our approach helps us to build a winning team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. So, regardless of how your diversity expresses itself, you can find a home here at Caylent.
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, genetic information, disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at hr@caylent.com.
companyDescription: Caylent is a cloud native services company that helps organizations bring the best out of their people and technology using AWS. We are living in a software-defined world where technology is at the core of every business. To thrive in this paradigm, organizations need to empower their people and processes through technology. Caylent is uniquely positioned to fuel that engine of innovation by bringing ambitious ideas to life for our customers.

jobDescription:
Alberta Blue Cross® is an Alberta based organization dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting wellness. We believe in what we do—and place trust in our employees to deliver our vision.

Working at Alberta Blue Cross® means having a career where you’ll be recognized for your contributions. We value diversity, encourage our employees to maintain a healthy work-life balance and provide opportunities for career growth.

OVERVIEW:

Alberta Blue Cross® has an immediate opening for a results-driven self-starter who can research, start, and complete initiatives on their own, coordinate with numerous stakeholder departments, and provide the Manager of Group Member Support with key updates and results. This Member Journey Specialist position will be responsible for successfully organizing and implementing initiatives that either align with Alberta Blue Cross® corporate and departmental projects, or otherwise help Alberta Blue Cross® successfully realize its goals for corporate strategy, operations, social purpose, customer experience, and wellness. The successful candidate will work under the Group Division, and collaborate with many other departments around the organization, ensuring tasks, projects, etc. are completed in an efficient and timely manner. The team’s initiatives are typically related to enhancing our Group members experience and their benefit plans, but may also relate to individual benefits plans, government-sponsored plans, or other business or administration channels within the organization.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Work on various corporate projects and department initiatives.Conduct research, implement changes, run projects, and report on status.Work directly with our group members and dependents to provide benefit insight.Work directly with individuals regarding survivor benefits.Identify areas of opportunity within existing business practices and user platforms.Utilizing Voice of Customer thinking, identifying opportunity to enhance member touchpoints.Summarize findings and suggest recommendations in written and verbal form.Work closely with project teams to identify and manage impacts of systems changes to business processes and resourcing.Drive various projects, such as the introduction of specific operational changes, legislative research, operational process reviews, reporting, and much more.Complete other tasks as assigned by the Manager of Group Initiatives & Innovation.

WHAT YOU WILL HAVE:
Minimum of three years’ experience in a corporate environment.2+ years of leadership experience would be considered a strong asset.Minimum of two years’ experience in business enablement or similar type role.A post-secondary degree or diploma would be considered an asset.Project Management/ Coordination designation(s) and/or experience considered an asset.Strong knowledge of group benefits plans, contracts, systems, and processes would be an asset.Experience in benefit management, particularly life benefits, would be a strong asset.Experience in business growth would be considered a strong assetExperience in customer journey mapping.Outstanding interpersonal skills.Outstanding communication skills – listening, written and verbal.Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and resourcefulness.Ability to work under pressure; meet tight deadlines; and prioritize and manage multiple tasks, projects and deadlines, all without jeopardizing quality.Self-motivation and flexibility.Strong planning and problem-solving skills.Constructive and collaborative attitude, and a strong desire to learn more.High proficiency with Microsoft Office.Strong networking and relationship skills.

This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected.

Alberta Blue Cross® is an inclusive employer committed to a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We empower and are advocates for our employees by welcoming, respecting and valuing their unique perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in an innovative, high-energy team-focused environment. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please apply.
companyDescription:
We believe that people, workplaces and communities deserve to be and live well—and we can help. As a benefits provider and wellness leader, we have the opportunity to play an important role in fostering the health and well-being of our customers across their lifetimes.

We provide benefits to more than 1.8 million Albertans through group, government and individual plans. Alberta-based, not-for-profit, wellness-driven, customer committed.

Living our values

Integrity and trust

We are respectful, ethical, honest and inclusive in all that we do.

Wellness and flexibility
