Customer committed

We are accountable and committed to our customers and passionate in the delivery of an exceptional customer experience.

Empowering potential

We support learning and growth while fostering a diverse environment that cultivates collaboration and innovation.

jobDescription:
Job Description

RECRUITING FOR THE FUTURE

This posting is for a future job opportunity.

To support the needs of our clients, Avanade is actively recruiting and interviewing for the role outlined below, as we continue to build on another year of growth in our business. Now, with more than 60,000 employees around the globe, we are positioning our organization to effectively prepare for the future. What does this mean for you? We encourage you to apply and interview for this role without the need to decide now. This allows you to connect with leaders and hiring managers at a pace that works for you and when roles become available, you will be the first to know.

Cloud Engineer

We are a Microsoft Partner and Consulting company. We help our customers do all things Azure Cloud. As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, you will work with our clients and participate in the development and deployment of enterprise scale Azure Cloud solutions. The type of projects you would participate in could include:

 The creation of cloud foundations Design and deployment of net-new cloud native solutions Migration and modernization of existing workloads Enabling organization transformation to a cloud-first model

Doing Cloud transformation at this scale requires you to be knowledgeable in public cloud in general and Microsoft Azure in particular.

A day in the life can include:

 Work in partnership with clients, helping them understand how to use cloud technology to meet their business objectives Communicate and interact with project leads and technical stakeholders Provide leadership where appropriate to technical implementation workstreams Deliver at a consistently high standard Able and willing to be hands on when required Provide assistance with technical issues, escalations and resolution Provide a good experience to your teammates and to our customers

What you need to know:

 3 years of IT experience in Infrastructure area including Senior Support capacity General technical understanding of cloud platforms and supporting technologies Strong experience with a business audience in either project or high level support capacity Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences effectively and clearly Technical experience in a major cloud platform, preferably Azure in Public or Private but strong experience to Azure on-prem we always consider Knowledge of Identity and Access management (IAM) software defined networking, security, governance, and compliance Must have prior scripting experience and familiar with dealing with conditional logic, looping and string handling

What we hope you know but are willing to invest and teach:

 Understanding of cloud automation and orchestration tools and techniques including git, terraform, Azure DevOps, ARM Experience in IaC and CaC (Containerization as Code) Any and all of: Jenkins, Ansible, AKS, Docker, etc. 3+ hands on experience in implementing and/or maintaining highly complex cloud environments Experience migrating on-premise workloads to the cloud At least one recognized public cloud technical certification Product experience in more than one public cloud, such as Azure, AWS or Google Cloud is an asset

What we expect:

 Commitment to learn and to invest time to bridge gaps in knowledge Acquire required Azure technical certification (our treat!) Keep up to date with technology trends

About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

jobDescription:
Aha! is a very different type of high-growth SaaS company. We are self-funded, highly profitable, and 100 percent remote. We provide the world's #1 product development software so teams can build products that customers love. More than 600,000 product builders use our suite of tools which includes Aha! Roadmaps , Aha! Ideas , Aha! Create , and Aha! Develop . And they rely on our training programs via Aha! Academy to become product development experts. We are recognized as one of the best fully remote companies to work for, champion the Bootstrap Movement , and have given over $1M to people in need through Aha! Cares . Learn more at www.aha.io .
Our team
Aha! engineering is a mid-sized, fully remote team that is highly productive. We are centered around North American time zones so we can collaborate during the workday.
We help each other grow: We each bring unique skills to the table and want our teammates to feel valued from the start. Our onboarding program exposes new hires to the codebase and lets them contribute right away. We move quickly: We ship code multiple times a day. We believe in getting valuable features in front of customers and iteratively improving as we learn what works and what does not. We value product over process: We want the team to have the time and focus on solving complex challenges. We minimize the overhead by setting clear goals and avoiding heavyweight processes and excessive meetings.We share knowledge freely: We share our learnings with each other and with the developer community. Our engineering blog demonstrates how we tackle interesting challenges at Aha! We enjoy: We like what we do. And we want you to love your team and your job too. Learn more about The Responsive Method , our company values , and the generous benefits we offer.Our technology
Our web application is a single-instance, multi-tenant Ruby on Rails monolith supported by Postgres (database), Redis (background jobs), and memcached (Rails caching). We also run a Node.js webserver to support collaborative editing and real-time updates. Our application is hosted on Amazon Web Services and architected with ECS for reproducibility and scalability.
We utilize a growing amount of React on the front end to build rich client-side experiences, including our fully collaborative text editor and our slide presentation editor. We balance the strengths of both technologies — Rails for its conventions and simplicity and React for more powerful interactive functionality.
We embrace new technologies that help us deliver a lovable product, but we also remain cognizant of the maintenance overhead that a new library or platform brings. We solve the problems in front of us rather than prematurely optimizing to address issues that may never materialize.
We do most of our planning and collaboration in Aha! Roadmaps and built Aha! Develop so that software engineers and their teams could take advantage of those same rich features. We use Slack and Zoom for video calls. (Email? Rarely.)
Your Experience
Most of our features involve writing significant Ruby on Rails code, so you should have experience working in a Rails codebase. We also write a lot of React but we are happy to help you learn that part on the job.
You Also Have The Below Experience And Skills
We believe that being a kind person who elevates the rest of the team is just as valuable as writing great code. You have strong problem-solving skills and experience working on important functionality for a cloud-based product. You are humble, eager to learn, and always willing to help others. You want teammates who enjoy solving problems regardless of the technologies and techniques involved. You have worked at meaningful scale before and want to do so again.
2+ years of experience working in Ruby on RailsExperience producing scalable, efficient, and maintainable codeExperience building features (ideally at a high-growth SaaS company)Active collaborator with product teamsYour work at Aha!
As a Ruby On Rails Engineer, Your Work Will Include
We work on a broad range of features across the full stack.
Implementing new features for our users, touching each layer of the MVC as neededBuilding deeply interactive reporting interfaces using ReactWorking proactively with product and UX to refine and iterate on specifications as the feature takes shapeInvestigating slow performance and optimizing queries to ensure Aha! is snappy and satisfying to useInterfacing directly with users to quickly squash bugs as part of our regular customer support rotation Documenting components in our style guide to help drive consistency
If this role sounds appealing, we would love to hear from you. (A real human reviews every application.)
Grow with us
Everyone deserves to reach their fullest potential. We know that when we do work that matters with people we care about in a high-growth environment, we feel engaged and alive. And our goal is to help you do just that. We offer all the benefits you would expect and more, including profit sharing. The specific benefits listed below are reflective of what we offer U.S.-based hires. We also do our best to extend identical benefits to international teammates.
The base salary range for this role in the US is between $100,000 and $160,000Cash-based compensation also includes profit sharing and we contribute a percentage of your total pay each month towards your retirementMedical, dental, and vision plans — for many teammates, we cover 100 percent of the premiumsUp to 200 hours of paid time off a year to spend however you want30 to 90 days of paid parental leave and five to 10 days of paid care and bereavement leaveUp to $1,000 annually for third-party education, along with paid time off to immerse yourself in learningVolunteer opportunities throughout the year
Base salary and total compensation are dependent upon many factors, such as: skills, experience, and relevant past roles
companyDescription: Aha! is a very different type of high-growth SaaS company. We are self-funded, highly profitable, and 100 percent remote. We provide the world's #1 product development software so teams can build products that customers love. More than 600,000 product builders use our suite of tools which includes Aha! Roadmaps, Aha! Ideas, Aha! Create, and Aha! Develop. And they rely on our training programs via Aha! Academy to become product development experts. We are recognized as one of the best fully remote companies to work for, champion the Bootstrap Movement, and have given over $1M to people in need through Aha! Cares. Learn more at www.aha.io.

jobDescription:
Full-time permanent position based in Calgary 
About Arcus
With the worldwide shift towards electrification and low-carbon power systems, Arcus is revolutionizing power management. Our AI driven Energy Cost Management platform enables power users and generators alike to plan and optimize operations based on electricity prices, peak demand periods, and electricity market opportunities. With roots as tech start up in Calgary, Arcus is now scaling into global markets, and we are looking for a power market analyst to join our model development team to be part of our accelerated growth.
The Role
We are looking to add an experienced software developer to our team to help us grow our power market data delivery platform into new markets while continuing to modernize our technology stack. Our current technologies in play include REACT, .NET and SQL. This role appeals to full stack developers with a focus on back-end technologies looking to make a real impact on a small team scaling a product offering. 
Technical implementation of application features from idea to code Contributing to the planning and prioritization of product releases 
Your Profile
Experience with agile software development practices Delivering in self-organizing teams with high levels of trust and transparency Experience with teams onboarding and training junior development staff 8+ years delivering software products using a SaaS model Working knowledge of REACT Deep knowledge of .NET languages and servers 
Nice to Have (preferred skills)
Previous work in the energy industry Recent experience with ASP.NET stack IIS system administration experience Expert level SQL knowledge (MSSQL Server) SQLServer administrative experience Recent project experience moving server side rendered web applications to single page applications Microsoft Azure services familiarity and administration Infrastructure development for running automated machine learning models Experience with dev-ops pipelines for automated build and release of code 
Working At Arcus
We are a team of experienced data scientists, electrical engineers, software developers, and market analysts passionate about innovation, efficiencies, and social entrepreneurship. We immerse ourselves around smart people who are inspired to solve hard problems. Arcus offers a supportive work culture that promotes diversity, autonomy and collaboration so that employees can deliver at their best. At Arcus, every team member has an opinion that matters.
What Arcus Can OfferArcus offers a comprehensive compensation package designed to reward short term and long term performance.
Competitive base salary ($110,000 -$130,000 per year)Enticing quarterly bonusEmployee stock options pool Health and wellness benefits3 weeks annual leave
companyDescription:
With the Worldwide shift towards electric and low-carbon power systems, Arcus is revolutionizing efficient and effective power management. Arcus’s predictive analytics SaaS supports customers in Power Generation, Oil & Gas Upstream/Midstream, Mining, Steel, Forestry, Cryptocurrency, Food & Beverage, and Municipalities to reduce operating costs, monetize cost centers, achieve environmental targets and improve grid efficiencies. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada’s energy capital, Arcus has created a technology with Global potential. 

Arcus applies domain expertise to augment AI models for dynamic energy and emission cost management.  Over the past five years, Arcus Power has successfully modelled Canada’s deregulated electricity markets, establishing an impressive track record of accuracy and an ability to widely communicate its insights through software to a diverse range of customers.

jobDescription:
We currently have a full time opportunity for: ASSOCIATE PRODUCT MANAGER/PRODUCT MANAGERCanada Remote or Hybrid Calgary (Head office: Calgary, Alberta, Canada)  WHO WE AREProvision’s purpose is to drive continuous improvement in the health and sustainability of the food supply chain. Our customers are passionate about delivering safe, high-quality food to the world, and so are we. Our SaaS product helps small family run farms, distributed farm networks, produce packers, food manufacturers, cold transporters, and everyone in between, manage, evolve, and leverage the data from their food safety and quality programs. Our days are focused on providing exceptional quality and service to some familiar brands, from the honey in your tea, favorite cinnamon buns and breads, delicious meal prep kits to the fresh produce you just picked up from the grocery store or farmer’s market.
We thrive on open communication and encourage everyone to be curious about all areas of our business, whether that is about our customers, what other teams are up to, how we prioritize our work or what’s going on with sales pipeline. We are diverse in our skills and our backgrounds. Our leadership team is made up of tech industry and agriculture veterans who thrive on learning, building cool things and constantly searching for opportunities to improve how the world works and how we work within it. Our growth minded team currently headquartered in Calgary as well as fully remote in, Vancouver, Grand Rapids, Toronto, Denver, & Sao Paulo. WHO YOU AREYou are a Product Manager or have relevant experience, a product mindset, and a desire to grow your product management skills. You may even have some great product book recommendations. You love to speak to customers directly and are continually looking for ways to better understand their worlds, their pain points and what they find valuable. You are analytical and can use data to validate direction and/or measure the success of the product and your impact. You’ve likely sliced and diced data in ways that others have never considered and used your analysis to find an opportunity. You’ve never said “because we’ve always done it this way” as a means of deciding between two paths. You love tech and have a list of favorites that have made your life better. You have 4+ years of successes and failures behind you in business, data analysis or technology. You leverage this experience to:· Communicate effectively with your team and stakeholders· Challenge status quo· Champion best-practice· Drive continuous improvement· Collaborate without ego to solve problems· Identify potential risks or collisions Bonus if you find Food-Tech interesting or you just really love food! SERIOUS BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE· Experience with and passion for user experience design or research· Have worked with an agile development team (and the tools that help facilitate product development)· Have worked in a SaaS company RESPONSIBILITIES· Ideate, test, and execute on core features of our food safety and quality platform.· Conduct in-depth user research and think critically about how to solve for our customers’ pain points.· Run analyses on qualitative and quantitative data to gain insights and identify opportunities to improve the user journey.· Prioritize opportunities to align to business outcomes and ROI.· Partner with engineers, data scientists, designers, customers, client success, sales, and marketing to deliver exceptional user experience. o Create problem documents and epics that clearly describe the problem to be solved for the customer and the impact to the business. o Work with your engineering and design team to define success and a plan to measure progress. o Provide clear visibility to stakeholders into the value and progress against goals for your workstream. o Develop go-to market plans with the product team, client success and marketing to achieve business and customer outcomes effectively.· Work closely with the Head of Product and Design to ideate strategy, quarterly goals and drive towards the product vision. WORK-LIFE AND LIFE· Work hybrid if you are in Calgary, flex between working from home or joining us in our open concept office (a historic brick loft in Inglewood) o Take advantage of the free parking· Take care of your Health, Dental and Vision plus basic benefits· 15 Vacation Days· Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) eligible based on performance.· Choose your device type (some of us are Mac people, some of us just want to PC)· Have some fun getting to know your coworkers through company events and socials, both virtually and in person (you will learn to like darts, most of us are just as surprised about this as you may be)· Casual dress in the office  We appreciate the interest of all candidates, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
companyDescription: Provision makes cloud software to streamline food safety and QA. Clients can build simple digital templates that expedite recordkeeping, with automatic schedules, rules, and alerts that increase compliance. All food safety and quality data is centralized in one hub with automatic history and customizable reporting. This makes it faster to complete audits, and easier to analyze processes.

J.D. Power is a global leader in consumer insights, advisory services and data and analytics. A pioneer in the use of big data, artificial intelligence (AI) and algorithmic modeling capabilities to understand consumer behavior, J.D. Power has been delivering incisive industry intelligence on customer interactions with brands and products for more than 50 years. The world's leading businesses across major industries rely on J.D. Power to guide their customer-facing strategies.

Company Mission

J.D. Power is clear about what we do to ensure our success into the future. We unite industry leading data and insights with world-class technology to solve our clients’ toughest challenges.

Our Values

At J.D. Power, we strive to be Truth Finders, Change Makers and Team Driven - the distinct behaviors that, together, define our unique culture.

Truth Finders - At J.D. Power, we are proud of the unbiased data and findings we provide. As individuals, each and every member of our team is dedicated to living this same objectivity and embodying the highest ethical and professional standards – the only ‘favorite’ we have is the truth.

Change Makers - At J.D. Power, we never stand still. We constantly seek better ways – innovating and evolving in everything we do to support our colleagues and our clients alike – and all in service of delivering data and insights that drive meaningful business impact.

Team Driven - At J.D. Power, we are one team and we are activated. Regardless of individual role, every member of our team is dedicated to supporting their immediate colleagues and our broader J.D. Power family to deliver on our collective purpose and make us greater than the sum of our parts. At J.D. Power, these values are more than words. We bring these values to life throughout our organization through our employee event series — J.D. Power Values Days. Each quarter, we celebrate one of our core values and hold an annual event to celebrate our combined values at the end of the year.

We are dedicated to leveraging comprehensive and equitable practices which contribute to the overall success of the company and its employees. We invite you to learn more about our DE&I efforts.

J.D. Power is an equal opportunity employer and compliant with AODA/ADA legislation. If you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please specify.

To all recruitment agencies: J.D. Power does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

For Internal Use- and #remote and #NAMER

Power quality and satisfaction measurements are based on responses from millions of consumers annually, resulting in actionable tools and insights to help the firm's clients better serve their customers and be more profitable.

jobDescription:
Who We Are:
Like our country, ATCO Frontec is built on a Frontier Spirit of being agile, robust, ready to go to the most challenging places and push the boundaries. Do YOU have the Frontier Spirit? If the answer is yes, you should probably work with us.
 
Description:
ATCO Frontec is seeking a Project Manager to join our ATCO Facility Solutions team in Calgary, AB. The Project Manager is responsible all personnel, contract management, logistics, work management and administrative matters related directly to the Alberta DCC Building Maintenance Program. The focus and attention are directed towards meeting of all contract requirements, to ensure continued customer satisfaction and attainment of the organization's business planning and financial targets.
 
Where We Work and Live:
This position will be based in Calgary with regular travel required to our various project locations.
 
Responsibilities:
Provides direction and leadership for the team as a coach and mentor by establishing a positive team environment based on respect, quality, teamwork, inclusiveness and compassion by defining accountabilities of team while directing and supporting the overall goals of the departments and maintaining staff with the appropriate skills and competencies to meet organizational and departmental objectives.Ensures, through succession planning and training, the continuous development of a high performing skilled team.Establishes and maintains a safety culture in the organization through visible leadership by example and ensures training, documentation, personal protective equipment and procedures are available and applied. Encourages initiative and leadership in all aspects of safetyManage project expenses and revenues to achieve target business plan results including, financial, operational, and safety results.Manage the review and preparation of contract amendments in order to meet the organizations goals and objectivesPrioritize work in partnership with the North region and South region maintenance teamsEnsuring operational conformance with all legislated and policy guidelines including compliance with the Code of Ethics and Affiliate Code of Conduct. 
Qualifications:
The successful candidate should have 8 or more years of industry experience in a supervisory and maintenance management roleFormal education in one or more of the following areas would be considered an asset: FMP, engineering degree, or Business Degree.The successful candidate will have exceptional leadership skills, and experience in a union environment is considered an asset.Strong trade background with experience in estimating, project management and construction.Strong computer/technology skills (word, project, excel, adobe, access, mobile apps, maintenance management software)Experience with the implementation and maintenance of a Quality System is considered an asset.Strong communication skills (verbal, written, email) both with external and internal clients 
 
We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.
 
Final candidates will be required to undergo a Government Security Clearance Check.
 
Collection, use, and retention of personal information will be in accordance with ATCO Group privacy policies and practices.
 
By submitting your resume and personal information to the ATCO Group of Companies, and/or participating in a personal interview, you acknowledge and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the ATCO Group of Companies to determine your suitability for employment opportunities within the ATCO Group of Companies.
companyDescription:
ATCO Frontec started as a greenfield​ initiative, whose name stood for Frontier Technologies. The company was formed in 1986 to supply technical expertise and logistical support in northern Canada, and has become a world-class facilities management and technical services company.

We specialize in operational support services, facilities management, logistics and consulting, remote site turn-key accommodation and disaster and emergency management solutions.  We support companies in the resource sector, as well as government and military operations, with innovative power generation solutions, water/wastewater systems, hazardous waste services, airfield operations and first responder services. We can rapidly deploy equipment, supplies, personnel and management anytime, anywhere.

Over ATCO’s 70-year history, we have worked in 100 countries around the world. Our Frontec International division is based in Budapest. We find innovative solutions to the issues of the world’s most demanding projects in challenging locations.

jobDescription:
Company Description
We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.
IBI Group is now proudly a part of Arcadis. Together, we are committed to improving the quality of life for our clients, people, partners and the communities we all serve.
Job Description
Arcadis IBI Group is calling on recent and Spring 2022 Architectural graduates, OR Architectural Technologists with 1-2 years of post-graduation architectural experience to join our busy and growing Architectural practice in Western Canada. You will have the opportunity to work with offices and projects across Alberta and British Columbia. As a member of our multi-disciplinary team, you will collaborate with design and technical leadership and be an integral part of project teams. As part of our Living+ Studio, you will be involved in high-rise residential and mixed-use projects and have an impact on the urban environment.
These job opportunities are available in Vancouver, Kelowna, Calgary or Edmonton.
Most of the things you’ll work on:
Contribute to the design process by utilizing various software platforms in addition to REVIT such as, the Adobe Creative Suite, AutoCAD, Rhino, Sketch-up, Enscape, and GrasshopperProduce architectural design packagesPrepare conceptual design packages and follow through to working drawingProduce graphics materials and images for client and City presentationsAssist in product researchAttend in-house project team meetingsPrepare meeting minutes and project schedulesMay perform other duties as required
Qualifications
You'll need to have:
Master’s degree in Architecture and/or a recognized university by the AIBC or AAA with some related experience OR Diploma in Architectural Technology with at least 1-2 years of post-graduation architectural experienceStrong creative design portfolio is essential as are strong communication, teamwork, presentation, graphics, organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projectsProficiency with BIM applications specifically REVIT experience requiredProficient in AutoCAD, SketchUp, Enscape, Photoshop, InDesign and various graphic softwareProficient in Rhino and Grasshopper is an assetParametric design skill is an asset
Additional Information
Our employees will find a design environment where collaboration is at the core of the business. We proudly support our team members through continuing education, completion of licenses and certifications, memberships in professional societies, seminar and conference attendance.
Competitive Base Salary based on industry standardsRobust Extended + Medical BenefitsParticipation in Incentives ProgramRemote Work Options or Hybrid WFH-Office ScheduleCoverage of Licensing Fees and Annual Dues to Professional AssociationsProfessional Development & Self Directed Learning Resources
We request applicants submit RESUME highlighting relevant work experience; please limit PDF files to 10MB. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

companyDescription:
IBI Group is a technology-driven design firm with global architecture, engineering, planning and technology expertise. We work across disciplines to define the cities of tomorrow through intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure, shaping the way people live, move, learn and heal. With more than 3,500 employees and 60+ offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally. 

On September 27, 2022, IBI Group joined Arcadis, a global leader in the delivery of sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. Together, with passionate thinkers, designers and engineers across 70 countries, the combined strength of Arcadis IBI Group provides unprecedented opportunities to offer new client solutions, while defining the cities of tomorrow, together. Our digitally-driven expertise will transform our industries and provide our clients with innovative, future-focused technology-enabled solutions alongside human-centric design excellence. Together, we’re a stronger and more resilient business, committed to improving the quality of life for our clients, people and partners and the communities we all serve.

jobDescription:
Job Description

Do you enjoy connecting people with technology? So do we. 

We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our growing Digital Experience team. 

As a Microsoft Modernization Developer, you focus will be on crafting, developing, and testing critical enterprise solutions. You will work on new software development projects and maintain existing application hen required You will bring your experience building SPFx applications for Microsoft Teams and SharePoint to help guide junior developers and share your knowledge with others. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide-ranging, high profile customer base across many exciting and challenging projects. This position develops and tests enterprise solutions. 

You know how the right software solutions can help businesses do more with less effort. You know your code and enjoy putting innovation to work in real applications and getting measurable results. This is the role that you know will steer your professional career in the right direction. 

Day To Day Responsibilities

 Design, develop and deploy SPFx apps that extend Microsoft Teams and SharePoint  Collaborate in all the different project phases, from defining technical, operational and user requirements, through to planning, quality control and testing  Leverage modern out-of-the-box user interface components in combination with SharePoint Framework to achieve the desired business solutions  Document architectures, tools utilized, and approaches  Create technical and functional/end-user operational documentation for the applications  Provide technical insight, recommendations, best practices, and alternatives analysis based on your knowledge and experience of Microsoft collaboration tools  Effectively research and understand emerging and up-to-date practices, as you will be working on new & evolving Microsoft technologies  Partner with global technical teams, acting as a bridge to clients or more senior Service Delivery team members  Develop junior teammates’ technical skills by providing direction and reviewing code 

Technical And Non-technical Skills

 Hands-on experience building SPFx solutions using React, Node.js, and VS Code  Familiarity with SPFx development tools and libraries (PnP, node, npm, yeoman)  Web development skills such as JavaScript, Typescript, React, REST API, and .NET  Understanding of how to integrate with Microsoft Graph API and Azure AD/AAD B2C  Experience with Teams bots, workflows, messaging extensions, connectors, and webhooks  Understanding of UI/UX principles and experience with Fluent UI or Office UI Fabric JS  Ability to manage source code and versioning, automatic build, testing, and deployment processes  Familiarity with other core Microsoft technologies such as SharePoint and Dataverse  Experience with Azure Communication Services is an added advantage  Demonstrated excellence in communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both verbally and in written form  Ability to work in teams and individually when needed, including global teams  Experience working with large scale production environments requiring minimal downtime  Strong critical thinking skills and the ability to analyze and solve problems with limited information, oversight, or direction from leadership 

About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

jobDescription:
Aha! is a very different type of high-growth SaaS company. We are self-funded, highly profitable, and 100 percent remote. We provide the world's #1 product development software so teams can build products that customers love. More than 600,000 product builders use our suite of tools which includes Aha! Roadmaps , Aha! Ideas , Aha! Create , and Aha! Develop . And they rely on our training programs via Aha! Academy to become product development experts. We are recognized as one of the best fully remote companies to work for, champion the Bootstrap Movement , and have given over $1M to people in need through Aha! Cares . Learn more at www.aha.io .
Our team
Aha! engineering is a mid-sized, fully remote team that is highly productive. We are centered around North American time zones so we can collaborate during the workday.
We help each other grow: We each bring unique skills to the table and want our teammates to feel valued from the start. Our onboarding program exposes new hires to the codebase and lets them contribute right away. We move quickly: We ship code multiple times a day. We believe in getting valuable features in front of customers and iteratively improving as we learn what works and what does not. We value product over process: We want the team to have the time and focus on solving complex challenges. We minimize the overhead by setting clear goals and avoiding heavyweight processes and excessive meetings.We share knowledge freely: We share our learnings with each other and with the developer community. Our engineering blog demonstrates how we tackle interesting challenges at Aha! We enjoy: We like what we do. And we want you to love your team and your job too. Learn more about The Responsive Method , our company values , and the generous benefits we offer.Our technology
Our web application is a single-instance, multi-tenant Ruby on Rails monolith supported by Postgres (database), Redis (background jobs), and memcached (Rails caching). We also run a Node.js webserver to support collaborative editing and real-time updates. Our application is hosted on Amazon Web Services and architected with ECS for reproducibility and scalability.
We utilize a growing amount of React on the front end to build rich client-side experiences, including our fully collaborative text editor and our slide presentation editor. We balance the strengths of both technologies — Rails for its conventions and simplicity and React for more powerful interactive functionality.
We embrace new technologies that help us deliver a lovable product, but we also remain cognizant of the maintenance overhead that a new library or platform brings. We solve the problems in front of us rather than prematurely optimizing to address issues that may never materialize.
We do most of our planning and collaboration in Aha! Roadmaps and built Aha! Develop so that software engineers and their teams could take advantage of those same rich features. We use Slack and Zoom for video calls. (Email? Rarely.)
Your Experience
Most of our features involve writing significant Ruby on Rails code, so you should have experience working in a Rails codebase. We also write a lot of React but we are happy to help you learn that part on the job.
You Also Have The Below Experience And Skills
We believe that being a kind person who elevates the rest of the team is just as valuable as writing great code. You have strong problem-solving skills and experience working on important functionality for a cloud-based product. You are humble, eager to learn, and always willing to help others. You want teammates who enjoy solving problems regardless of the technologies and techniques involved. You have worked at meaningful scale before and want to do so again.
2+ years of experience working in Ruby on RailsExperience producing scalable, efficient, and maintainable codeExperience building features (ideally at a high-growth SaaS company)Active collaborator with product teamsYour work at Aha!
As a Ruby On Rails Engineer, Your Work Will Include
We work on a broad range of features across the full stack.
Implementing new features for our users, touching each layer of the MVC as neededBuilding deeply interactive reporting interfaces using ReactWorking proactively with product and UX to refine and iterate on specifications as the feature takes shapeInvestigating slow performance and optimizing queries to ensure Aha! is snappy and satisfying to useInterfacing directly with users to quickly squash bugs as part of our regular customer support rotation Documenting components in our style guide to help drive consistency
If this role sounds appealing, we would love to hear from you. (A real human reviews every application.)
Grow with us
Everyone deserves to reach their fullest potential. We know that when we do work that matters with people we care about in a high-growth environment, we feel engaged and alive. And our goal is to help you do just that. We offer all the benefits you would expect and more, including profit sharing. The specific benefits listed below are reflective of what we offer U.S.-based hires. We also do our best to extend identical benefits to international teammates.
The base salary range for this role in the US is between $100,000 and $160,000Cash-based compensation also includes profit sharing and we contribute a percentage of your total pay each month towards your retirementMedical, dental, and vision plans — for many teammates, we cover 100 percent of the premiumsUp to 200 hours of paid time off a year to spend however you want30 to 90 days of paid parental leave and five to 10 days of paid care and bereavement leaveUp to $1,000 annually for third-party education, along with paid time off to immerse yourself in learningVolunteer opportunities throughout the year
Base salary and total compensation are dependent upon many factors, such as: skills, experience, and relevant past roles

jobDescription:
About You
You want to work for a fast-paced company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You have a strong sense of personal ownership and responsibility for completion of objectives on time. You want to figure out why things tick which makes you tick but very little ticks you off. You want to think outside of the box and continually challenge your own limits, as well as those around you. You have a mad scientist mentality where you want to be part of the robots building robots revolution.
About Attabotics
Attabotics is the world’s first 3D robotics supply chain system for modern commerce. Inspired by the framework of ant colonies, Attabotics replaces the rows and aisles of traditional fulfillment centers with a patented storage structure and robotics shuttles that utilize both horizontal and vertical space, reducing a company’s warehouse needs by 85%. By empowering retailers to place fulfillment centers near high-density urban areas, Attabotics helps create jobs and decrease carbon emissions by closing the last-mile delivery gap. A TIME Magazine Most Innovative Company special mention, CNBC Disruptor, and one of Fast Company’s world’s 50 most innovative companies. Attabotics has been adopted by major brands including luxury department store Nordstrom, and other retailers across apparel, grocery, food & beverage, and home goods. Attabotics is based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, with fulfillment centers across the United States and Canada.
The Role
As a System Test Automation Developer/Specialist you will have a critical role on the system test team in developing test automation for our warehouse fulfillment system. We will rely on your attention to detail and excellent documentation skills to describe problems and identify risks/quality issues for our robotic system design. Test planning and execution will be a big part of your day along with collaborating with the product development team to understand new features and tests required.
Who You Are
Degree in Mechatronics Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical, or related field preferred Strong coding background and experience in developing test automation for both hardware and software components using Python or C#.Minimum of 5+ years of experience in a testing role both manual and automated.Strong ability to identify, record, document, and track development issuesExperience in preparing and executing test plans and proactively identifying areas for additional testing based on the deployment objectivesAbility to understand and work with electro-mechanical systems, basic understanding of motors & roboticsSoft skills that include strong written and oral communication, time management, self-direction, and organization
What We Need
Contributions to a system test suite that includes software, robotics, UI, and other various hardwareCreating test cases, test suites, & documentation to show that the design meets expectations and validating behaviour at a system levelPerforming regression testing to ensure existing functionality works as expectedWriting test automation; knowledge of SpecFlow, BDD and C# are strong assets.Installing software, configuration of systems, creation of field facing documentationOperation of the Attabotics system which includes interacting with robotics, troubleshooting problems, and performing minor repairsWork collaboratively across the organization, including engagement with the development team, project management team, and the customer facing teamOpportunities exist for task scripting, developing reports for metrics, data analysis
If this description describes you perfectly and the work environment you know you can thrive in, send us your resume as well as describe to us what you’re passionate about and we may just reach out to you.
Attabotics is committed to employing the best people to do the best job possible within our environment. We hire based on merit and are strongly committed to cultivating diversity as a source of excellence. Attabotics firmly believes that a vast array of perspectives produces and promotes innovation and business success. Our corporate diversity encompasses differences in ethnicity, gender identity or expression, language, age, sexual orientation, religion, socio-economic status, physical and mental ability and education.
Attabotics promotes a corporate safety culture where employees’ health, safety & well being is number one and with the ultimate goal of establishing a zero incident work environment.
Attabotics is aware of false advertisement of our postings, which may include compensation information. These are fraudulent sites and should not be trusted. For a current listing of all our postings, and the only legitimate location to apply, please visit.
https://jobs.lever.co/attabotics
companyDescription:
Attabotics provides an intelligent cube storage solution to meet the ever-changing fulfillment needs of modern customers and modern commerce. The company was founded in 2016 and is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, with over 300 employees from all over the world.
Attabotics’ future-proof warehouse storage system is a complete solution made to last as the nature of commerce evolves. We have created a complete, fully 3D solution with storage and picking stations – the Atta Studio – and robot shuttles that can access any bin without having to reshuffle the system.

jobDescription:
Chez EY, vous aurez l’occasion de bâtir une carrière aussi unique que vous l’êtes. Et grâce au volet mondial, au soutien, à la culture inclusive et à la technologie, vous pourrez devenir la meilleure version de vous-mêmes. Nous comptons sur votre voix et votre point de vue uniques pour aider EY à devenir encore meilleure également. Joignez-vous à nous et créez une expérience exceptionnelle pour vous-mêmes et un monde meilleur pour tous.
En tenant compte de l’évolution rapide de l’environnement professionnel, vous collaborerez avec les responsables de mandats et tirerez parti de notre large éventail de compétences et de perspectives pour améliorer le rôle et l’efficacité de la fonction finances. Nous sommes à la recherche de développeurs de plateforme OneStream EPM pour se joindre à notre équipe Gestion de la performance de l’entreprise. Vous aiderez les clients à améliorer la performance de leur entreprise et de la fonction finances interne en mettant l’accent sur la prestation de services-conseils qui visent à dégager des avantages mesurables sur le plan de l’efficacité opérationnelle et de la prise de décisions stratégiques.
La possibilité
À titre de membre de l’équipe Gestion de la performance de l’entreprise du groupe Consultation – Entreprises, vous aurez l’occasion de travailler auprès de leaders des finances afin d’optimiser leurs fonctions relatives à la finance.
Nous aidons les organisations à réaliser l’alignement stratégique de leur fonction finances, à mettre en œuvre des initiatives d’amélioration des services et de réduction des coûts, et à intégrer un processus et une culture de gestion de la performance qui unit l’entreprise autour de ses objectifs fondamentaux.
Dans le cadre de votre poste lié à la transformation de la fonction finances, vous participerez activement à des mandats touchant les domaines d’expertise suivants :
Stratégie et feuille de route de la transformation de la fonction financesClôture et consolidations des états financiersPlanification et analyse financières, excellence du contrôle et rapports de gestionModèle opérationnel de la fonction financesAmélioration des processus des fonctions finances et comptabilitéServices partagés mondiaux, dont les centres de services partagés et l’impartition
Vos principales responsabilités
Vous serez appelé à établir des relations tant à l’interne qu’à l’externe ainsi qu’à cultiver et renforcer celles-ci. Vous participerez activement à l’amélioration de l’efficacité opérationnelle des projets et des initiatives internes. Dans le cadre de notre engagement envers la qualité, vous mènerez à bien des projets et vous vous assurerez de la haute qualité du travail. Vous devez être disponible pour effectuer des déplacements à court préavis afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Les déplacements représentent environ 50 % du temps.
Responsabilités à l’égard du client
Posséder des connaissances techniques en implantation de logiciels, notamment des activités touchant aux domaines suivants : mappage de données, validation de conversion, configuration de la sécurité et de systèmes, tests d’intégration du système et tests d’acceptation utilisateurPosséder une compréhension approfondie des dimensions standards de OneStream, notamment la capacité d’écrire des règles d’entreprise pour la consolidation et la planification dans les applications OneStreamDévelopper des flux de données entrants et sortants depuis et vers les applications OneStream, des rapports et des rapports de planification destinés aux utilisateurs finaux dans Quick View, ainsi que du matériel de formation et de la documentation pour les utilisateurs finaux à l’appui de l’adoptionDévelopper des schémas et des modèles de données afin d’organiser et de transformer les éléments de données pour ensuite les intégrer à des modèles et des rapports, qui ont pour but d’appuyer les clients dans leurs activités de validation des donnéesSoutenir l’architecte de solutions ou les gestionnaires de projet dans le maintien du bon déroulement de l’implantation – notamment gérer les aspects financiers des mandats en structurant la dotation, en assurant le suivi des frais et en informant les chefs de projet de la survenue de problèmesExpliquer les implications techniques et commerciales aux membres du personnel du client, par exemple les avantages et inconvénients des différentes options de modélisation ainsi que les approches inhérentes à celles-ciParticiper à des initiatives de développement des affaires et établir des relations solides au sein du groupe Consultation et d’autres gammes de services d’EYRéaliser des analyses coûts-avantages, des analyses de coûts et des analyses comparatives pour contribuer à l’évaluation de la performance de OneStreamDéterminer les exigences principales de l’entreprise aux fins de l’acquisition d’une application EPM et de la configuration d’applicationsConseiller les clients sur l’optimisation de leurs processus de consolidation, de prévision, de planification, d’établissement de rapports et de budgétisation
Responsabilités à l’égard de la gestion des membres du personnel
Participer aux initiatives liées aux gens, y compris le recrutement, le maintien en poste et la formation des professionnels du groupe finances et gestion de la performanceParticiper à l’orientation technique d’autres développeurs, notamment la formation des membres du personnel d’EY et des clientsMaintenir un programme de formation afin d’assurer le perfectionnement continu des compétences personnelles
Compétences et qualités pour réussir
Capacité à comprendre les processus de planification des activités et de gestion du rendement des clients et les exigences commerciales connexesCapacité à comprendre et à intégrer les environnements informatiques des clients et les technologies existantes dans la conception d’applications (par exemple les règles d’entreprise, les structures de données et les besoins liés aux outils d’extraction, de transformation et de chargement)Capacité à comprendre et à évaluer l’état actuel des processus et des contrôles relatifs au groupe gestion financièreTraduire la conception en plans d’implantation, en échéanciers et en efforts de développement afin de générer des plans de dotation et des calendriers de projet suivant des cycles en mode sprint et la prestation de services agileGérer et soutenir plusieurs projets de clients et possibilités simultanés; capacité à gérer son temps parmi des priorités concurrentes pour l’obtention de résultats optimauxSolides compétences en analyse et en résolution de problèmesExcellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite
Pour être admissible à ce poste, vous devez satisfaire aux exigences suivantes :
Un excellent dossier scolaire, c.-à-d. un baccalauréat et un minimum de 2 années d’expérience dans le secteur ou au sein d’une société d’experts-conseils reconnueTitre ou qualification professionnelle, un atout (diplôme en administration des affaires, en informatique, en ingénierie ou l’équivalent)Au moins deux ou trois années d’expérience dans l’implantation de solutions OneStream couvrant au moins quatre projets en tant que développeurExpérience en migration de systèmes de consolidation sur place comme HFM vers OneStreamConception d’une application OneStream personnalisée en fonction des besoins des clientsExpérience en mise en œuvre de l’élimination des comptes et opérations réciproques, des apports, des calculs de la quote-part des résultats et des calculs des participations ne donnant pas le contrôle dans OneStreamExpérience additionnelle en services-conseils ou au sein du secteur et avec différents outils comme Oracle EPM, Oracle Hyperion, Anaplan, Tagetik ou d’autres plateformes complexes de gestion de la performance de l’entrepriseCapacité à créer des applications OneStream efficaces et efficientes à partir de feuilles de calcul ou d’autres systèmes financiers des clientsSolides aptitudes en relations avec la clientèle et capacité avérée à gérer des mandatsExpertise dans les domaines suivants : clôture et consolidation des états financiers, analyse et planification financière et implantation d’une application de gestion de la performance de l’entreprise
Idéalement, vous avez aussi :
Expertise dans l’un des domaines suivants : rapprochement de comptes, gestion du rendement des ventes (p. ex. planification des quotas et territoires, gestion de la rémunération au rendement), planification des ventes et des opérations ou planification d’affaires intégréeSolide compréhension des défis et solutions se rapportant à l’intégration des donnéesConnaissance approfondie de deux ou trois secteurs (mines, pétrole et gaz, fabrication, vente au détail, haute technologie ou secteur public)Connaissances et expérience dans plusieurs secteurs parmi les suivants : transformation de la fonction finances; clôture et consolidation des états financiers; transformation et amélioration des processus; planification et établissement du budget et de prévisions; évaluation et gestion de la performance; communication d’informations sur la performance de l’entreprise; réduction des coûts; centres de services partagés et impartition des processus d’affaires
Ce que nous recherchons
Nous sommes à la recherche de la prochaine génération de leaders exceptionnels pour poursuivre notre mission. Dans le passé, les membres de notre personnel les plus performants ont fait preuve d’une connaissance approfondie des marchés des services financiers, de solides compétences en analyse et en résolution de problèmes ainsi que d’une capacité à s’adapter et à collaborer dans un contexte changeant. Si vous démontrez un engagement indéfectible à achever des projets dans les délais impartis et sans dépasser le budget, tout en offrant de l’encadrement et de la rétroaction aux membres moins expérimentés de l’équipe, ce rôle est pour vous.
Ce que nous offrons
Nous offrons un programme de rémunération concurrentiel selon lequel vous êtes rémunéré en fonction de votre rendement et qui reconnaît la valeur que vous apportez à l’entreprise. Notre programme de rémunération globale comprend une couverture complète de soins médicaux, de médicaments d’ordonnance et de soins dentaires, un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées, une directive en matière de vacances formidable, ainsi que des journées payées par la Société, les jours fériés et des congés personnels payés (en fonction de la province de résidence), ainsi qu’un éventail de programmes et d’avantages intéressants conçus pour votre bien-être physique, financier et social. Vous bénéficierez également :
De la formation continue : vous acquerrez la mentalité et les compétences nécessaires pour vous préparer à toute éventualité.De la réussite telle que définie par vous : nous vous offrirons les outils et la souplesse dont vous avez besoin pour exercer une réelle influence, à votre manière.D’un leadership transformationnel : nous vous offrirons les connaissances, le coaching et la confiance nécessaires pour devenir un leader de la transformation dont le monde a besoin.D’une culture diversifiée et inclusive : vous serez valorisé pour qui vous êtes et vous utiliserez votre voix pour aider les autres à trouver la leur.
Si vous pouvez affirmer que vous remplissez les critères susmentionnés, communiquez avec nous dès que possible.
L’expérience exceptionnelle d’EY. Il n’en tient qu’à vous.
La diversité et l’inclusivité chez EY
La diversité et l’inclusivité sont au cœur de qui nous sommes et de la façon dont nous travaillons. Nous avons pris l’engagement de favoriser un environnement au sein duquel les différences sont appréciées, les directives et les pratiques sont équitables, et où nos gens éprouvent un sentiment d’appartenance. Comme en témoignent les gestes que nous avons posés pour combattre le racisme systémique, notre appui aux membres de la communauté LGBT+ ainsi que des projets novateurs tels que le Centre d’excellence en neurodiversité et nos initiatives en matière d’accessibilité, nous acceptons et saluons la diversité des expériences, des habiletés, des parcours et des perspectives de nos gens, qui les rend uniques et nous aide à évoluer. Parce que nous croyons que c’est en ayant la liberté d’être fidèles à eux-mêmes au travail que nos gens donneront le meilleur d’eux-mêmes et contribueront à bâtir un monde meilleur.
EY | Travailler ensemble pour un monde meilleur 
La raison d’être d’EY est de bâtir un monde meilleur, de créer de la valeur à long terme pour les clients, les gens et la société et de renforcer la confiance à l’égard des marchés financiers.
S’appuyant sur les données et la technologie, les équipes diversifiées d’EY présentes dans plus de 150 pays instaurent la confiance au moyen de la certification, et aident les clients à prospérer, à se transformer et à exercer leurs activités.
Que ce soit dans les services de certification, de consultation, de stratégie, de fiscalité ou de transactions, ou encore, au sein des services juridiques, les équipes d’EY posent de meilleures questions pour trouver de nouvelles réponses aux enjeux complexes du monde d’aujourd’hui.
companyDescription:
EY exists to build a better working world, helping create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Find out more about the EY global network http://ey.com/en_gl/legal-statement

jobTitle: Chef de projet - Automatisation du bâtiment
jobDescription:
Changez l’avenir avec nous
Nous sommes à la recherche de personnes dévouées et talentueuses qui sont en mesure de relever des défis en constante évolution ainsi que de répondre aux besoins de clients ou aux questions de collègues en appliquant des concepts intelligents et en faisant preuve de créativité. Nous favorisons le changement et travaillons avec des personnes animées par la curiosité qui réinventent l’avenir du travail. Rejoignez-nous et, ensemble, nous nous concentrerons sur ce qui est vraiment important : améliorer la vie avec de nouvelles idées et les plus récentes technologies à l’échelle mondiale.
Pourquoi vous aimerez travailler pour Siemens?
Liberté et conciliation travail-famille : adoptez notre environnement de travail souple et bénéficiez d’un horaire flexible, du télétravail et d’espaces de travail numériquesRésolution de problèmes parmi les plus importants à l’échelle mondiale : prenez part à des projets passionnants et novateursEnvironnement mobilisateur et stimulant qui évolue rapidement et comprend une technologie de fine pointeOccasions de faire progresser votre carrière et de bénéficier de programmes de mentorat à l’échelle locale et mondialeRémunération globale concurrentielleParticipation aux bénéfices possiblePossibilité d’acheter des vacances ou de vendre celles auxquelles vous avez droit, selon votre style de vieContribution à nos initiatives de responsabilité sociale centrées sur l’accès à l’éducation, l’accès à la technologie et le soutien aux communautés, tout en ayant une incidence positive sur la collectivitéParticipation à nos célébrations ainsi qu’à nos événements sociaux et professionnels en dehors des lieux de travailOccasions de partager vos idées novatrices et d’être rémunéré pour celles-ci!Avantages et réductions pour les employésAccent mis sur la diversité et l’inclusivité
Siemens est fière d’avoir été classée huit fois parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada ainsi que d’avoir figuré parmi les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes Canadiens en 2020 et parmi les meilleurs employeurs du Grand Toronto en 2021.
En quoi consistera votre rôle?
Effectuer une surveillance sur place et hors site pour s’assurer que toutes les constructions sont conformes aux règlements en matière de construction et de sécurité.Déplacement / visite dans les régions couvertes par la succursalePasser en revue le projet en profondeur aux fins de la planification des éléments livrables et de l’estimation des coûts.Planifier l’installation, le démarrage, la mise en service, le renouvellement et la garantie.Gérer la marge de revenus et la marge brute pour la réalisation des plans d’affaires mensuels et annuels.Établir des prévisions à l’égard des revenus liés au projet.Surveiller l’état des projets et contrôler les coûts des travaux afin de maintenir les marges.Diriger et superviser l’élaboration des plans de projets, et veiller au respect de ces plans.Diriger la supervision de tous les travaux d’installation et de réajustements, ainsi que le personnel exécutant les tâches assignées.S’assurer que les calendriers sont suivis et que les projets sont exécutés conformément aux documents contractuels et aux attentes des clients.Déterminer les besoins en ressources (p. ex., personnel, outils) et fournir toute la documentation correspondante.Fournir du soutien technique et opérationnel aux équipes de vente; leur fournir notamment la tarification appropriée et la définition de la portée des travaux pour les occasions de projets.Communiquer l’information sur les projets (p. ex., les changements d’équipement) aux employés de l’ingénierie, de l’exploitation et des ventes, au besoin, pour minimiser les coûts et les délais lors des phases d’estimation, d’appel d’offres et de mise en œuvre de chaque projet.Instaurer et entretenir une organisation d’activités efficace vouée à la satisfaction de la clientèle et des employés et à la croissance rentable.Agir comme personne-ressource principale afin d’informer le client de l’achèvement des travaux et des mesures d’atténuation de problèmes.
Ce qu’il vous faudra pour réussir
5+ ans d’expérience en automatisation des bâtiments et matière de technologie de construction de bâtiments, ET au moins 3 à 5 ansainsi l’expérience opérationnelle en gestion et en développement de projetBaccalauréat en génie ou l’équivalent; accreditation ou expérience de travail équivalentePMP (Professionnel en gestion de projet), un atout Hautement préféréTitre divers, dont le titre professionnel d’ingénieur, la certification LEED, le titre CEM, la certification de l’ACAI ou tout autre titre professionnel connexeSolide connaissance des systèmes d’alarme incendie, de sécurité, électriques et mécaniques pour les bâtimentsConnaissance des normes CAN / ULC, des codes canadiens du bâtiment et de l'électricité Familiarité avec Microsoft Project ou un autre logiciel de gestion de projetExcellentes compétences en communication et en présentation et capacité de communiquer avec les entrepreneurs, les conseillers et les cadresAtout: expérience en tant que technicien de terrain
À propos de nous
Nous partageons nos idées et soutenons les personnes derrière celles-ci
Depuis plus de 110 ans, Siemens Canada est synonyme d’excellence en ingénierie, d’innovation, de qualité et de fiabilité. Siemens Canada est un leader technologique qui offre des solutions complètes dans les domaines des infrastructures intelligentes et des industries numériques. Nous faisons de ce qui importe une réalité en établissant des normes par notre façon d’alimenter en électricité, d’automatiser et de numériser le monde qui nous entoure. L’ingéniosité nous stimule, et ce que nous créons ensemble vous appartient.
Nous avons changé les choses ensemble en recueillant 757 000 $ au profit d’œuvres de charité, en soutenant plus de 23 organismes sans but lucratif et en plantant 1 100 arbres dans nos collectivités locales. Siemens Canada compte 2 500 employés et 24 bureaux et installations partout au Canada. Joignez-vous à notre équipe d’environ 293 000 professionnels talentueux dans plus de 190 pays/régions et aidez-nous à relever les défis les plus stimulants pour bâtir un avenir prospère. Alors, qu’attendez-vous? Entamez la prochaine étape de votre carrière avec nous.
Pour en apprendre davantage sur Siemens Canada, veuillez visiter notre site Web au www.siemens.ca.
Toutes les demandes nous intéressent; toutefois, nous communiquerons seulement avec les candidat(e)s sélectionné(e)s.

Entreprise: Siemens Canada Limited
Niveau d'expérience: Expérimenté
Plein temps / Temps partiel: Temps plein
